If you're looking for subpar Italian food and mediocre service go to The Olive Garden - at least there, you know what you're signing up for.

SO I will have to leave a relatively short review for a good reason you'll know after you visit the restaurant. This is a great, unique little family owned restaurant and everything is cooked to perfection. If you're in Seattle, and looking for a unique dining experience, don't look anywhere else. The Horri family puts their heart in this restaurant and you feel it the moment you walk in, must visit!

I have been coming here for almost 20 years, how have I not written a yelp review? This place is nothing short of darling and you are practically guaranteed to have a great experience. The main thing you need to know: no menus. You read that right, there are no menus. Mike, the owner and chef and sweetheart of a human being will come to your table and see what you don't eat. One person doesn't want shellfish? No problem. One person is a vegetarian? No worries. One person doesn't like any kind of seafood or spicy or long pasta or mushrooms? No worries. Mike has you covered. Once that convo has happened, all you need to do at that point is sit back and relax and wait for plate after plate of food to be delivered to you. There will be an appetizer. There will be a salad. And there will be other foods that will blow your mind. And without exaggeration, in the hundred or so times I have eaten here I've never had the same meal twice.
And do not forget to leave room for dessert! Flan, tiramisu, cheesecake, ice cream, cannoli - True to form you never know what you are going to get but it's going to be amazing.
Evening parking directly across the street is plentiful and free. But you might want to walk for a few miles to burn off all of the food you just ate :-)

I've been going to Pasta Freska since 10 years ago and it hasn't really changed much. The decor is very similar if not the same and food tastes like homemade Italian food.
Pasta Freska is a great place to go to when you don't want to think about a menu instead of wanting to go somewhere you can socialize with some friends or a date. I wont describe too much of the experience because many Yelp reviewers already have.
I just have a few notes to make: one time I made reservations via their website. When I was there with a date, a server came up to us and I told them we had reservations. He responded with "Really, are you sure?" as if he couldn't find us. It was weird because I even had text proof that it was booked. He then said "hold on one second" and left. It wasn't until someone else came (I think the owner) that he asked how many we had again and sat us. It was kind of a weird situation.
Then last night, I went there with 3 of my friends who booked via Open Table and we got there at 6:30pm. There was at least 15 people in the front waiting and the host said they were running late and backed up. He didn't check or write anything down. So we got the feeling that we wouldn't be able to get our seats and after waiting a while, we left. The funny thing is, I used Open Table to find some other time tables elsewhere and Pasta Freska was listed with an open table at 7 pm, 7:15 pm. 7:30 pm, etc. which was clearly not going to happen... So I would suggest that you don't trust the reservations here and be prepared to wait. Otherwise come right when they open or on weekdays.

I didn't want to go out to dinner, why? Still stuffed from earlier meals on the road. But a family member was so insistent because it's my birthday.
Drove from Shoreline all the way to Westlake via 99/Dexter. Arrived at 1850 for 1900 reservations. All crammed at front entrance with no one recognizing our presence.
Chef shows up handing out wine to placate the masses. I pass...I did a wine tasting across the sound, I'm good. Ate some amazing food earlier from a Ligurian chef/owner. Really I'm good. You ever see someone "in the weeds"? The entire BOH/FOH. Totally.
30 minutes. Zilch. Nada. Walked out back in the rain. I did call and left voicemail that we left.
I'm sure it would go unnoticed.
Just saying, but resisted saying I told you so.

This was such an epic experience for my daughter and I. The food was incredible but please note... SAVE YOUR BREAD for the delicious sauces that come with every dish. Omg sooo good!!! We did not and regretted that every second of the meal. We had reservations for 5:30 and when we left we passed the huge crowd waiting to get in. Bye Felicia! Did I mention... soooo good

Went with my girlfriend for dinner. Chef comes and asks your likes and dislikes and makes you dishes of his choice. It was a five course meal. Chef was friendly and service was excellent. Food was average.

Great food and overall great experience :) Chef Mike is funny and engaging. I love not knowing what dish is going to be served next! I brought my family who are visiting from the Philippines and they loved every dish! We had requested for spicy pasta which was delicious and truly spicy! We will definitely be back!

Definitely a fan of this place!
I went here on a Thursday with a party of four. It wasn't that busy and we asked to sit on their roof patio. It was so pretty, a scene from Europe! It had flowers blooming with real grape vines growing.
I didn't know this walking in but this place apparently doesn't have any menus. Our server asked us if we want some wine and any allergies or things we don't want to eat.
We said yes to the wine and no on allergies and then we were on our way to a delicious journey. First came out warm garlic bread and a salad which I enjoyed. The following dishes were a little bit of a blur, they just keep coming out! I think our favorites was this crab pasta and a tomato based linguini. Overall, all the dishes were really good. I believed I tried 4-5 dishes. It is served family style as the server has this huge plate of food and they walk around plating everyone's plates with a piece of it.
The dining experience is a little long, we were there for over 2 hours but the servers were pretty attentive.
I was curious of what the price was when we got our bill and it wasn't too bad! We also had a Groupon too.
I would definitely return. It's a fun and relaxing experience and you don't feel rushed here.

We had dinner here last night outside on the patio!
This restaurant is charming and unique and the staff is amazing! A GEM hiding in West Lake!!!
No menus - so be prepared to be surprised by every delicious bite! It's very hard to describe! Salads to all, first course the same to each of us... from there until dessert, individual courses that we just had to share! Wines chosen by the waiter, the owner's son! Amazing and delicious! Sorry I didn't take any pictures! Next time for sure!

First time visit, went with coworkers for HH. In a nutshell...
Great cocktails- it's always fun to try new drinks or their take on old drinks.
Super friendly staff- our server spent quality time explaining the cocktails and foods. We ended up taking many over her recommendations and enjoyed them. She was prompt and efficient. When we were asking questions about the food preparation she sent out the chef to answer our questions.
Food- oh wow. The wings are delicious as were the twice fried chicken thigh nugget thingys although I never tasted the sriracha in the dipping sauce. This was the first time I have ever had mac and cheese that was al dente and the pork on top was tender and flavorful. Cheese puffs were ok and the smashed potatoes were delicious also.
I love this place and would recommend it highly!!!!

$2 Oyster Happy Hour!
Lady Jaye deserves five stars for that alone, but here's a list of her other sparkling qualities:
Sophisticated (cocktails)
Ambitious (food)
Zero attitude (staff is so genuine and friendly!)
Smells amazing (like wood smoke and pretty people)
Try Lady Jaye, don't let her be the one that got away.

I was recommended by a friend to try this place out for brunch and I recommend you should too!
We came on a Saturday morning for brunch and I ordered the Hobo Scramble. I didn't know what to expect, but let's just say -- I finished the entire plate. That little biscuit was AMAZING! I can't tell you enough. As my friend would put it "I want to live in this biscuit" -- then the Hobo Scramble had a little bit of everything, bacon, ham, sausage, potato, and eggs. Perfection.
The restaurant is super cute, good size dining area. The inside also has a bar area with a few TVs. It looks like they have an outdoor area for the summer times. For a rainy Saturday morning, it was decently busy in there!
I highly recommend you stop by for brunch. I can't wait to go back for dinner!

Let me tell you, this restaurant does a fine job on their food! I ordered the pork cheek Mac and cheese, forever smoked turkey drum, burrata cheese, pimento cheese puffs, butter Lettuce, oysters, and my fav garlic prawns! The meat dishes here are so flavorful and tender; honestly I felt ready to hibernate afterwards
The Burrata cheese is paired with stir fried string beans and sweet tomato topped with onion crisps. The big Burrata on top was so amazing but this dish was honestly a little confusing. I was expecting a salty taste but the sweet tomato really overshadowed the whole dish. It was def a surprising dish, not bad but I couldn't eat a lot of it. So I ate all the Burrata instead lol
The butter Lettuce had a Smokey taste but a little bland. The real highlight of the meal was all the meats and the garlic prawns. So tender and flavor! Those are must try dishes!

Shrub Zero $7: Even though I enjoy making shrubs at home now because I love vinegar. I'll still try it when I'm out for new flavor ideas. The rotating flavor that day was huckleberry and it was a really pretty flavor. I'm not sure if the huckleberry was just overpowering or I've become so used to shrubs the vinegar doesn't hit me as much anymore, but it was still nice and refreshing.
Smoked Bologna Sandwich $14: This is also available during brunch which is Saturday and Sunday 10 AM - 2 PM. I ended up not really liking the mustard on this, and it kind of took over the sandwich flavor wise. It's been ages since I've had a bologna sandwich in my school days, but the meat on this didn't taste super different from what I remember. I did enjoy the broken potatoes as the side.
White Cheddar Grits $5: This was a good portion size for sharing as a side. In terms of grits alone, it was pretty good. My favorite grits were at Fiddlehead when they were open, but I'd order it with a side of sausage gravy. Now I like the grits at Witness in Capitol Hill which has it with bacon gravy for brunch. Basically I'm saying I need gravy to really go next level regarding my enjoyment of grits.
Overall although the food was alright, there's not much else on the current menu I feel inclined to try. I'll probably check on it now and then as I'm definitely open to giving it another shot if something catches my eye.
*****
My Star Ratings:
1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.
2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.
3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.
4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.
5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

Lady Jaye is a super cute restaurant in West Seattle, and I would recommend it. Located right on California Ave, the restaurant serves for a central place to get there. a good version of Southern, casual food and BBQ. Prices were ok and not ash (maybe ranging about $11-$20 for an entree). Though their menu is not expansive, there are a couple of things we tried that were flavorful and just the right amount of saltiness (such as the garlic shrimp and beef cheeks). Also, Customer service-wise, the waitress was very nice and would consider coming back.

Came for brunch. Food was not bad. Service was excellent though.
Food: I went for the basic breakfast... pretty sure that's the name. It came with two eggs, crispy bacon, home fries and a biscuit. The dish literally came out within 5 minutes of ordering. Not sure if this was impressive or concerning... BUT the food was tasty. There were 4 slices of bacon - a ton! The home fries were just okay... they were kind of mushy and I usually like my potatoes crispy. The biscuit, while good, was not the best I've ever had. It was a good texture but lacking flavor even when paired with butter and jam.
Service: we were promptly greeted and seated when my husband and i strolled in at 11am on a Sunday. The service was very warm, friendly and attentive. This restaurant has only been open for four months so I can only hope they sustain this level of service for years to come.
Atmosphere: if I recall correctly there was a bar in the restaurant so wouldn't be surprised if this spot did happy hours and such. We didn't get anything to drink though for brunch. I liked the size of the restaurant - not too big, not too small. The woman who took our check mentioned they have a beautiful patio out back which is super popular during the summer, but we didn't see it in person.
Overall: good standard brunch fare, could use a bit more oomph though. Service is excellent however.

Stopped in here for Happy Hour and it was fantastic. It was a little chilly outside, but not raining so we opted to sit outside by their huge fire pit.
Our server came out pretty quick after seating us and we ordered a couple of whiskey warm drinks. They were delicious. Their HH menu is pretty good too. We had a variety of items to try.
Food is good, service is good, however, it was a little pricey because we ordered drinks that weren't on the HH menu. Overall, a definite must go back to!

Cute little bar tucked on California Ave. Great space to catch up with friends or grab a drink. I've only been for dinner on a Friday night and it was a good vibe. Ordered a local beer and the chicken wangs with a side of mac & cheese. All of which was a really delicious pairing. My friend ordered the turkey leg which was huge! - the meat fell off the bone nicely, similar to having it be sous vide. The bar has many options to choose from and the menu was simple yet promising. Customer service was great and engaging, not too bothersome or not enough, just right! This place definitely prides themselves in quality (food, service, aesthetics) without being too overbearing. Brunch looks like it would taste good. Will definitely come back again!

Nice little spot off California Ave with Ron Swanson on the TVs lol. I ordered 3 dishes. the mushroom dip with chips, the pork cheek Mac and cheese and the pork collar pastrami plate .
Mushroom dip - very flavorful, big fan
Mac and cheese - pork cheek is amazing, super tender and my favorite part of the entire meal, the Mac and cheese was really creamy how I like it but a little salty
Pastrami plate - the pastrami was really good, also very tender, they really pay attention to the details when it comes to their meats
Drinks - Japanese vesper was on special, incredibly smooth and had the faint taste of a stick of juicy fruit gum, loved it.
Over all good experience here, only reason it's not a 5 is, it was pretty pricey. An app, 2 entrees and a couple drinks were $100+ but that's Seattle for ya

Went here on New Year's Day for brunch. We have been wanting to try this place for a while. The place was packed! The staff was really friendly. We both had coffee and tried their fresh orange juice. Both were delicious. This was the first fresh squeezed orange juice that actually tasted like it was fresh!
I had the chorizo scramble and my husband had the breakfast sandwich. Both were so good! The chorizo tasted so fresh and perfectly spiced. The sandwich had deliciously smoked Canadian bacon on it.
I am so happy we just checked this place out. I can't wait to come back for dinner and another brunch! Love having this great place in west seattle!

A nice bar in west seatttle. The drinks are amazing but the food is okay. Where do we start. We ordered the buffalo trails, eagle rare version of scotch and the bourbon crusta. Each of these drinks were mind blowingly delicious. They do have a full sized bar with a lot of rare or hard to find liqour as well. We ordered the chicken wings and were not impressed with it. Loads of seating, staff is friendly, service is great. Highly recommend to stop by for drinks.

The food was absolutely delicious! I cannot remember the servers name, unfortunately, but she was an absolute delight! Kind and patient, she let us explore the menu and offered suggestions when appropriate.
I got the mac and cheese, which was orgasmic. I didn't bother taking a breath between bites!
Our server suggested the lava cake with peanut butter ice cream for dessert. HOLY MOLY. Absolute perfection

I heard lots of good things about this place and had a friend visiting the day they were offering their first brunch. I figured that would be a perfect day to check them out!
The ambience was nice - could be good for a date or just with friends. They were playing some great bluegrass music, which I definitely appreciated. Our waiter was really friendly and checked on us appropriately.
The menu was limited. I had a hard time choosing something off the menu, which is normally a good problem to have, but in this case, it was because nothing really stood out.
Ended up choosing the chorizo scramble with a jalapeño crema and potatoes. The scramble was meh. The chorizo wasn't really the chorizo I was expecting (i'm thinking red and spicy - this was grey and mild). Wasn't very flavorful overall. I think I could've made a better scramble at home to be honest. The potatoes were really good, though! My friends all raved about their potatoes. No one really said anything about their actual meal. The potatoes were salty and perfectly crispy.
I got a bloody mary which was clearly spiced and seasoned. Just the way I like it. My friend got the smoked pineapple mimosa which was very interesting! It didn't taste smoked at first but got smokier and smokier as she got to the bottom, until it was too smoky. Not sure if it wasn't mixed well or something. Ill give that a pass though since it was interesting!
Overall, the food was meh (again, only reviewing brunch). I would like to come back to review their dinner options because I've heard such great things (but I also saw reviews saying not to believe the hype, so who knows). I could also come back just for drinks!

I went to Lady Jaye on a Sunday morning for their brunch. I had heard about this restaurant from word of mouth and I wanted to try it out. I was greeted warmly by Mona who quickly got me a menu. I decided to order the shrimp and grits. i have not found good shrimp and grits in Seattle. I've had amazing shrimp and grits in the South in places like New Orleans and Atlanta. However, the grits I've tried in Seattle taste like cement. When I received my plate, I was surprised by the arugula on top of the shrimp grits. It was definitely a Pacific Northwest twist on the dish. I loved that the arugula had a pleasant vinaigrette on it. The actual grits were the right texture and immersed with chunks of Andouille sausages that gave it great flavor. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and mixed well with the creamy grits. This was definitely the best shrimp and grits I've had in Seattle and anywhere outside of the South. As I was leaving, the place started filling up. It has a good vibe to it with friendly staff. I would highly recommend Lady Jaye with their Pacific Northwest twist on American comfort food. It's definitely a gem in the Junction in West Seattle. I never go to West Seattle but I would go out of my way to come out here again for Lady Jaye.

I went to Lady Jaye a couple weeks ago for dinner with some friends, and had a good experience. I didn't order any cocktails -which they are known for- so that was a bit of a mistake. The food overall was good, nothing really blew me away though, that said, we only tried a few of the menu items.
I'm planning on going back and trying a cocktail (or two) in the near future

Finally, a great cocktail place in West Seattle Junction! Right in the heart of Alaska Junction, a really cool place for cocktails and dinner. I really enjoyed the service, food and cocktails. My only recommendation would be to change music: it might be personal but I would tone it down. Otherwise, a great place with a cool vibe and delicious cocktails.

After 20 years, Lady Jayes has knocked Jaks grill off the top of my favorite restaurant list.
It's hard to settle on one dish to review but the burrata is definitely my favorite even though I was skeptical at first. Hot beans with cold cheese? No thanks! BUT oh my gosh! After the first bite of creamy salty goodness, it's yes please!! Then there's the pork cakes and the mushroom dip with house made chips!! Soooo deelishus.
I'm not usually a fan of crazy cocktails but I love have they pull together a bunch of interesting ingredients and make it work. I have to have a Strawberry Manilow every time I go.
I love the ambiance. The lighting, decor and music make it a place I could hang out all day. It's so comfortable and welcoming.
The staff are hands down my favorite part. They are so excited about their product and even more excited to share it with you and it shows. Everyone I have talked to has been so gracious and humble.
I look forward to every time I get to go. Hmmmm maybe brunch on Sunday???

Holy cow, the pork pastrami plate. How could brisket or a Reuben get any more delicious? Corned pork. So rich and fatty and flavorful. Served on a beautiful cutting board with onion rye, stone ground mustard, a pickle, and house-made sauerkraut. I loved the concept of assembling your own open-faced reubens - ensures nothing gets soggy and each bite has the perfect mix of flavors.
Next time, I want to try the giant turkey let with Mexican fixings (ancho bbq sauce, lime crema, cilantro, etc.) - looked pretty delicious.

Oh my god, this place was good. I can't think of one thing I would change. We got in around 4 on a Saturday and it was happy hour (yay!) some of their signature cocktails were 2 dollars off and they had food deals. I opted for a Guns and Rosemary gin cocktail and it was delicious! It came with a salted rosemary rim and I was pleasantly surprised that it was not overpowered by the rosemary and it was just the right amount of sweet. I had two of these babies it was too good to switch to something different.
Whoo, okay distracted by how good that cocktail was. Let's talk ambiance. It's a little dim lit but basically the perfect amount to be relaxed. Just being there made me feel cool, it's a little rustic, a little hip, they have a huge chalkboard with the specials written out. What more can you ask for? We were there for a date night and this delivered for a date night mood for sure.
Service was awesome! Our waitress was the perfect amount of attentive while also letting us enjoy our food, drinks and each others company. We never had anything we didn't need and when I annoyingly decided I wanted oysters after we ordered everything else 5 minutes before she was very nice about.
And finally the food! I want to eat here every day. We had 4 oysters on the half shell with a tobasco ice topping that comes on the side. The tobasco Ice wasn't overwhelming and you could still taste the flavor of the oyster. We also had the pork cheek Mac and cheese and pork collar pastrami platter. I was a little hesitant when I saw the mac and cheese had arugula on it but it was heaven. All of the flavors went so well together, now I'm wondering if I should put arugula on my Mac and cheese more often. The pastrami plate was also amazing. It was the fanciest deconstructed rueben I've ever had. The meat was smoky and juicy served with delicious crispy toast, thousand island dressing, mustard, pickles and sauerkraut.
We will be back to try the bologna sandwich.

This is a great go too, for a nice meal and good drink. They always have great desserts too!
A pretty decent happy hour menu.
I do miss the cocktails & design of the Tiger Tail. But they kept enough of the original build out.
I do wish they opened earlier and did brunch or lunch. The area is lacking things open before 4pm.

Three stars is a stretch for tonight, unfortunately.
The staff seemed overburdened. They were very slow to get to us but once they did, it wasn't a long wait for drinks or food.
And then we come to the food. We had two small plates: pesto cream gnocchi and cauliflower with romesco. The gnocchi was heavy, almost pasty, and clunky. The cauliflower was badly over-seasoned with salt, though the texture was pretty good. For dessert, coconut coriander rice pudding with pistachios. The portion was huge (like two cups) but the dish was also a miss. The rice was undercooked so the texture was less like pudding and more like pinhead oats.
Overall, I don't think we'll return.

This place was incredible. The smoked tuna toasts were so delicious (I wish every time I made a tuna sandwich it tasted as good as that smoked tuna) with a sweet pepper as a perfect touch on top. The roasted cauliflower was good and flavorful, though admittedly my least favorite item we tried. The pan seared tuna (daily market fish) was expensive at $32 but wow it was flavorful. The sauce on top was tangy, refreshing, and I just couldn't get enough, and the fish had a beautiful crisp to it. The dungeoness crab spaghetti with a lemon butter wine sauce -- wow. Decadent, rich, and delicious with a piece of roasted bread dipped into it. I'm excited to go back and try more. The service could've been a bit faster, but the waiter was friendly and had a lot on his plate (hah)
Update: They now do brunch too! Homemade sweet potato English muffins with their eggs Benedict. The lemongrass braised short rib with kimchi Benedict was stellar and the apple streusel oven baked French toast... wow. The portions are huge so bring a friend to split!

Mediocre food across the board: came with a larger group, and wasn't impressed by any of the apps or entrees. The gnocchi was especially disappointing for the price: the pesto was made with dried basil (yuck), and the dish as a whole was gummy. Desserts were unimpressive. Drinks were okay - the options are decent, and there's good wine to be had. This is a relatively easy spot to get into with a group of 5+, but I'd rather wait for a great meal elsewhere.
Great delicious breakfast. Several vegetarian options. I really liked the Ballard black beans. Yummy mix of squash and eggs in that one.

This is a super cute place! We stopped in for a drink and appetizer and were not disappointed.
The service was super friendly! The bartender was very welcoming and helpful with the menu.
We ordered a few drinks and the crab fitters. The fritters were perfectly fried and so tasty! A perfect app to share.
This place would be great for a date night! It's really cute and not too pricey. Oh, and I'm pretty sure a coupon popped up when I check in but we didn't use it. Check it out tho, if you come here.
We definitely want to come back for dinner soon!

Bit of a mixed bag here, though I'm glad to have given it a shot.
The plantain appetizer didn't have a lot of flavor, though the guacamole and salsa with them were quite good.
The burgers were fine.
The spinach and artichoke dip was very parmesan heavy with a side of well toasted bread.

Food was phenomenal! I got the ribs and the polenta was the best I have had. It melts softly in your mouth with some of the juice from the ribs. Came with a bit greens which compliments very well. Also had the manila clam, it was pretty delightful. Great attentive server paired with very comfortable vibe. Highly recommend!

Our server was so outstanding, I want to give her a 5 star rating! She was very knowledgeable and very patient in answering all our questions. She paced the meal well.
Unfortunately, only some of the food was great. The coq au vin and short ribs were delicious and well prepared. The fried chicken was wonderfully crispy and well-seasoned.
Some of the food was so-so. The red sauce for the meatballs was better than the meatballs themselves, which were too heavily seasoned with smoked paprika. None of us liked the meatballs, and yet scraped the last bit of sauce from the dish. The brussel sprouts (on the menu since day 1!) were tasty but extremely sweet. The would have been a better dessert than starter. The fries were crispy and hot, but we couldn't taste the black truffle at all. The Caesar salad had nice flavor, but the salt wasn't balanced between the fried capers, croutons, cheese and dressing (overly salty).
We will try it again, hoping the kitchen was having a bit of an off night.

Gathered with some pals here a few times now and its always been a wonderful experience. Last time I had the spinach salad with oranges and bacon and added a chicken breast, a winning salad! My favorite meal has been the fried chicken sandwich with a twist..switching out the fried for a juicy chicken breast! Honestly I talked about that sandwich the next day. Have something to talk about the next day and go here already!

This place reminds you of an old setting american style bar.Its a bit expensive for drinks and large plates but the food more than makes up for it. They have ciders on rotation and a large selection of wines and beers as well.
Being a vegetarian,we had the artichoke artisan dip and roasted cauliflower for appetizers. The artichoke was the tastiest dip ever ! The cauliflower was a bit soggy but it had a cuminy taste which was good.
My friends also had the shrimp tacos and the seafood spaghetti which they raved on about !
They also have desserts per seasonal changes, we had the lava cake and the lemon strawberry tart. I am a dark chocolate fan, so i loved it. The tart had a subtle sugar taste which suited me.
The service was gracious and couldnt be happier about it ! Will definitely head to this place more often.

We live in the neighborhood and walk by The Blue Glass all the time so we finally decided to try it. We are so happy we did. All the food was delicious. The meat was cooked to perfection and the app was just as great. It's not the cheapest place but Seattle in general is not. We walked away a little under $100. Two drinks, two meals and an app feeling satisfied. Service was excellent too and we sat at the bar cause the restaurant was packed.

Nice ambiance but the football game on 3 televisions that nobody appeared to be watching. I ordered the lamb shank and the meat was falling off the bone and juicy but flavorless. There was a bit of ground mint on top, but not a balancing of flavor, just a smack in the tongue of mint and lame lamb. The sweet potato, brussel sprout, etc... vegetable 'hash' was no hash but a medley of sorts and the flavor on the plate. I ended up eating each bite of lamb with brussel sprout halves to add flavor to meat.

Blue Glass is a great little spot for a glass of beer, wine or a cocktail. They also have a nice menu that is simple yet good offerings. Clams were delicious! Not much seating and def gets warm in the summer.

We ate there the week before Christmas ... it was very busy, and both the wait-staff and the kitchen were overwhelmed - and service was very slow as a result - I assume that isn't normal.
The southwest corn chowder was fabulous (a special, not on the regular menu). The Moroccan lamb was tasty and interesting, with golden raisins and a mix of flavors, and Israeli-style large grain cons-cous. The veggie burger was thick and tasty - we feared it might be simulated meat, but no, it was a proper veggie burger, and quite good. Their list of specialty cocktails is interesting - I had the anejo sour, which was good, if pricey. They also had a good selection of beers (the Seapine IPA on draft was my partner's pick).
All-in-all, we liked The Blue Glass - located downhill of Phinney Ridge on 65th, it's a neighborhood joint with some spizazz. It was a bit pricey ... not outrageous, but more than I would expect for that kind of restaurant.

Wow! Where to start, my husband and I stumbled in here super late a couple days before Christmas!
It's a super cozy little restaurant with a great vibe. There were no children in there which was a godsend! I'm not sure if it's a family restaurant or if it's more of an 'adult only' setting but it was great to eat a meal without having to hear people's children.
Food was 10/10! The short ribs were some of the best I've ever had.

This was always one of my favorite cozy dinner spots but now it's also my go to brunch spot! The lemongrass short rib kimchi Benedict was so decadent and flavorful. My friend and I also shared an apple streusel French toast and I was in sweet tooth heaven. The restaurant is 21+ which definitely made for a more peaceful brunch than you would usually experience

LOVE THIS PLACE My first experience with The Blue Glass was this summer, when I went in to grab drinks with friends. Our cocktails were great! And we tried the smoked tuna toasts with Mama Lil's Peppers. DELICIOUS! I was so happy to find myself there again with friends last Friday. I was encouraged to go for it! -and try the Braised Short Ribs with polenta and sautéed rapini. The ribs practically melted in my mouth! A wonderful dish! Of course I ordered the smoked tuna toasts appetizer again, had to! I took a bite of my friends' Moroccan Lamb and Albondigas, and was in heaven!
The atmosphere is warm, inviting, and intimate. You are set up to have a wonderful time chatting it up with your company. Perfect night out, highly recommend

My wife and I visited while vacationing in Ballard. It was a short, pleasant walk from our Airbnb. It had a great vibe inside - comfy and iconically picturesque at the same time.
The beer list was fairly extensive, and the beer tasted fresh.
We ordered pan fried brussels sprouts (awesome texture and perfectly cooked, but quite sweet - it could be a dessert), crab fritters (great flavor and super filling) as appetisers. For entrees, I had a Caesar salad with coho salmon (salad was meh and the fish was overcooked) and my wife had the pear arugula salad (good but nothing special).
They could have had an off night this particular Wednesday. Its got awesome ambiance, really good beer, but I would not recommend them for the food.

We hosted the rehearsal dinner for our wedding here in June. If you're in search of a restaurant to "buy out" for an evening that is a good fit for 50-ish people, definitely give The Blue Glass a look!
James at The Blue Glass worked with us to customize the night to meet our needs. The Blue Glass was flexible on menu and able to accommodate a variety of dietary constraints (including gluten-free and vegetarian). We ended up starting with buffet-style appetizers (Brussels sprouts and Dungeness crab fritters -- both a hit!) and then had plated entrees for the main course. We were able to give our guests the choice of three different entrees (lamb, salmon, and vegetarian risotto) which was great for accommodating various tastes. FYI they have beer, wine, and a full bar available, too.
Size-wise, the restaurant was a perfect fit for our group of 45-50. We filled it up nicely, and when it was time for a few toasts you could easily hear the speakers without needing microphones / audio equipment. (One less logistical item to worry about!) And since we had bought out the whole restaurant for the evening, there were no concerns about toasts disturbing other patrons!
The evening itself went off without a hitch. No delays, no food quality issues, and no worries for me and my partner! Afterwards, a number of guests commented on what a good spot it was for a rehearsal dinner. We would definitely host a rehearsal dinner here again: alas, for us, we hope that is a one-time sort of thing(!) -- so why don't you host yours here, instead?

I was traveling alone for business and wanted a relaxed, upbeat place to grab dinner and a drink at the bar. This place fit the bill with great food and a fun vibe. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when they mailed the shopping bag I left behind back to me in Philadelphia.
I will definitely make sure to stop back in the next time I'm in town.

Came here tonight for an impromptu dinner date and left very satisfied. This place, besides being slightly hard to find, is the cutest little nook in downtown Seattle. You feel as if you're in a completely different world vs the touristy pike place corridor.
We arrived around 6:55 PM and were pleasantly surprised it was still happy hour. The deal is actually quite good - $4 off cocktails! I ordered a mezcal cocktail (what's new?) and husband ordered old fashioned. We asked for them less sweet and they turned out great. Mine had a ginger syrup which was different vs most mezcal cocktails I've ordered!
For food, ordered brussel sprouts and beet deviled eggs to start, and split the mussels and burger for the mains. The brussel sprouts were recommended by the server. They were good, not great. Felt like I could make them myself and wouldn't order again for $12. The deviled egg was the perfect party in my mouth and something I had never tasted before! It had a slice of anchovy in it which sounds odd but tasted amazing. Burger was perfectly cooked with a nice crispy bun. The fries were cooked crisp to perfection. Mussels were in perhaps the best sauce I've ever had.
Overall food was so tasty, service was quick and attentive despite restaurant being completely full, and menu comprehensive! Will come back for sure - especially now that we know HH runs until 7 pm on weekdays!

I came to Zig Zag for dinner and had a great experience in the end. My visit didn't start off great, though. The service was slow. On the night I was at Zig Zag, the restaurant was no more than 50% full. Nevertheless, I still waited nearly 25 minutes for my food.
That being said, the food was definitely worth the wait. I had the Wild Mushroom Farro, and it was the best farro I've ever had in my life! The flavor was completely balanced, with no one ingredient dominating the dish. I was also impressed with how they incorporated huckleberry into the dish. On top of that, the sauce - which I'm told was just vegetable stock with butter - was phenomenal. My only minor complaint was that some of the cauliflower was burnt. But the dish was so perfect in every other way that I can definitely overlook the cauliflower.

Met a friend here for some cocktails and it was really nice. I appreciated the vibe and that it wasn't super crazy loud. We got to hang out at a standing table and order our first drink before a table opened up, but it wasn't long until one did even though it was Friday night. The drink selection was awesome, and everything we ordered was great (and cleverly named). We also enjoyed our reasonably priced olives and Marcona almonds... good food, great drinks, nice vibe...

Came here for a drink Saturday night.
Cool, chill, vibe. Super low key. Little bit hidden but follow the signs down the stairs. We didn't have to wait and were seated right away. We got two cocktails and be warned they are super strong.
They have a large selection of different kinds of drinks as well as a late night menu. We didn't try any of the food but it all looked amazing.

Wow what a great find on a work trip! There's so many places to choose from right here in the Pike Place Market area. Lucky me, I landed at Zig Zag!
Service from Anna and Erin was spot on a dm fabulous. Technically, I believe Anna was my server yet Erin bought several things and was very attentive as well. It kinda worked as tag team service and that was just fabulous!
All the food was spot on, they had plenty of gluten-free options and the happy hour wine was very good.
My only complaint is that I ate way too much because the food was so great! My hotel is around one plus miles ...uphill. Ugh. It'll be good for me, right?!? Super good, I'll be back!

This place savings grace is there zig zag burger with the fried egg. That was absolutely delicious. The yolk just gushed out everywhere. Felt like I was eating a breakfast sandwich one minute and then the next second a bacon cheese burger. Also the cheese just oozed out of everywhere. Very delicious. The fries were a bit too salty for my taste though. Score: 5/5
Their snacks were very boring. The baguette with the cultured butter was good though. It comes toasted but my only compliant is that I eat too fast and the outside of the bread is too hard :(
The cheese platter was smelly!!!! It's not my cup of tea but I'm sure other people will love it

As a tourist to Pike Market, it was fun to dig out this hidden gem. My bar tender friend suggest me here for cock tails. And yes, def a great spot for happy hour drinks then a walk around to enjoy the sunset.
The drink menu is huge, and the bartender is quite knowledgable about almost everything. I like the atmosphere too, as a weekday early evening, it's already a full house, towns of locals and tourists like me here for their happy hour.
I would def come back and try more items.

What a hidden(?) gem!
Great cozy restaurant and their service was fantastic. Small selections of wines but they were really good wines and reasonable.
Ordered A charcuterie plate, fried oysters, burgers and mussels. The plate was so tasty and the meats were perfectly cured, their mousse was just melt in my mouth.
Mussels were so plumped and juicy. Creamy curry? Sauce was as good as mussels. Their burgers were seasoned right and right size. Not to small or big.
Fried oysters were my fave. Small size and sweet. Everything we ordered was just divine. I would go back there for HH next time. Sooo laidback vibes and the foods were excellent!!

Looking for a classy, undercover jazz cafe with dim lighting, friendly staff and sleek design that totally takes you away from everyday life? Your answer: Zig Zag Cafe. Skillfully tucked away from Pike's Place market, close to the waterfront, Zig Zag offered superbly crafted cocktails and the perfect aperitif options to take a breather prior to continuing our tour of the city.
The lighting is dimly lit with old antique bottles of wine (some unopened) and cozy red lighting that makes you feel stuck in time. Each table is decked out with a candle as humble chandeliers decorate the ceilings.
We ordered a dish of deliciously tasting green & black olives with the perfect amount of garlic and zest. Complimented by a dish of pita bread and heated hummus (spiced with paprika and garlic), the food was delicious! For my cocktail, I ordered an aperol spritz - aperol campari mixed with good quality prosecco and orange zest with enough punch to keep me going.
Overall outstanding dining experience. Highly recommend! A+

I had a great experience here. I've heard a lot of good things about Zig Zig and I'm so happy I've finally made my way there to experience it myself. I ate the fries and deviled eggs off their late night menu. I loved the sultry smokey ambiance and the bartender was great. I just loved watching the art that goes into crafting their perfect cocktails. I had a simple Moscow mule, perhaps next time I'll try one of their house cocktails. The deviled eggs were so yummy! Maybe I'll be back soon to try more food!

Went with a small group of friends last night and we were seated pretty quickly. Drinks aren't super cheap but you definitely get your money's worth. Shared a squid pro quo and it was delicious. Only negative I would mention is that we were sitting near the door and it was a bit chilly.
Nice atmosphere, wait staff prompt and friendly. Food was good. The fried clams and mussels were great. The whisky drinks even better. I love the red lighting and music.

Even though I'm a life long Seattleite, last night was my first time to the Zig Zag Café. The area around Pike Place is incredible now that the viaduct has been demolished, and I hope local businesses benefit from that. I loved the Zig Zag Café, excellent drinks, good food and great staff. Our server was very friendly and very accommodating when I realized too late that I had ordered something that didn't agree with my tastes. Much appreciated, and I won't wait so long for my next visit!

Dark and cozy, with delicious bites and strong cocktails. We had deviled eggs, the pork skins, and almonds and olives for snacks before dinner at Cutters. The eggplant dip with the pork skins was the highlight. It was silky smooth, and not like baba ganouj, if that's what you were thinking. There's an off-menu cocktail-with-a-story, if you're interested. Called the Chas, it's bourbon, Cointreau, and other potent tastiness. A Pike Place institution, you must come to Zig Zag if you're in Seattle.

We stumbled upon this restaurant walking from pikes place down the water before heading over the smith tower. Zig Zag has the best mixologist in Seattle with a wide range of spirits. The food was wonderful, the staff was great and it's in a good location. The mixed drinks were excellent. An eggplant dish was superb, perfectly cooked and with the right garnish. The place is very cozy and very relaxing. The server was great in giving suggestions and the drinks were great.

BEST HAPPY HOUR. So many fun drinks and yummy snacks. They have one of the most extensive cocktail menus I've ever seen and it was hard to decide on just one (okay, two) to try. For snacks we had the fries which have a great balance of salt and dress black pepper and the crispy pig skin which came with a fantastic aioli.
We arrived around 5:30 and were able to get a seat on their small patio, but the inside looked nice too if the patio is full.
Definitely a place to visit and hang around. The barman was the best. And I don't even drink!
Great place for a drink at dusk....very nice selection of drinks and food. Bartenders very knowledgeable
Had appetizers and drinks with a friend. Tasty all around! Fun little spot and nice patio area.

Probably my new favorite place in Belltown.
The bartenders are the best. They have great listed cocktails and I've had them invent a new cocktail on the fly. If the place isn't super busy, they will interact with you making you feel really comfortable.
The bar is built around the cocktails and the bartenders. The decor is okay for my tastes.
The place can be too small at times so great for a romantic stop but a large party might have to wait for a large table.
If you want more than bar snacks, skip this place but come back after you had food for a great time.

I picked this spot for going out to celebrate my birthday with a friend, after hearing lots of buzz. The ambiance is really beautiful and the blue velvet couches/tropical mural are very classy and well-done. However, the drinks didn't especially 'wow' me--the menu is divided up into categories like "grapes", "grains," etc. Lots of cognac I noticed! I opted for "The Fall of Man" which had sherry in it as well as green apples for a garnish. My friend ordered a drink that had strawberries for a garnish (can't remember what else was in it). We both enjoyed the drinks but for $16 cocktails I guess I was expecting something a bit more memorable.
P.S. They have a $60 off-menu snack which consists of caviar and Bugles. Please order it and tell me how it is!

Had a couple cocktails on a Sunday night, catching up with a friend. I would rate this experience alongside Damn the Weather. This is a damn fine cocktail bar. I had the first 2 Agave cocktails; the second in particular was knockout good, very smoky yet delicate and botanical. Should have asked the bartender's name so I could shout him out; he poured a couple tasters of spirits I had never encountered.
Definitely come here for a classy cocktail experience, ambiance is intimate, staff were friendly. Can't speak for the food (yet).

Roquette - I think is one of the top bars in Seattle. It's definately our favorite. We like to pop in on a week day when it's slightly slower and sit at the bar. Always at the bar! It gets pretty crowded on a weekend but it's also nice. Bartenders are very professional, down to earth, knowledgeable and kind. John is great! Looking forward to many more drunken nights at Roquette.

A wonderful cocktail bar or lounge. A great meeting spot for a date or friends who want a masterfully crafted cocktail. Each drink is broken up by the type of spirit and as you go down each list the drink is more "developed" or full bodied and more alcoholic. We had the brandy old fashioned and the cab we elope. The old fashioned was a wonderful take on the traditional with great winter taste and spice. Each drink had the perfect balance of acidity and sweetness and alcohol. The bar staff were definitely masters at mixing cocktails and not shy on conversation. Overall a pleasure to enjoy a drink at and will definitely be back.
Great drinks in a well appointed space with helpful staff. A little on the loud side and it's not as frou-frou as some spots but I'm very glad we went and checked it out.

Came through here with the understanding that they're probably still working through some opening kinks. Belltown has some amazing cocktail lounges already, so Roquette is up against some stiff competition. I might be back for a date in the future, but with Rob Roy, Mr. Darcy's and Branchwater a stone's throw away... maybe not.
The drink I got (think it was called Madame Derrier? Something bitter with whiskey) was indeed amazing, but spendy, even for Seattle. Date's drink was also good. Both were nice 'n' strong. But again, there are tons of great options around.
The inside of the bar is very dark, but somehow missing that coziness I expected. Maybe it was just because it was a sparse night...
The service wasn't great. We sat at a table near the window, away from the bar, and the server kept coming over to us (just have been half a dozen times, maybe more) to ask how we were. Each time, we were fine. I got the impression they wanted us to leave or order another drink or food, and we just didn't need it.

Great cocktail game, although some in our party weren't in agreement.
Went for opening night and staff was super great. Vespers were delicious, nice attention to detail. BR was pretty busy but not sure what the ambience would be other than bar with people having drinks...
Could use some work on other cocktails. Giving this place another chance.

Came here on a Friday night with a friend and loved the vibe of this fairly new establishment. I had the bartenders make me a cocktail with whatever they wanted and it did not disappoint. I love their creativity and the chicharrones we the perfect snack for our stop.

Drinks: okay
Prices: expensive
Service: shitty, hostile
Bar was empty when we came in. A number of us were meeting up at the bar. Table ran out of chairs so we pulled some of the bar stools for our friends (remember empty bar).
Lady told us we couldn't use the stools because it would block the "aisle" and would be a fire hazard. Fine, returned stools.
Friends stood around the table and lady came back and said we couldn't stand around the area because it would still block the aisle and still be a fire hazard. There was a corner area that opened up and she suggested we sit there.
Corner area was large, was not next to any aisle, but still did not have enough seats (poor floor management, there's 8 of us), and bar still empty. We pulled some stools cuz we figured no fire hazard. Lady said she we couldn't use the stools and wanted her stools back.
Friend mumbled a complaint and lady goes on a power trip, flexes that she has the ability to kick us out. We weren't loud, rude, or belligerent to any degree. We barely finished our first round of drinks. Whatever... we decided we didn't want to stay. Slammed our drinks and scrambled to get out of there.
Don't worry lady, I won't come back. I will take my yellow ass and green backs somewhere less hostile.
Btw, bar was still empty when we left.
French influenced cocktails. Bartender owned which is awesome. Food is coming soon but we were there on day 2. Erik the owner has a great vibe going and Jesse made me a great manhattan.

A fantastic new entry to the Belltown circuit. French-Polynesian influence without going the way of a tiki-bar, the drinks are inventive and balanced. The menu will grow with time -- I believe it's been open less than a week -- but I was able to try their 47 Monkey Vesper, the white Negroni, and a TBD spirit-forward Mezcal cocktail (a creation of barman/designer Kyton). Each featured layered flavors that are perfect for the Summer.
Design-wise, the place is intimate but well lit, and the walnut accents and eclectic wallpapers throughout make for a fun backdrop.
Don't miss out on the hot chicharrones. And I think I heard something about about Bugles and caviar...

A hidden gem in the heart of a lively neighborhood. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in to a dimly lit, elegant bar. You can nestle yourself away in a fashionably styled corner for date night or sit at the bar with friends for a drink and chat with any one of the knowledgeable bartenders. Drinks are great, atmosphere is great! Highly recommend.

Brand new spot in Belltown with French inspired cocktails. Had a Calvados Old Fashioned and a friend had the Chambery Negroni (white). The space is gorgeous and the bar was nearly full when they opened at 4pm. Certainly not to be missed if your looking for an excellent cocktail in Belltown! Lots of unique spirits too!

My wife and I just stopped by on a whim.
We are happy we did.
We were greated with a smile that lead to a nice conversation with the owner/bartender.
The wine selection was limited but excellent. I had their version of Manhattan and it was fantastic.
I highly recommend this bar.
If I lived in Seattle I would move to this neighborhood.
Now I just need to convince all these restaurants and bars to come to San Jose.

Popped in recently and was greeted with a musty malodorous smell, likely due to unclean bar mats and generally poor cleaning habits. Worse yet, when I asked a bartender for a Japanese whisky recommendation, he pretentiously asked about my price range. Now, while I'm no Amazonian tech bro, I'm extremely fortunate enough to have enough disposable income to cover most beverage costs, and having worked as a bartender while in law school, I can assure you that this isn't a common nor acceptable question to ask of patrons. The fact that I was the only non-white person in the bar certainly doesn't help his motivations either...

I've had drinks on the menu and specially crafted drinks-they do them all! It's a nice space to pop in for a pre-or post-dinner drink, chat with a knowledgeable bartender or hang out with a few friends. Not a lot of space for bigger groups and no good way to reconfigure seating. No kitchen so no real food, just some light snacky things. My favorite seats are at the end of the bar in the back or at the short end of the bar counter. Great watching.
Fabulous place to grab a few phenomenal craft cocktails! The Chambery Negroni was a perfectly balanced thirst quencher. I'll be coming back for sure.

The place was alright. Nothing really stood out to me and the cocktails are on the more pricier side for what it is $16-$22. The waitress wasn't that friendly and looked like she didn't want to be there. The vibe is chill thou and relatively not that busy considering it being a Saturday night . They also charged us 20% gratuity for a party of four and we just got only drinks. I've never been charged gratuity for a place that just served cocktails. I got an old fashion which wasn't bad, but it was hard to overlook that other aspects of the experience.

My experience of this bar is that I have been transported in time. The selection of Japanese single malt whiskey is transcendental. I tried the Nobushi and The Matsui. Amazing! I can't wait until the food comes! Really lovely bartenders. It's a sweet spot.

I was traveling alone for business and wanted a relaxed, upbeat place to grab dinner and a drink at the bar. This place fit the bill with great food and a fun vibe. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when they mailed the shopping bag I left behind back to me in Philadelphia.
I will definitely make sure to stop back in the next time I'm in town.

Came here tonight for an impromptu dinner date and left very satisfied. This place, besides being slightly hard to find, is the cutest little nook in downtown Seattle. You feel as if you're in a completely different world vs the touristy pike place corridor.
We arrived around 6:55 PM and were pleasantly surprised it was still happy hour. The deal is actually quite good - $4 off cocktails! I ordered a mezcal cocktail (what's new?) and husband ordered old fashioned. We asked for them less sweet and they turned out great. Mine had a ginger syrup which was different vs most mezcal cocktails I've ordered!
For food, ordered brussel sprouts and beet deviled eggs to start, and split the mussels and burger for the mains. The brussel sprouts were recommended by the server. They were good, not great. Felt like I could make them myself and wouldn't order again for $12. The deviled egg was the perfect party in my mouth and something I had never tasted before! It had a slice of anchovy in it which sounds odd but tasted amazing. Burger was perfectly cooked with a nice crispy bun. The fries were cooked crisp to perfection. Mussels were in perhaps the best sauce I've ever had.
Overall food was so tasty, service was quick and attentive despite restaurant being completely full, and menu comprehensive! Will come back for sure - especially now that we know HH runs until 7 pm on weekdays!

I came to Zig Zag for dinner and had a great experience in the end. My visit didn't start off great, though. The service was slow. On the night I was at Zig Zag, the restaurant was no more than 50% full. Nevertheless, I still waited nearly 25 minutes for my food.
That being said, the food was definitely worth the wait. I had the Wild Mushroom Farro, and it was the best farro I've ever had in my life! The flavor was completely balanced, with no one ingredient dominating the dish. I was also impressed with how they incorporated huckleberry into the dish. On top of that, the sauce - which I'm told was just vegetable stock with butter - was phenomenal. My only minor complaint was that some of the cauliflower was burnt. But the dish was so perfect in every other way that I can definitely overlook the cauliflower.

Met a friend here for some cocktails and it was really nice. I appreciated the vibe and that it wasn't super crazy loud. We got to hang out at a standing table and order our first drink before a table opened up, but it wasn't long until one did even though it was Friday night. The drink selection was awesome, and everything we ordered was great (and cleverly named). We also enjoyed our reasonably priced olives and Marcona almonds... good food, great drinks, nice vibe...

Came here for a drink Saturday night.
Cool, chill, vibe. Super low key. Little bit hidden but follow the signs down the stairs. We didn't have to wait and were seated right away. We got two cocktails and be warned they are super strong.
They have a large selection of different kinds of drinks as well as a late night menu. We didn't try any of the food but it all looked amazing.

Wow what a great find on a work trip! There's so many places to choose from right here in the Pike Place Market area. Lucky me, I landed at Zig Zag!
Service from Anna and Erin was spot on a dm fabulous. Technically, I believe Anna was my server yet Erin bought several things and was very attentive as well. It kinda worked as tag team service and that was just fabulous!
All the food was spot on, they had plenty of gluten-free options and the happy hour wine was very good.
My only complaint is that I ate way too much because the food was so great! My hotel is around one plus miles ...uphill. Ugh. It'll be good for me, right?!? Super good, I'll be back!

This place savings grace is there zig zag burger with the fried egg. That was absolutely delicious. The yolk just gushed out everywhere. Felt like I was eating a breakfast sandwich one minute and then the next second a bacon cheese burger. Also the cheese just oozed out of everywhere. Very delicious. The fries were a bit too salty for my taste though. Score: 5/5
Their snacks were very boring. The baguette with the cultured butter was good though. It comes toasted but my only compliant is that I eat too fast and the outside of the bread is too hard :(
The cheese platter was smelly!!!! It's not my cup of tea but I'm sure other people will love it

As a tourist to Pike Market, it was fun to dig out this hidden gem. My bar tender friend suggest me here for cock tails. And yes, def a great spot for happy hour drinks then a walk around to enjoy the sunset.
The drink menu is huge, and the bartender is quite knowledgable about almost everything. I like the atmosphere too, as a weekday early evening, it's already a full house, towns of locals and tourists like me here for their happy hour.
I would def come back and try more items.

What a hidden(?) gem!
Great cozy restaurant and their service was fantastic. Small selections of wines but they were really good wines and reasonable.
Ordered A charcuterie plate, fried oysters, burgers and mussels. The plate was so tasty and the meats were perfectly cured, their mousse was just melt in my mouth.
Mussels were so plumped and juicy. Creamy curry? Sauce was as good as mussels. Their burgers were seasoned right and right size. Not to small or big.
Fried oysters were my fave. Small size and sweet. Everything we ordered was just divine. I would go back there for HH next time. Sooo laidback vibes and the foods were excellent!!

Looking for a classy, undercover jazz cafe with dim lighting, friendly staff and sleek design that totally takes you away from everyday life? Your answer: Zig Zag Cafe. Skillfully tucked away from Pike's Place market, close to the waterfront, Zig Zag offered superbly crafted cocktails and the perfect aperitif options to take a breather prior to continuing our tour of the city.
The lighting is dimly lit with old antique bottles of wine (some unopened) and cozy red lighting that makes you feel stuck in time. Each table is decked out with a candle as humble chandeliers decorate the ceilings.
We ordered a dish of deliciously tasting green & black olives with the perfect amount of garlic and zest. Complimented by a dish of pita bread and heated hummus (spiced with paprika and garlic), the food was delicious! For my cocktail, I ordered an aperol spritz - aperol campari mixed with good quality prosecco and orange zest with enough punch to keep me going.
Overall outstanding dining experience. Highly recommend! A+

I had a great experience here. I've heard a lot of good things about Zig Zig and I'm so happy I've finally made my way there to experience it myself. I ate the fries and deviled eggs off their late night menu. I loved the sultry smokey ambiance and the bartender was great. I just loved watching the art that goes into crafting their perfect cocktails. I had a simple Moscow mule, perhaps next time I'll try one of their house cocktails. The deviled eggs were so yummy! Maybe I'll be back soon to try more food!

Went with a small group of friends last night and we were seated pretty quickly. Drinks aren't super cheap but you definitely get your money's worth. Shared a squid pro quo and it was delicious. Only negative I would mention is that we were sitting near the door and it was a bit chilly.
Nice atmosphere, wait staff prompt and friendly. Food was good. The fried clams and mussels were great. The whisky drinks even better. I love the red lighting and music.

Even though I'm a life long Seattleite, last night was my first time to the Zig Zag Café. The area around Pike Place is incredible now that the viaduct has been demolished, and I hope local businesses benefit from that. I loved the Zig Zag Café, excellent drinks, good food and great staff. Our server was very friendly and very accommodating when I realized too late that I had ordered something that didn't agree with my tastes. Much appreciated, and I won't wait so long for my next visit!

Dark and cozy, with delicious bites and strong cocktails. We had deviled eggs, the pork skins, and almonds and olives for snacks before dinner at Cutters. The eggplant dip with the pork skins was the highlight. It was silky smooth, and not like baba ganouj, if that's what you were thinking. There's an off-menu cocktail-with-a-story, if you're interested. Called the Chas, it's bourbon, Cointreau, and other potent tastiness. A Pike Place institution, you must come to Zig Zag if you're in Seattle.

We stumbled upon this restaurant walking from pikes place down the water before heading over the smith tower. Zig Zag has the best mixologist in Seattle with a wide range of spirits. The food was wonderful, the staff was great and it's in a good location. The mixed drinks were excellent. An eggplant dish was superb, perfectly cooked and with the right garnish. The place is very cozy and very relaxing. The server was great in giving suggestions and the drinks were great.

BEST HAPPY HOUR. So many fun drinks and yummy snacks. They have one of the most extensive cocktail menus I've ever seen and it was hard to decide on just one (okay, two) to try. For snacks we had the fries which have a great balance of salt and dress black pepper and the crispy pig skin which came with a fantastic aioli.
We arrived around 5:30 and were able to get a seat on their small patio, but the inside looked nice too if the patio is full.
Definitely a place to visit and hang around. The barman was the best. And I don't even drink!
Great place for a drink at dusk....very nice selection of drinks and food. Bartenders very knowledgeable
Had appetizers and drinks with a friend. Tasty all around! Fun little spot and nice patio area.

This has got to be one of my favorite Thai places in Seattle now! All the dishes were so well made and presentation was gorgeous!
Service is also great and friendly! Stop by here if you're in Wallingford especially on Monday's or Saturday's because they have live shows and happy hour for great prices!
TIP: order the roast duck curry and the Tom yum pizza!! You won't be disappointed!

Gorgeous atmosphere and phenomenal plating!
Definitely a positive experience here. Great food and huge quantities! The menu items are mixed with traditional Thai food you would normally see on any Thai restaurant menus and some modern dishes. I ordered the duck curry and the Pad Thai, they were the ultimate comfort food and the curry was amazing.
Hope to come back soon and try out other dishes.

For some time, I'd been a bit of a purist. If it's not cooked like this or has these ingredients, then it's not authentic!
But the more I've been open about trying different fusion/experimental dishes, the more my attitude has just become - if it's good, it's good.
Sisi Kay is a place that I was initially skeptical about. The fancy interior, the fancy drinks, the menu with Tom Yum pizza and Linguini Tom Kha - excuse me?!
But I haven't had any of this before and besides... I was intrigued. And oh-so curious.
I came here with two other friends and we were able to try a number of dishes. We ordered the following...
Spring Rolls: Pretty standard but still good!
Blistered okra: Solid texture and tasty with a good kick.
Soft shell crab salad: I LOVED the texture of the crab in this salad, and such a meaty crab! The salad itself was also great.
Tom Yum pizza: This is exactly how I would expect a Tom Yum pizza to taste. Creative and delicious!
Drunken noodles: Once again, so tasty!
Every dish was a hit and I was pleasantly surprised. Admittedly it's a little pricey, but I wasn't too bothered by that. I am absolutely coming back here to try their Linguini next time!

Originally drawn to this place because of the architecture and interior design, I'm happy to say the food is just as amazing as the ambiance. The lower area is personally designed for casual dine outs with an open bar that offers a wide variety of drinks (and a happy hour that is soon to be coming!!). The upstairs has a much more formal atmosphere, perfect for a family setting or a romantic dinner for two.
Food comes out hot and delicious in fair time and the flavor is packed in every bite- you can really taste the authentic Thai spices and seasonings. The portions are huge and great to share with friends. Some of my favorite dishes have to include the pad see ew and garlic chicken. The tom yum pizza appetizer is perfect for seafood lovers like me and the fried tofu is also an absolute must. My friends and I finished everything. Would recommend eating here to anyone :-)

Food and drinks were really good , pork satay was my favorite and surprisingly tomkha pasta and green curry pizza were a stars of the night, happy hour price for food and drinks really reasonable , very good

We got word that May got a new facelift and sprucing up of the menu so my mom and I decided to check it out. Found out it's still the same owner/kitchen staff and most importantly the SAME delicious Pud Thai!! Presentation and taste still the same just as we remembered.
We also tried their new appetizer larb chicken wings and it was actually really good. It had the dressing of larb and the roasted rice powder but with the mini chicken wings which I thought went together really well. Beef pad Seaw also a must try, sweet soy sauce wide rice noodle and Chinese broccoli. Yummy!
Service was nice and prompt and super friendly waiter. They had a little rush when we got in but it seemed like they were able to handle it pretty well with just the two of them. A nice little gem in the Wallingford neighborhood. Can't wait to come back to try their Happy hour!

Sisi Kay Thai Eatery & Bar was DELICIOUS! My boyfriend and I came for their Happy Hour. Upon entering, the design and cleanliness was fantastic. We had exceptional service by Darko. He was friendly and took very good care of us and made sure we had a good dining experience. If you stop by during Happy Hour, as you should, I recommend these dishes:
* Calamari
* Satay Boran ( The peanut sauce and pickled cucumber was deloycious! )
* Tom Yum Pizza
* Devil's Wings
I also had a Cucumber Mint drink... can I say AMAZING and refreshing?!
You WILL NOT be disappointed.

I really loved May Thai restaurant and lounge and am happy to see it hasn't gone away, but instead is just under new branding. I usually get the Pad Thai but I decided to try the Crispy Garlic Chicken this time around and I was not disappointed. The flavor was great and the chicken was perfectly crispy and juicy!
Definitely will need to come back and just double check if the Pad Thai is still as great as before.

Probably some of the best Thai food I've had in Seattle. Went here for dinner after reading other Yelp reviews during their soft opening. We ordered the phad see Lew and garlic chicken. Both dishes were delicious and the noodles were particularly bomb. The new decor both upstairs and downstairs was so cool - it looked like it had been designed by an interior design show on Netflix. The staff was all super friendly and asked us how everything was. Keep up the good work!

I love the idea of Pizza they combine with Thai as PizzaTomyum and Pizzagreencurry. I wasn't sure but I did try.Oh gosh it's amazing and yummy!!! If you like to have a chill time good service, good drinks. They have happy hour of too. Happy to have place like this in Seattle. Different type of Thai food.

I tried this News Thai restaurant and the food was really delicious! I love Thai food and I would definitely come back to this restaurant. The service was really top notch as well and everyone was so friendly. I really like the ambiance of the place too. The decor in my opinion was very inviting and refreshing.
THIS IS A MUST TRY RESTAURANT! 5 stars!!!

Just ate here with my boyfriend who can't have gluten. The waiter promised that the dishes (Phad Thai, pineapple fried rice and eggplant) could be prepared without gluten. I enjoyed the dishes. But my boyfriend felt unwell as we were near finishing our meals complaining of the same symptoms that he recognized from having had gluten.
Called the waiter staff and they were quick to say everything was prepared gluten-free...wonder if the cooks could confirm or were aware? But he identifies his current symptoms and know almost immediately when he's eaten gluten.

Very delicious food and good portions. We had the spaghetti pud kee mow which was a nice twist to the original dish that normally has the wide rice noodles. Although I prefer the flavors to be strong, the spices were a bit too subtle for me. The place was very nicely decorated and the bar and cocktails looked very interesting. Server showed us the happy hour menu and for sure we will be back for that.

Great food and service.
My husband and I had chicken pad thai and crispy garlic chicken- both were delicious!!
Staff was very friendly. Restaurant itself was very clean and had a welcoming atmosphere :)

Great ambience, good service and delicious foods.
We ordered pizza tom yum, pad thai beef, crab fried rice and chicken larb. Foods took a little time to arrive but overall is a great visit. And Maphraw - coconut is a good cocktail to try.
O.M.G !! This place is freaking Great !! Iam big on customer service and it was wonderful!! Thanks Michael for the great Welcome

Tried this place out cause of the good reviews and beautiful exterior. The interior is perfectly designed and the food surpassed our expectations. We had the Tom yum pizza, pad thai, penang curry, and ocean spice. We were a little skeptical of the pizza but it works so well. Pad thai was unique in presentation and also delicious. The seafood and fried basil in the ocean spice dish are excellent. Definitely coming back here.

Just had dinner at Sisi Kay with my in-laws. I can't say enough good things. The Thai style wing appetizer was excellent. Light, with a balance of sweet, sour, spicy and umami. I could have eaten three orders. The spinach dip was a non-sequitur on an otherwise Thai menu, but was also very good. Fresh spinach with a pleasant but not overwhelming cheese topping, all piping hot, with a good toast accompaniment.
Our entrees were all stellar. They have maintained the May Thai style table side Pad Thai service, along with other Thai classics. All were well done, with fresh ingredients, and the proper level of spice. Portions were generous.
For my midwestern family, this was an excellent intro to what the PNW has to offer in terms of Thai. I will be coming back, and recommend it to anyone. On par with Buddha Ruksa or May Kitchen and Bar.

This place is amazing! My girlfriend and I came here because we heard about the recent opening, and the fried tofu, pad Thai, and green curry did not disappoint. The portions are generous and the staff is extra kind.
Recently ate here and really enjoyed the new design of this restaurant. The food was quick, tasted amazing and the service was great.

Hail to the chef. Why are these restaurants only in Seattle?
It's as if all these great chefs slaved away in the industry for years, and one day woke up and said, you know what? I'm going to buy a small place, house, bottom floor of a building with three chiropractic offices, and just run my own small kitchen where I can float casually between the pan my guests tables, regaling them with stories of my cooking career and adventures, all the while wowing them with absolutely incredible dishes.
honestly, just order whatever you want. some of the best gnocchi with lamb we can remember, but the osso buco. This was the best I have had since Francesco's off Hegenberger in Oakland that closed in 2016 after 47 years.

I would give them 3 1/2 stars if I could but they were A-OK!
We came here one night and were seated on the back patio right away.
The service was super friendly. A couple people touched our table throughout the night to make sure all was well. That is always appreciated.
The food was OK. We got a lamb rack with gnocchi and salmon pasta. The gnocchi was really chewy and just inedible but the lamb was very tasty! The salmon pasta really wasn't anything to rave about. Nothing stuck out about it, pretty basic.
Overall, the outside seating was nice, the service was friendly and the food was ok! Nothing to complain about it and it was a nice experience.
They did give complimentary tiramisu at the end and that was nice.

I just wanted to update in case the restaurant owners look at this - - I really like this restaurant, but I have to agree with some others that the ambience could be a nicer... Maybe less harsh lighting, candles? I can't recall if there was music. I mention this because I was thinking of this place for Valentine's day dinner, but I decided against it only because of the not-very-romantic ambience. If that's not what you need with dinner, though, then I recommend this restaurant!

Had a date night and was craving Italian. The decor was bland, but was hoping the food would make up for it. Ordered the chicken marsala and ravioli. The chicken was not fresh, was bland, and had the consistency of rubber. The ravioli was okay, but lacked any flavor. Overall disappointed.

We had a great time at Zouave's restaurant a couple weeks ago. The food was DELICIOUS and plentiful. We had a great conversation with the chef, and the server was also great. They seemed very knowledgable about the dishes and the wines of Italy as well as cuisine from other parts of the Mediterranean.
I highly recommend this intimate little restaurant if your looking for a special experience!

We came in wanting to like this place and left feeling just... sad.
The food is awful. Like reheated chain restaurant quality. Your wine choices are clearly so bad they won't provide the brand label on the menu. The decor I would describe as Italian themed man-cave.
I'm writing this review to maybe help correct, as other reviews have noted, what seems like a high level of fake positive reviews for this restaurant.
I hope the owner can improve this place, maybe limiting the menu options would help.

I walked in to the cute restaurant and went for a sweet spot in the back porch on a warm day. My husband and I were excited by this charming little spot. Cute, cozy with a great neighborhood feel. We ordered wine, both of us thought was Meh... Their house was not our taste (me White, He red)
Then the food came. We got the antipasto plate that was lacking variety. Then I had Gnocci and he had the Chicken Marsala. Both were bland, the chicken was not moist and kind of rubbery. The Gnocci was chewy too. The service was slow.
Sad to say, I wanted to like this cute little spot but we won't be back.

Hidden Italian gourmet! Nice patio and great food. Met the chef and he was very friendly with suggestions on the food. The mushroom soup was really good! My dish the chicken prosciutto was a bit saltier than I like, but was still delicious!

We decided to come here because of the reviews on Yelp. It was a bit empty when we walked in so we decided to sit out in the patio. We stared at the menu for quite some time as we didn't know what any of the dishes looked like (I'm a visual-kind-of-person). After Googling some dishes and speaking with our server, she suggested the Lamb Ragout Penne Pasta (minus the lamb ragout-vegetarian option) and the Gnocchi. We waited almost an hour for our food, which we weren't too upset about because the chef's wife mentioned that the bread and pasta sauces are all made from scratch.
