I've been hearing through the coffee vine that I ought to check out this joint, but kept sleeping on it, though I regret it, because this establishment brings life to Beacon Hill!
I visited on a Sunday afternoon, and upon arrival the energy was very welcoming and engaging. The bartender was super tentative with greeting customers, and the restaurant manager, Brandon was incredible by helping introduce me to the menu. It amazes me how the team works together to create new pizza creations weekly and crafts them together for the menu!
During my visit I tried;
1. Arugula & Beets Salad
2. Reverse Marg Pizza Slice
So the salad literally made my mouth water as I was eating! I loved how fresh the greens were, and the beets were pickled to perfection! To top it off was the the blue or Gorgonzola cheese, which was enough to get me really comfortable before my slice. Yum!
The pizza slice I had was called the "Reverse Marg" which came with pesto base, fresh mozzarella, and fresh tomatoes! Yoooo, the pizza was amazing, from the first bite to the last. Those fresh flavors came together so greatly, and I seriously enjoyed the caramelized crust. Also, I couldn't help but compliment how I felt the pesto was single handily made for ME! Lol.
Beyond the delicious food, this place does special events, live music, and even trivia nights! So check it out!
I'm really happy to have found an incredible new favorite in my neighborhood! Thank you Breezy Town Pizza!!

Great pan pizza, not deep dish like Chicago deep dish. Crust is crunchy but the dough puffs up too much which detracts from the flavor. Sauce is not super sweet like other pizza places. The flavor profile balance of cheese and sauce could improve. Acidic sweet sauce and bland cheese. Salty pepperoni so it balances the dough well. Cheesy and greasy. Very heavy with ciabatta crust and greasy pepperoni.
Delicious! You'll have to wait about 25 minutes if they aren't too busy so don't come starving. Their Ceasar salad is good and is a decent portion size. We also ordered the popcorn which was pretty good too, but it could have used more cheddar flavor.

This place has ruined regular pizza for me. It's about a 45 minute trip for me to get a pie from BTP. I haven't had a bad pizza here and I've tried quite a few of their options. They do a Combination of Detroit still crust with a Chicago style topping set up. It's so good!
If you think the price is steep, I promise these pizzas are enormous and there will be leftovers.
They are located in a bar, so it's not really a "eat in with the family" environment, but it's a nice little spot with some great street parking. Showing up a little early and having a quick cocktail is a bonus if you have the time.
I really cannot recommend it enough.
Not your average pizza. Heard about this pizza joint from my buddy Gabriel. More like angel Gabriel now. Deep crust and solid flavor. Best slice I've had in months, maybe years.

Super high hopes when we discovered this on Yelp today. We've been to Windy City Pie twice and absolutely love it! So, we jumped on the chance to try out BTP tonight for dinner. Like others have said, parking is tricky. Got there when the place was pretty empty, only one customer ahead of me picking up to go. I grabbed my pizza (Pete and Pete) and got the instruction to hold the pizza flat and was on my home...a good 20-30mins. Mid-way, (hubs driving), I started to feel moisture in the upper right corner of the box...and it started feel more and more wet. Weird. When we got home, I opened the box and saw that even though I held said pizza flat as instructed, the toppings all slid forward because the pizza was undone and really wet. Oh, and as the British Baking Show loves to say...soggy (raw) bottom! Not good for pizza, yeah? We tried to remedy by trying to put couple of pieces in Air Fryer--much better. Toppings were spot on and like the original Windy City Pie (thus 3 stars)--yum. Off night? Not sure. Worth the drive? We're thinking about it...

Lives up to the hype! Exceeds the hype. I ordered to go and experienced the heaven in my own home. I generally am a thin crust person and after living in NY I can get real picky about dough and sauce... but the photos and the reviews brought me in and I can say my Seattle pizza life has been changed forever.
The Pepperoni pizza. perfectly crisped cups of pepperoni to accent the rest of the pizza's perfection. Somehow the taste of pepperoni permeated the sourdough crust to the bottom of the pie, making every bite savory and delicious. The sauce is perfectly spicy and rich with flavor. the crispy cheese crust is faint-worthy. the cheese sort of pooled to the middle of the pie but I can't say that I missed it in other bites, every bite was literally the best bite. The dough is outstanding. I don't quite understand it but it is noteworthy. And quite filling, but not in a way that makes one irritated like I am full of empty fluff bread. No No, I was full in the most satisfied way.
I ordered a veggie special slice (white sauce, sweet potatoes, fennel) to go as well, but it could not touch the pepperoni so after two bites I saved it for today's breakfast with an egg. I reheated on a cast iron skillet on medium low, and it was delicious as well. Kale caesar was a bit dry, but super fresh and with the lemon, actually balanced out the grease from the pizza well. It would have been cool to throw an anchovy on there, but I get that there are more anchovy haters than lovers. Between Breezy Town for medium dish and Humble Pie for thin crust I can count on these two as monthly standards as long as I live in Beacon Hill.

Not only what is this place dark and divey you have to be the one to place your order or get your own drink at the bar. The deep dish style did not appeal to me, because it was just too greasy, and over done on the edges. Even the pepperoni on top was burnt. Would not go out of my way to frequent this place.

One of the best pizza in Seattle, hands down! Im a thin crust guy but this medium deep dish is so bomb. It isn't straight Chicago deep dish so it's not as filling. The crust is what sets it apart from the rest. Dubbed as Detroit style pizza, the crust is crispy burnt cheese. That's not all, it's topped with crispy pepperoni. So each bite is super flavorful, oily, crunchy and cheesy. I usually just sit there and would eat half the pie and contemplate if I want to eat the whole thing.
This place is tucked away in the back of the lockout lounge on Beacon. Order in advance and you can just pick it up. They even deliver. Since I live so close, this was my go to pizza spot.

Breezy Town Pizza is a sister location to Windy City Pizza. If you've been to Windy City Pizza, you already know what to expect. Deep Dish Heaven.
I came with a friend and split the classic Pepperoni Paint Job pizza. They start with a sourdough crust with a ring of caramelized cheese around the edge. It might look burnt, but it's actually the best part of the pizza. The pizza is topped with Wisconsin brick and mozzarella cheese and two kinds of pepperoni. The little pepperoni slices curl up into perfect crispy cups of meat goodness. Excellent red sauce that's sweet and a little acidic.
The pizza is ideal for 2-3 people. They also offer pizza by the slice and some interesting brunch pizzas during the weekends.
Breezy Town is located inside the Clock Out Lounge. You order at the back of the bar and can order drinks at the bar or from the staff. There's plenty of seating and the inside of the bar is nice and clean. If you love Deep Dish Midwestern Style pizza, you owe it to yourself to check it out.

So glad we finally tried this place. Everything was delicious, the service was great, and the restaurant is just the right mix of classy but laid back.
We had the oysters, fried tomatillos, pickles, and king crab corndog to start. The oysters and tomatillos were fantastic, but the corndog was out of this world. I will come back just for that corndog. I cant even describe how much joy you get with every bite. We went with the crab spaghetti and the roast duck as our mains, and they were equally delightful. Everything we had was simple, but done really well, which can be hard to do.
We finished off with some champagne and the olive oil brownie, a must have if you've got a sweet tooth or are a fan of crackerjacks (they make their own and sprinkle it on top and its rad).
Our waitress was super attentive and gave us some great recommendations, and definitely made the experience 10/10.
We will definitely be back to try the new things on their menu, and about a dozen more corndogs.

My husband and I thought we would try this place for brunch. First thoughts? The menu was a little precious, but we figured we give it a try. We should have know what we were in for when we took our first sip of coffee. So. Fricking. Bad. This is Seattle, man! We have really great coffee here! This was... memorably bad.
We discussed just paying for the coffee and leaving, but how bad could it get? Oh, honey...
I went ahead and ordered the Steak and Fried Egg and my husband ordered eggs, bacon and hash browns. Simple. Nothing too difficult. Or so we thought.
The bacon was burned and the hash browns were severely under cooked. And what's up with the pickles on top? I know the menu says pickled red onion, but pickled cucumbers?? The eggs were fine. A little overcooked, but edible. Sadly, the scrambled eggs were the high point of the meal.
When my dish was set in front of me, it looked okay, at first glance. Until I noticed the cook on the steak. I ordered it medium rare and what I got was just this side of breathing. The server was very apologetic, and they took everything back for a do over. When I finally got my dish back, and moved the eggs off the top of it, I saw that the steak had a giant ribbon of fat running down the center. Pale white, greasy, and altogether unappetizing. It was really bad. I'm not sure who they have to do their quality control, but this was an epic fail.
At this point, the only thing I can say was that they didn't screw up my husband's eggs to terribly. We did get apologies and only had to pay for his eggs and the coffee, so there's that. Will we ever give them another shot? Chances are very very slim.

My husband and I came this past Saturday and I'm not sure if it's extreme to say that this is our new favorite restaurant in Seattle. The service was pleasant and attentive. We also had great food recommendations. The ambience was casual but sort of LA with plants everywhere, even in the bathrooms.
I ordered the mezcal cocktail, which was literally on fire. The smoky smell was a bit overwhelming but the drink tasted delicious. Appetizers, we ordered oysters, fried egg plant and clams. For the main dish we split the crab chitarra, which a nice server explained was the word for guitar because the spaghetti was like guitar strings. The pasta had a perfect spice to it and I thought about it most days since I've had it.
Overall I think the food was all thoughtfully made, service was excellent, and menu was well priced. We will be back very soon.

Came for brunch Saturday morning around 10:30am and was seated right away, wasn't crazy busy or anything. I don't know if it was just our server or the way their service typically, is but beware if you want a quick brunch...
My partner ordered the special which was prime rib hash which could have been amazing but was sadly dry and overcooked. The sauce was bright brought everything together though there could have been more of it. I ordered the wild rice and quinoa bowl which was tasty! I liked the pickled golden beets.
The dish that caught us by surprise though was the horchata pain perdue! It was massive and so delicious. The bread was so soft and the flavors were amazing altogether. It's definitely a sharing dish unless you have a massive breakfast sweet tooth!
I'd come back to try out their dinner menu. It's definitely a cute space but hopefully our super slow service was just a one time thing.

We were quite excited to try Eight Row reading about it on Eater. Well well well. It was disappointing. For the 2 of us, we ordered 4 dishes.
-Fried Eggplants: yummm! I do like this dish and recommend it.
-Rockfish Ceviche: can use more brightness and acid. Good amount of heat from jalapeños. The fish itself has a bit funny texture like not good cut.
-Pumpkin Gnocchi: great flavors. I really enjoy the mushrooms, roasted and pickled! Gnocchis were really super soft. At first I thought it was raw! I recommend this dish as well.
-Spaghetti Alla Chitarra: Dungeness crab spaghetti. This dish is the most disappointing of all the 4 we ordered. Pasta cooked nice and al dente. Can't barely see any crab meats. They were very small and mushy crab that looked and tasted like canned crab! Not worth $25. We didn't order any alcohol. Our total before tips was $90.
Atmosphere of restaurant is very comfortable, modern and lovely.
Service was good. Staffs : nice and helpful.
Great big space for big group.
Lots of street parking.
Overall, we are not in a hurry to come back to this restaurant. We can get better food with $90.

Oh Eight Row.... how I wanted to love you. And maybe someday I will! But for now... its 3 stars.
Came in for dinner on a Friday night a few weeks back. Kind of late, around 8:30 so it wasn't too busy. Décor is cute. I like that they've brightened the place up from the previous Lucia vide. Initial greeting from the hostess was friendly and we were seated promptly (had a reservation). My overall feeling on this place is that it has good potential and a lot of room to grow. The menu reflects a well thought out approach but some of the flavors in the dishes just didn't quite make sense for me. I love simple, I love complex, I love great food. But if you're going to attempt to elevate your menu with more complexity, you need to do it right. If the components in the dish don't jive, its just an over complicated plate which wasn't well executed.
We ordered 2 appetizers, 2 entrees and dessert. Food reviews as follows:
Seared Calamari - Not your typical, which was exciting. This was calamari stuffed with chorizo. That part was good! I enjoyed the flavor combo. The accompaniments however (carrot puree, mint), didn't seem to pair well in my opinion. Room for improvement.
Black Cod Ceviche - Enjoyed this, fish was fresh and it did have an overall "bright" theme to the dish. Some of the pickled items and the overuse of mint didn't quite make sense with the other items but I understand the direction they were going in.
Duck Breast - Gahhh. Was so on the fence with this dish. I wanted to love it because the duck was actually cooked perfectly. The skin, my fav was on point but it was way over salted :( and I can handle salt, love salt but even this was a little much for me. The rest of the dish was good overall, nothing which made me scream wow, but nice texture combos with the wild rice and the mostarda and decent depth of flavor.
Hanger Steak - Best part of this dish was the sunchokes. Steak and chimichurri were underwhelming and under seasoned. Maybe just not the spot for steak.
Olive Oil Brownie - Im a sucker for dessert! and I love olive oil anything. The server sold us on this, indicating that the olive oil kept the brownie super moist, almost gooey. Uh, not the case. This baby was dry. But luckily the sweet cream ice cream was delightful and gave the brownie some moisture assistance.
This was a tough review to right because at first glance I think this place should be 5 stars and I can appreciate the creative dishes their going for. Just didn't feel the value was there at this time. I do think i'll give this place another try (and hopefully update my review) as they do serve brunch and i'm always down for a great brunch.
Until next time Eight Row!

I live a block away, so when Eight Row popped up I visited the first week. I've also been back a couple more times for dinner and once for brunch. It's a real gem. It's nice to have something a little more elevated in the Greenlake area!
Some dishes I highly recommend are the Venison + Pork Sausage, the Honey Glazed Half Smoked Chicken, the local lettuces (such a perfect yet simple salad to pair with anything you order!) and you can't go wrong with the oysters- very fresh and perfectly chilled.
The hangar steak and crab salad was just OK to me- I felt like my steak was pretty tough to chew and didn't seem like it was salted let alone seasoned. Beautiful presentation nevertheless.
Their wine selection is alright. I believe there was only one option by the glass for each type of wine which is fine- but I'd be pleased if they rotate or swap those out because the Cabernet Sauvignon option they offered didn't wow me. Their Rozella drink is delicious if you're in the mood for something fruity. It's just the right amount of sweet/tart/refreshing/satisfying. The Bellini at brunch is great too!
If you're there for brunch I suggest the Horchata Pain Perdu for something sweet- it's amazing! Tip: split it with someone. It's massive and even half of it left me feeling quite indulged. The fried oyster hash is also good and a very unique dish at that! Loved both. Can't wait to try more brunch items!
I've always had pretty great service here. The staff is polite and professional and you can tell they believe in the food and the chef. The space is bright and clean, it could even stand to be a little more dimly lit in the evenings in my opinion but that's no reason to complain. Solid 4 stars and I could see a few tweaks earning it a 5th star easily!
Will be back soon to try the squash and pumpkin dishes yum

I think it has a lot of potential.
The hostess was incredibly kind and got us going with some cocktails while we waited for a table.
Everyone said the best dish was the eggplant so we got that and some broccoli to start. The eggplant was fine, I think it was overhyped. However, the brócoli was killer. It rested on a smearing of tarragon alioli. It was perfect for the charred brócoli.
This was followed by the crab noodles (reaaaaally salty), whole trout (good but missed the mark big time with the skin being soft and not crispy) and ended with the brick chicken which was actually really juicy and flavorful.
It was good but not cheap, would like to go back for happy hour.

Cute hipster restaurant for brunch! Food was amazing and would be a great place for a date or girls outing. Would highly recommend their food and coffee. Their black coffee and waffles were pretty amazing.

Well what can I say... great location, elegant decor, beautiful cocktail list and awesome service, yet overpriced, mediocre food. Understand that I am buying the atmosphere but I feel pressured not to give a better rating but perhaps the anticipation to the taste is too high. We had the crab salad and quinoa bowl - really not worth it for the price. sorry.

Stoped in with a friend for her birthday. We started with the cornuts and it was okay but nothing spectacular. I ordered a drink on happy hour and it was okay but very strong whiskey taste ( if you love whiskey it was the cherry sour and you would probably love it ) Good deal considering only two drinks on happy hour.
I ordered the pickle appetizer and it took over 30 min to come out, the manager said she would comp due to the time. My friend ordered the pasta and she really liked it. I ordered a salad and it was tasty but again a little underwhelmed but the shaved vegetables were unique and good. The pickles finally came and it was all different veggies pickled and the green beans were a flavor explosion so delicious spicy and pickled.
We ended with a piece of cherry pie and it was delicious neither too sweet or tangy. The manager brought out ice cream from Lopez Island for my friends birthday and it was yummy. Overall a 4 star experience it was expensive and the happy hour menu underwhelming the pickles were 10 star with all the different flavors and love pickled vegetables. I will be back excited this is in the hood the hangar steak a nearby table looked delicious.

Sadly this turned out to be a disappointing dining experience.
Initially we were excited by the prospect of a new green lake restaurant, and all the more excited when we saw it was getting well reviewed.
We decided to try to it out on a Saturday night as we wanted to go somewhere local. Service was welcoming and the space is really nice. Felt quite summery with all the plants.
I had the local lettuce salad with champagne vinaigrette. It was so bitter that I could only eat half of it. The endives had somehow made everything in the salad really bitter including the shaved carrot. Very strange. Definitely a flavor fail.
For my main I had the pumpkin gnocchi which was generally pretty good though undersalted (which is not something I normally complain about).
So overall didn't love my meal and my husband felt similarly about his meal. The other big issue is the price. It cost $170 incl service for two starters, two mains and a cocktail and 2 glasses of wine. That seems an awful lot for a local restaurant. Especially when the ambitiousness of their menu does not meet expectations.
Nice environment! Went here for dessert with my friends and had a great time. I wIll say that I went a tad underdressed so feel free to throw on a sweater instead of a sweatshirt.

WOW! This was a total surprise. I'm so excited that this new place is in our hood! I was sad when Lucia went away, not because it was that tasty but it was comfy. This place takes that cozy environment and modified it to make it even better!
Then there is the food. HOLY COW! So very good. I got their chicken dish which was off the hook good. My husband got a steak dish also amazing. Just know that when you eat here your bill is going to be heavy. It's expensive but worth every single penny.

Came here with a brunch with a friend and her 2 year old on a Sunday and I'm glad that I made reservations as it was pretty full by the time I sat down. Just FYI if you have kids, they don't have high-chairs but was able to snag a booth which worked ok for the kid. I would say their brunch menu is made up of 25% breakfast and 75% lunch so if you want breakfast food, you might not be satisfied here. Also, prices are pretty high considering most items don't come with hash browns, eggs, etc.... and for the French toast it's literally a huge chunk of bread, while delicious was $15 with just topping and syrup (some fruit would of been nice). I got the eggs benedict and it was delicious and welcomed the side salad but again, I can see some people wanting "breakfast" food.
Service was ok, I was waiting for my friend to show up and got seated early but would of been nice to have been brought water or asked if I wanted anything to drink (really needed coffee) and waited about 10 minutes until I was acknowledged.

Wandered down here on a Sunday evening with a good friend.
Food was delicious. As a vegetarian, they had a decent offering - which I always appreciate. We ordered an Endive and Pear Salad (they happily swapped the dressing here since the one it came with had anchovies in it), and some Pumpkin Gnocchi. I asked the waitress if it would be enough, since it seemed a small-plate situation, and she suggested we order another item, so we went for the Roasted Broccoli. Everything we ate was delicious. The Gnocchi was light and tender, the broccoli zingy in the best way, and the salad refreshing. But two plates would have been plenty.
We decided to celebrate with dessert - an Olive Oil Brownie that was executed wonderfully.
Really the ONLY thing keeping this place from 5 stars was the incessant high pitched ringing that is apparently a result of them having the heater and the music on at the same time ... That was just horrific. Almost had us out of our minds. If I'd been there with my husband, rather than friend, I know he would've have been able to stand it and we would have had to leave.... So go on a warm day, when the heater isn't necessary. At least until they get that resolved.

We got to enjoy dinner here just after the grand opening. The atmosphere is delightful and allows for easy conversation. The staff keep everything super clean- even the bathrooms were spotless!
We ordered the clams, Hangar Steak, and the chicken dish! The clams came in a delicious broth that was such a welcomed break from typical clam broths. The broth was packed with flavors that really partnered well with the clams. The steak and chicken were cooked to perfection! We were thrilled when the chef, David Nichols, brought us a Crab Corndog. Sounds crazy but, it was a delicious bread batter stuffed full of fresh crab meat. The picture shown was after several bites. It is presented like the most elegant corn dog you have ever seen!
Overall, this was a perfect date night! We will be back for sure.
Some other reviews talk about being overpriced but, for the quality, and taste of the food, the welcoming staff, and wonderful ambiance, it's worth every penny!
We got to spend another evening at Eight Row with some friends! Both experiences were outstanding!
Love the atmosphere with all the plants, beautiful bar. Food is pretty good and staff is super friendly. Brunch is the best!

Awesome restaurant, will definitely come back! I loved the decor and it had chill vibes which was pleasant after the work week.
Great food presentation and the flavors were amazing! Solid wine selection and tasty cocktails!
The staff was friendly, upbeat and pleasant to dine with! The speed of the food was a little on the slower side, but if you're not in a rush, enjoy this new spot in the neighborhood! I'm confident this will get worked out as they get a little more time under their belt.

This place was amazing! From the decor to the service to the food; everything was fantastic. I had asked for a virgin mock tail and the bartender whipped me up a ginger beer, lime and cherry drink that was delicious. My husband and I split the oyster and the carrot habenero Sauce that was on it was divine. My husband had the duck which he raved about and my gnocchi was so delicious especially on a cold night. We had two dessert (brûlée and brownie) and while the brûlée was a little too thick for our taste, the brownie was literally the best dessert ever. The peanut brittle on it was so original and delicious.

This my favorite place for Pizza in the greater Seattle area.
The service is good and the food great!

You'd be hard pressed to find a better Greek salad and pizza combo in the city! It's Greek style pizza, so heavy on the cheese and toppings. This is not your wimpy NY style. Just to control expectations on other variables, the decor is dated (very modest) and the service can be slow, but don't let that deter you from phenomenal food!
Olympic is completely family run and you can tell they have a passion for good quality, home-cooked food.
This restaurant is a true gem of the Ravenna/Roosevelt neighborhood!

We had the pork steak with potatoes, lemon rice soup, and gyros. The food was so delicious that my boyfriend can't stop thinking about the food he had there. Also, the service and employees were very friendly.
Phenomenal pizza. They don't skimp on the cheese. The owners are super nice. What's not to like? This is my go-to place when I want a quality pie.

Comfort food galore! Ireni and Andreas, the owners, helped me customize a pasta that my Niece (who attends UW and wasn't feeling well) was craving. Ireni took my order then they both were in the kitchen preparing it. Large portions with delicious garlic bread, and soup or salad. Amazing couple that have ran this amazing restaurant for 45 years. I will try their pizza next time, although the Lemon Chicken is a new favorite!

My bf and I went here to grab a quick bite to eat. We order fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and it came with a salad. We both really enjoyed the salad. The pasta was also very delicious and creamy. Our server was very nice and she gave us excellent service. If you are looking for yummy food that feels like family cooked it. You are in the right place.

Must try! This place is seemingly a hole in the wall and doesn't seem busy, but i was shocked once i ate there.
The environment is a bit bland and feels like an old diner, but the family who runs this place are really kind and wow can they cook.
Every dish i have had has been delicious.
I recommend the spaghetti and meatballs with marinara. And anything with the famous feta dressing.
I got the baked lasagna. At first look, it looks nothing like any baked lasagna I've had before. But dang it tastes good!!!

This neighborhood Greek pizza joint is my fave! We love everything in the menu! I crave the Greek salad and the Andre's special. The owners are super friendly and precious! My daughter is a picky eater and she loves the lemon chicken soup and the feta cheese noodles. I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to support a locally owned and operated establishment!
My favorite restaurant. Wonderful family-run business. Never too busy. The prices are just right, and the bottom-less garlic bread!
Amazing pasta! And super quick service. Got the spaghetti with marinara sauce, came with a salad and some yummy garlic bread. Highly suggest this place for a quick and easy lunch or dinner.

They say all 1-star reviews are for the service. This is all about the food. Maybe I'm a pizza snob, I am from the East Coast. I have worked a pizza counter. This was sadly the worst pizza I've ever eaten. The crust was okay. This was the only redeeming feature. All of the toppings--all 5 pieces of pepperoni and 10 mushrooms--were at the center of the pie. These were topped by a rubbery, orange cheese. Not what I'm looking for on my pizza. Seems like some folks have had a really positive experience here. We got takeaway, so it was all about the meal. And it just wasn't good.

Driven past this place for years(parking on Roosevelt is.....), on trips to whole foods and east west book store! Yesterday evening had some free time(10min), so went in to check the place out, -"get a pamphlet menu". Was greeted warmly nice owners,quality vibes, looking forward to trying the food and drink.
"Proactive" !conclusion: Looks like a really nice place for intro to new books and pizza and whine with Fettuccine Alfredo with lots to go for the fridge!
I am also curious about the Gyros because I have many friends that love Gyros! and are always looking for quality places!
PS. I should make it my project goal for next time to try the front -banner --"Parking in rear alley access off 64'th"!
google.com/maps/place/64…

Wow. I had to personally thank the chef on this one, a tiny old man with a sparkle in his eye, and his wife, presumably, right next to him making pasta. Who would have thought this tiny hole in the wall would have such good food. I am a traditionalist and stick to the classics - fettuccine Alfredo, lasagna, chicken parmigiano, S&M... I choose the FetAlf sans chicken.
Now, I used to work at a very high end Italian restaurante in Los Angeles, celebrity chef and all, and it was the second best I've ever had outside of an Italian restaurant in Northern Japan, go figure, but Olympia Pizza comes in at a solid 3rd on my list of world favorites.
Kudos and yes, I'll be back

Olys is my go-to if I want lunch delivered at work. Everything I've ordered tastes amazing and I love how they have a variety of things to chose from! I usually get the gyro salad with the house dressing. So delicious!

Great food, great value, and more than anything, the owners are great people.
The pizza is awesome, and being that the owners are from Crete, some of the best Greek food around you're going to find.
Warm atmosphere inside, and their bar area looks exactly like what you would find in a typical taverna in Crete.

3 stars for the Caesar salad. Very lemony with tasty croutons! The garlic bread was dry and hard by the time we ate it. The pizza (we had the special) was ok. I just prefer a sweeter more substantial crust and the toppings just became soggy under the solidified cheese. But, my husband took it home and ate it for lunch, so 3 stars it is!

I really enjoyed the pizzas, and there was plenty to eat. everyone on the group loved the pizza but the two kids, and for some reason, they weren't big fans. I ordered the special of the day, the greek lasagna, which I didn't really care for, but that may simply be my tastes for lasagna. It was good food, and would go back again, but it didn't blow my socks off, so I'm going 4-stars.

So came here just looking for spaghetti, came to find soo much more then that. The Pepperoni pizza was sooo bomb! The portions sizes are HUGE!! The spaghetti meatballs was good a little dry but i asked for a marinara side and it was bomb after that. The BBQ ribs were sooo tender and just fall right off the bone they were delicious! I definitely will be coming back! The customer service was also so welcoming!
Great Greek family restaurant with awesome salads and pasta. Best afgalemono in town!!!

Really great cocktail bar in the heart of Pioneer Square. I didn't get to visit any of the back rooms because they were all reserved, but I loved sitting at the bar. They had a great staff of knowledgeable and fun bartenders. Drinks and food both were everything I wanted them to be.
I also used this bar to feed and house 30 executives for an end of the year meeting, and booking was a dream. Very low stress with the perfect amount of communication.
Bars like this are doing their best to elevate the Pioneer Square neighborhood.

Awesome spot in pioneer square with great food, interesting drinks,good service and a cool vibe. Came in with a group on a Saturday night and pretty much ordered most of the menu to share:
the winners:
- Brussels sprouts- roasted, crispy, with a bit of tang from the glaze, makes eating your veggies a great idea
- hammered potatoes- thick potato slices served with a yummy combo of textures from creamy aioli to crunchy pickled onion... definitely a great sharing plate
- saffron fried rice- special of the night with chicken and chorizo, definitely a favorite for the table
- squash al pastor tacos- surprising combo of savory squash with a little sweetness from pineapple that came together with the crema
- fish tacos - crispy, lightly fried cod topped with a delicious tomatillo aioli
Runner ups:
- chimichurri Mac & cheese - good flavor with nice crunch from the breadcrumbs but a little dry
- brisket & cornbread- the cornbread was actually arepas which were good but a little dense. The brisket was tender and the crema was a nice balance
Every plate was scraped clean so clearly no complaints, will definitely be back to wrap up the few items left on the menu to try.

Been coming to Dead Line for awhile now and the food is still as delicious as when it first opened and the drinks are still spot on! Bartenders are still very friendly and serve great cocktails! We got a Dead Line (with activated charcoal!) and Glass full of hugs (because I like hugs and bourbon!) and they were both really delicious and well-balanced.
We ordered the arepitas and brussel sprouts to start and had the squash al pastor and chorizo tacos to share for dinner. The arepitas were crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside with just enough sauce on the dish. It was hard not to lick the plate. The brussel sprouts are perfectly charred with a balsamic glaze to die for. Yum! The squash al pastor tacos were tender and well-seasoned... enough that you didn't miss the meat! The chorizo tacos were also well-seasoned with awesome pineapple salsa and pickled jalapenos.
I asked James about some of their Scotch selections and Chris came over to chat with us about their selection of Scotch and whiskey. We got to talking about their selections, some of their favorite bars in the area, and Chris also gave us some samplings of their delicious goods.
I left well fed and warm with delicious drinks in my belly. Thanks James and Chris!

Atmospheric bar w a happy hour menu~ the service was also really great and attentive.
The drinks were pretty solid. Their signature cocktail also was not bad (interesting concept w the activated charcoal).
We shared Brussel spouts from the HH menu. Came heavily drenched in sauce but it was still ok/good.

Loved our cocktails and bites at this gem of a place tucked away in pioneer square! Latin American food always calls my name but the dim lights, great selection of cocktails, and American extras on the menu changed the game.
GET THE AREPITAS!!!!! They are Colombian not Venezuelan, but amazing! Also tried the Brussels sprouts and it was a perfect complement to our drinks.
Only reason this is 4 over 5 stars is a limited menu, but the service was amazing, very little wait for a table, great ambiance, and everything we got was well made/thoughtful/delicious.

I walked in and for some reason the name put a different "look" in my head. The staff was friendly and the gentlemen was from another bar I had been before.
I always loved their drinks so i knew they would be tasty, however they were better. Gained another customer.
I was in fact looking for a place that I could do parties, there was a huge birthday part going on upstairs in the room. It was very adorable, the decorations, the set up was in AWH.
We sat and had whiskeys, tequila drinks, and ended our night. We didn't have any food, but that was OK.
The gold room in the back is perfect for my great gatsby themed event that I want to throw. I cant wait to come back.

Great spot to stop and grab some food if you're near Pioneer Square. I ate here last weekend with a couple friends and the food and service were amazing. We got there around 9 and had no problem getting a table. The restaurant is a decent size with many tables and bar seating for customers. Their menu is pretty small but we were able to find food that suited all of our dietary needs. I only ordered a side of fries as I had already eaten but the guests I was with ordered the chorizo tacos and the drunken brussel sprouts. Both dishes were delicious! Also, they have a great cocktail menu with lots of fun drinks to try. I would definitely eat here again!

One of the best new restaurants in Pioneer Square. Great service, owners, drinks and food. The chefs are very passionate about their craft and it shows in the food.
I have taken a few dates here and always bed. Happy with my service, food and drink.
I would recommend this place for dates or drinks with friends.
They have a really cool back rooms. Parking isn't too bad now that construction has finished in first Ave. decor is very cool and they have a back room and upstairs for private events.
Check this place out!

This was by far the best restaurant I have ever eaten! I am a flight attendant for a major airline and I get to eat all over the place. The staff was unbelievably friendly, the food was amazing. My boyfriend and I were here for the evening and we stopped in by accident (which was a happy accident because I was trying to find "damn the weather"...Which is right next-door!) We don't drink, but they had a spot available for dinner at the chefs counter. Coolest experience ever! The chefs are extremely talented, great conversation, and have a huge passion for what they do. I ordered the burger, and my boyfriend ordered the chorizo tacos. The burger was cooked absolutely perfect, fresh fries that stayed hot the entire meal! The chorizo tacos were the best blend of flavors I have ever experienced. I could not recommend this place enough! We cannot wait to go back.

I went here with 2 of my friends and were seated at the bar since we did not make a reservation.
The potatoes were roasted from the outside and soft from the inside. Since I am vegetarian they made vegetarian tacos for me. The vegetarian tacos had smoked cauliflower, red peppers, pineapple, and potatoes. These tacos were kind of spicy in flavor but were really good. The non vegetarian food was really good too according to my friends. They did not have a lot of food options but had a lot of beverage options.
The kitchen was open and you could see the chef make your food. The restroom was really clean and modern.

Ohhhh myyy goddd... these tacos are packed with flavor and the brisket is cooked perfectly. The vibe is nice and relaxing . Staff is friendly and service is quick. Will be back next time I'm in town .

We held a surprise birthday for my wife in the Gold Room and it was fantastic. It has a welcoming speakeasy vibe, and the service was spot on; from coordinating the reservations with Erik to our server, Rich who was personable and attentive.
The drinks were delicious and our favorite, was the blue thing drink. The food was that we were able to order was also tasty. I said "able to" since they did run out of a few items like the scallops and burgers. We ended getting some brisket that had a nice spicy kick to it and the pork belly was cooked well and crispy to go along with their salad and hammered potatoes.
We had a great night there and sure to be back for more craft cocktails.
Love it. This was a chance upon. Great food, great service. If you are in Seattle give it a try. You wont be disappointed. Awesome vibe. Definitely will be coming back and I recommend it highly.
Cool pioneer sq spot. Great mixed cocktails and craft cocktails ... bartender can make ANY drink and the food is yum too! Check out back area for a 70s throwback style lounge

I originally decided to stop into this bar because the pictures of the decor were amazing -- I was definitely not disappointed! But even further than that, I was pleasantly surprised by my exceptional experience there.
The bar is well stocked and carefully curated by the owners, a couple that has been in the industry a long time and decided to open their own spot. It has a 20's prohibition vibe to it and there's even a semi-hidden back room with couches. Everyone that works there is SO friendly, the service was way above and beyond my expectations. I highly recommend going here! Thanks to everyone who took care of us during our visit.

Dead Line is an uber-cool restaurant and cocktail lounge that almost drips old-time Jazz Age splendor. The venue was named for the line of demarcation between the rebuilt section of Seattle and the old section that was destroyed by fire back in the 20th century. The address (114 First Avenue) was at one time home to a New Orleans-style Cajun/Creole restaurant.
If you're a person that enjoys a good cocktail than the expert mixologists working behind the bar here will totally be singing your song! They can make some of the best classic cocktails, or deftly mix herbs, seasonal juices and exotic liquors to craft an original creation upon request.
Tip: They have a daily Happy Hour here from 4-6pm which features complimentary "small bites" with all beverage orders.
The cuisine here is Latin with a decidedly South American slant. While It's pretty much impossible to go wrong regardless of the dish you choose, I highly recommend their burgers, which have a very nice kick to them :-)
While all the cocktails I've tried here were delicious, I especially enjoyed the "Dead Line" signature cocktail - I highly recommend that you stop in for one.

I had a winding dinner conversation for four loud hours here with a group of friends. The entire time, all of the staff was very friendly and helpful. They even let me order off the happy hour menu a few minutes past the deadline (not living up to the name).
The food here was really good. I tried the hammered potatoes with brisket, tacos with brisket as they were out of chorizo, and roasted cauliflower. The hammered potatoes were my favorite. Perfectly crispy, delicious toppings, and a well rounded flavor profile. The three dishes I ordered all kind of had the same ingredients and taste in a way, even though they all tasted good.
The drinks were fun. I got my standby, an old fashioned. It was good. I followed that with the titular dead line. Not my favorite, as it tasted a little like Gatorade, but it wasn't bad and I like trying new concoctions. Finally I got a sazerac in honor of my home state. All the drinks were a bit on the weaker side. I wish they had a bit more punch overall.
But hats off to dead line for letting us dominate your restaurant all night!

Came here on my birthday for a quick drink and I really enjoyed the ambiance and service of the place. Both of our bartenders were really nice and sweet and was able to assist us immediately. I would come back again. We also ordered a rendition of a whiskey ginger and it was amazing!

Dear Dead Line,
I am SO UTTERLY HAPPY to have found you! You are a secret and sexy speakeasy with delightfully attentive and friendly bartenders, a FUN drink menu (One Thing, Two Thing, Red Thing, Blue Thing...and whatever else kind of things you care to prescribe the imbibing), and a fabulous happy hour (3-6). Oh, and I was luckily to maintain my self control by only ordering one portion of the fried green plantains but next time, it's on. This dish is to DIE for. Oh, Dead Line, where have you been in my life???
xoxoxox,
Liana

Best fish tacos I've ever had - and I've had several. A little pricey for the portion size, but they make up for it in high quality deliciousness. We also had the potato bravas (sic) and Mexican corn, which were both excellent as well. Cool space too.

We came on Saturday after 5 for an early dinner. The place was already pretty full. The restaurant decor was pretty modern and constantly playing Chinese songs in Cantonese and Mandarin. We first order a few orders of skewers (lamb, chicken glizzard, chicken soft bone and Markeral) and an order of lotus leaf steam rice with chicken. The food was served very quickly. The lamb and the chicken glizzard were so on point, we ended up ordering 4 more of them! The rice was solid and pretty tasty, but the skewers were true gems. The only thing is that I wish they serve draft beef. The meat skewers would pair perfectly with some cold crisp beer!
We will be back!

After seeing this on my recommendations, I decided to stop by on a Saturday night an hour before closing. It was pretty packed, I guess the local Chinese community already knows about this place.
I originally ordered the spare ribs with rice to-go, but changed to dine-in once I saw a table open up. I proceeded to take a seat after waiting 10 minutes or so, thinking my food would come out soon. About 20 minutes later, a server brought me a soy-sauce-marinated egg, apologizing for the wait and telling me my food would be out soon.
In total, I waited around 45 minutes before my food finally came out. By then, the restaurant was close to empty, and it was close to closing time. However, despite the food taking so long, I'm glad I wasn't rushed to eat quickly.
My food came out in a large steamer, and it looks like a lot of food at first. However, the steamer is pretty shallow, and so the food just thinly spread out. Quantity-wise, it was perfect for one person.
One thing that was unique was that they put banana leaves under the dish as it steams, imparting a unique aroma that I've never seen in other rice and sparerib dishes. I didn't necessarily add anything flavor-wise, but I just thought it was interesting.
The spare ribs, though tender, did not pack any flavor at all. The same could be said about the rice - it just tasted bland. I had to almost drench the whole thing in soy sauce to taste anything remotely satisfying. They did give a good amount of bok choy, which I appreciate. But that wasn't enough to offset the taste of the primary components of the dish.
Pricing is a bit high (12.95 for a rice dish) for my liking. Maybe if the food was a little more flavorful, I'd be okay with it. But I can't see that price point justified as of now.
The decor itself is pretty nice. It's sleek and modern, and very well lit. There's a huge TV inside playing Chinese tv shows/dramas, but that didn't do anything for me since I can't read/understand Chinese.
It's not the biggest restaurant - there are maybe 10-15 tables that can fit around 4 people, so try not to come in a large group. There's also a few bar seats, but it gets tight at the bar from what I've seen.
It's located in the Asian Family Market plaza, which gets really busy on weekends. Weekdays, it's manageable. There are tons of parking spots, it's just a matter of when you go that'll determine how easy parking will be.
I think I'll still go to Chinatown if I want my spare ribs and rice dishes, at least, until this place makes some upgrades to compete with my regular options.

Definitely go with a smaller group, we waited over an hour for a party of 7. For as busy as the place was, there were only 2 servers. While they were very nice, the service was lacking. No refills on water, half the food came out together then the rest of the dishes came out one by one at least 10 minutes apart with the last dish coming out when everyone else had finished.
That beIng said, the food was ok. The skewers were flavorful but the rice dishes were pretty bland. The sauce that was provided didn't help either.
Overall a disappointing experience given the amount of time we waIted. Can't say that I will go back.

We ate here on a Sat for lunch and got on the Yelp waitlist. Unfortunately, after an hour wait, when we got there, we were somehow farther behind in line than when we started. The staff told me yelp waitlist was broken but since I had waited an hour they bumped me to the front of the line. Very nice of them.
We ordered the Chinese Ham Sausage lotus leaf rice. You can really smell the lotus leaf fragrance in the rice. It was cooked perfectly and the sausage wasn't overly oily. The bokchoy was not overcooked and still had a slight crunch. Would definitely recommend this.
Also got some BBQ skewers: lamb and shrimp with quail egg. These were not bad. Nicely seasoned but slightly forgettable. Lamb was also a little tough.
The seaweed salad was really good and had a nice bit of spice in it.
The service was very friendly but they were clearly incredibly busy. Sometimes you had to flag them down to take an empty plate from your table or to provide you with things like bowls for sharing but they were always happy to help.
Unfortunately, someone spilled some hot sauce on my fiancé's coat that was hanging behind her on her chair. We didn't notice it until later that day but luckily we got it out.
Overall, their lotus leaf rices are nicely done and worth a visit.

Luna Bistro is a new addition to the Asian filled store-fronts in the Overlake area plaza that was once home to Goodwill, but now is anchored by Asian Family Mart. During its soft opening stage, there is not a sign outside yet. It's next to MonGa Café if you go now.
As of today, they opened only 4 to 5 days ago. I joined the waitlist via Yelp and was told the wait was 16 to 31 minutes. It was more like an hour. That's ok; I guessed that would happen and was mentally prepared. If you don't like crowds or lines, it's better to give it some time.
Within the Yelp reviews, you'll find the owner's own summary of his restaurant. In short, it's his comfort food, particularly the lotus leaf rice dishes, which is essentially your must-order food here. We had the chicken and mushroom and the garlic sparerib. A soy-sauce based mixing sauce (similar to a Chinese style dumpling sauce) is provided. Drizzle on this sauce, mix well, and enjoy. Eat like "a local" by eating with the spoon. ;) Both dishes were filling and satisfying. I would love to see a try vegetarian option in this category. A bok choy, mushroom, and maybe egg (sunny side up) and corn would be great. I also would welcome at least one more seafood options; would love to see a garlic shrimp with chopped bits of garlic visible.
They also have a good set of options in their BBQ section (served after 6pm). We wanted the quail egg shrimp, but they were sold out. We ordered the fish balls instead. They are lightly seared, and there's a seasoning on it (possibly cumin). Yummy. We also ordered their tea eggs - very flavorful. I highly recommend this appetizer.
Prices are reasonable, especially the rice dishes. I suspect this place has a good future. Give them a try, though maybe at a less busy hour. There was no more lines by 7:45pm on a Friday.
Service was surprisingly good on a very busy night. 3 guys handled the front, speaking English, Mandarin, and Cantonese. Despite the wait and the crowd, it was still a good meal overall.

I was very excited to see this new restaurant located a couple doors down from Mon Ga. I don't believe they have their signage up or at least I didn't see any when I came in tonight.
Braised Pork Belly over steamed rice - 3/5 Very light in flavor so make sure you drizzle some of their homemade soy sauce for added flavor. Pork/fat ratio: 10% pork & 90% fat. It was too fatty for my taste.
Shredded Potatoes 2/5 - Not much flavor. It wasn't even mildly spicy nor vinegary. It's a good palate cleanser for the fatty pork belly.
Beef skewers 1/5 - Lightly salted and it came with a side of dried seasoning (mild crush chili powder and cumin) for dipping. Beef was cut in small cubes and a bit tough.
Fish ball skewers 2/5- I was expecting it to be grilled or something but it wasn't. They basically cut the fish ball in half and pierced it through the skewer with light dusting of the same seasoning (mild crush chili powder and cumin). It also came with an extra side of the same seasoning on the plate.
Crispy Milk Curd - 2/5 It's hard for me to describe what this tastes like. The texture reminds of flavorless, soft jello with a somewhat crispy crust drizzled with condensed milk on the top. Since there wasn't much flavor to it, they should have served it with a side of condensed milk for dipping.
Service: 1/5 - There were 5-6 waiters working tonight which I thought was a good sign but quickly realized they prefer to chit chat amongst themselves than to attend to their customers. We had to flag someone down to take our order after being seated for over 10min. At the end of our meal, we had to vigorously wave at them to get their attention to bring us our bill. Someone finally came and cleaned only half of table and decided to get back to their group convo. I really hope they'll improve their service soon.
Home style Chinese cooking with steamed meat and rice dishes. Very tasty and comforting but not pretentious in the least. Chicken cartilege was too hard to eat.

In terms of food, I think Luna Bistro's food can be a bit more flavorful. As of right now I think they taste a bit blend and their price point is a bit high (12.95 for a rice dish, 10.95 for 4 wings, 5.95 for a small pot of soup)
However, I am still giving this restaurant a 4 stars due to the fact that they are different than most other Chinese restaurants here. They are serving steam dishes with very basic ingredients. Nothing is soaked in spicy oil and chili pepper, I feel 10 times healthier eating here.
I hope they try different things to make their rice dishes a bit more flavorful. I will continue to visit this store.

TL;DR: lotus leaf steamed rice! seaweed salad! comfort food check!
-----
Randomly stumbled upon this place on a rainy Sunday and boy am I glad. My group of 4 came just before noon and were able to get seated in less than 10 minutes without reservation. However, it became pretty packed soon after and they actually sold out of their dishes around 1pm.
I believe the restaurant is still in its soft opening stage so there were definitely some kinks they need to work through. The services can be slow at times (we had to ask for water multiple times) and the server forgot one dish we ordered. But the food made up for it.
We got the lotus leaf steamed rice with chicken and mushroom, steamed rice with pork belly, seaweed salad, fried chicken wings and lamb skewer.
The steam rice dishes were phenomenal and I'd definitely come back for them. While they looked very simple, they sure hit the spot, so did the seaweed salad. The lamb skewers were pretty standard and kinda expensive imo.
The only thing we didn't like was the fried chicken wings ($10 for 4 pieces btw!!). The wings looked good in picture but they were overly grease-y and sweet?! I think they were either battered using a dessert batter (they do serve a fried milk dessert thingy), or fried in the same fryer as the dessert. We asked if they are supposed to be sweet and the owner said yes... so maybe my palate is just not refined enough :S

So glad to finally find a place like this!! I find myself always craving clay pot rice dishes. Although they do not serve their rice dishes in clay pots and thus you miss out on the crispy rice pieces, I would argue the banana leaf addition is a worthy substitute.
They make their own sauce to mix into the rice and it's so impressive. I was afraid the sauce would overpower the rice flavors or make the dish too salty but I was pleasantly surprised to find that it actually complimented the dishes perfectly!
Will definitely be going back to try all of their dishes :)

Very interesting Chinese restaurant with different takes on traditional dishes. Lots of good options for meat and veggie dishes, plus lots of flavors! This place needs to expand its eating area as it is really only good for parties of 4 or less. There were 6 of us and it was very squished! The servers were excellent, all smiles, and very fast! The biggest negative is that the parking for this area is a nightmare! Very little parking for so many businesses. Uber drop off may make this a better experience. Overall really good restaurant with good food!

Came here Saturday night with my family! Make sure to put your name down on the waitlist on yelp before you go in. All of the skewers tasted amazing. My favorite was the bacon wrapped in mushroom. My least favorite was the rice. We ordered the garlic robes but now looking at the photo, I don't think that's what we received. The rice dish was not very tasteful. I would def come back for the skewers though! This is a new restaurant so there were some mistakes in ordering from the waiters. But overall, good place!
New Chinese restaurant in Bellevue offering good rice meals. Currently in soft opening mode.

Very cozy environment with delicious comfort food at very friendly price!
They are still in soft opening mode so the store is a bit hard to find.
I personally loved the minced pork lotus rice. The barbecue menu has a great selection as well. My personal favorite is the lamp chop and bacon wrapped enoki. Beef skewer is also great as well.
Service is great and feels like home.
Would definitely come back next time.

It's quite hard to rate this place based on my first experience. According to my husband the flavor is how Hong Kong people eat which is quite bland compared to my normal taste. However I can taste the freshness of the vegetables and the quality of the meat in their rice dishes. The service was good.
Just ok. The food was nice and hot but without much flavor and overpriced for what you got.
Their foods are really good, but their customer service is even better. The servers are so nice, attentive, and polite. Will definitely come back!

The server was very very nice. It was a busy day when I was there last time, and our food came out pretty late. I understood that because I am a server as well. However, I was surprised the server offered us free lunch. I really appreciated that. Thank you so much, I will be back.

This is a brand new restaurant with authentic and honest asian delicacy! Disclaimer: my wife knows the owner and we were invited to 'test drive' before they are open to public this week.
We are family of five with 3 small kids, we ordered 5 different lotus leave steamed rice (we couldn't finished them), 2 types of bbq lamb, few homemade drinks, chatting with the owner and watching them working hard to get the restaurant ready for soft opening the second day.
We are Malaysian Chinese and has been living in many different places. The difficulty is always about looking for great Asian restaurant where they serve good authentic food, with fresh ingredients, which you can taste the cooking and ingredients, rather than just the over flavoring.
I must say this is exactly what Luna Bistro is offering. The lotus leave steamed rice we tasted are all really delicious, is a way that how a family would cook at home (if you have time to prepare). It's refreshing almost coming from most Asian restaurant, that i can taste the pork, the chicken, the steam vegetables , along with the steam rice with the natural fragrance of the lotus leave steamed with it. Oh! Please try the minced pork steam rice, the owner recommended it, I am not normally a minced pork person (as it always get over flavored), but the one served here is phenomenal for us!
And then the bbq lamb, the skewer come with great flavorful dry hot spices for 'dipping', that is amazing, the bbq lamp chop (3x single lamb rack) is juicy and good balance of flavor - I wish I am here not with family but with just friends and having these with beers!
The portion is good to the price, we only managed to finished like 3 out the 5 portioned of the steamed rice, we are small eater though with small kids, so now we have steamed rice for Sunday lunch at home.
Upon finishing our fantastic dinner, owner came by again for feedback, we share our great experience with some small practical suggestions here and there (cutlery for kids, reservation for family, etc), and our concern - maybe his has too few tables, he should start looking for expansion!

Delicious lotus steamed rice with spare ribs! The steamed rice with chicken is pretty good too. The chicken wings are tasty.
Note that BBQ only starts after 6 pm

I gotta say I was quite surprised by HP. I've been out of the foodie scene in Seattle for awhile and hadn't heard of it, and when the name came up in a yelp search I groaned. "Oh lord, another twee hipster place with inconsistent food and overly pedantic service!" is what I thought.
But I read the Yelp reviews and decided to give it a go, even though we had no reServations. The place wasn't full but it was busy, and when I said i had a party of two but no rezzies they pointed me to the bar, which frankly is where I would rather eat anyways. (Pro tip: you can nearly always sneak a seat for dinner at the bar in a good popular restaurant. It's the only way I will eat at the Met.)
So, I sit down and the bartender asks if I want sparkling or still water. Well dammit that's a nice touch. Then the beer I want is out, but they load a new keg for, quickly and without rancor. Also nice.
Then the food! We had the charcuterie, oysters, octopus, steak and split a panna cotta for dessert. I usually look for one standout, one solid and then give the place credit if the worst dish is something I could probably do better at home.
Every dish was very, very good. Very good. Service was thorough and attentive without being cloying. And for Seattle the bill wasn't horrifying!
The only thing I can complain about is the vibe, and it's a minor complaint. The decorations and design are "neutral" in the best and worst senses of the word: they don't get in the way of really great food (yay!) But they are boring (boo!).
I will absolutely come here again!

Dined there December 20, party of 3. Service was Ok, had to ask for bread a few times, however initially was not even offered bread/butter. Seems like it arrives upon 2nd request.
Food was good, but portions for the price are stingy. Plate with beef cheeks came out with one side of the plate super hot, another side luke warm. Indicator that the food was not made to order, but heated to order. Amatuer move.
The kicker- even for 3 people 20% mandatory tip is already included.
Why 20%? Why not 18 or 21? Tip is supposed to be something that is valuated arbitrarily based on individual experience. An incentive, if you will, for wait staff to be on point.
The bill conveniently had a line for Tip, that is in addition to already mandated 20% and the wait staff sheepishly never mentioned that aspect. In other words, they will gladly take your money if you are not looking at the check details. Pretty shady business practice if you ask me. Will not be coming back.
To the management - if you have specific to say, I would like to hear. You token "Our apologies, regret, your dining experience, tips are going to xyz" and the rest of corporate phrases - please save them.
It was a Friday evening 7:00 PM, place was pretty empty, left around 9:00 PM, it was still emptier than ever......

I had an opportunity to have dinner at Heartwood in a situation where it was comp; so my review isn't tempered by having to pay the tab including the service fees they add in for downtown Seattle restaurants and bars. We got Uber as they don't have valet and figured to be drinking a bit more than usual for this occasion.
The front of the house has a bar and dinner seating toward the back of the house. It was packed in the front bar area with large groups enjoying happy hour and the ambiance was this is a good place to have after work drinks and good cheer.
We skipped the party and went past the open kitchen where you smell a light touch of wood smoke from there free standing pizza oven. It immediately made me think of eating smoked ribs even though not on the menu.
The cocktails are serviced using artisan ice that is crystal clear that provides a nice touch, as you can see in the photos of the "Usual" rye whiskey drink. The beet salad, seared albacore, steak tartar and oysters where our starters that were well executed and just the right portions so you can still have room for the entrees. I saw a good cross section of the entrees; octopus, sea scallops, beef cheek and seared lingcod with me having the scallops.
The staff handling the seating and table service are top notch here and very professional. A covey of staff clear the entire table in one go between courses showing a great deal of organization. You should not come away disappointed from the point of sitting down until you leave from the execution of providing you a great dinner experience.
I'm pretty sure the bill for this meal was from my perspective over-the-top, but it was nice having such a great experience without the bitter taste of paying up the additional 30% tax & service charges on top. This said, Heartwood Provisions has an excellent staff and food that well deserves the service charge.
As we left our guests, we couldn't resist hang out at the bar for another "the usual" and chatting up the bartender before we Uber'd our way back to the Burien non-hipster zone below the West Seattle bridge.

Good setting, ordered drinks based on wait staff recommendation, delicious yet very complicated. The beef jerky starter was good, nice flavor, Got tight into dinner ordered a scrumptious octopus meal complimented with Brussels sprouts, the sprouts were melt in your mouth delicious, my first shot at octopus and I was not disappointed, this was served on top of ink fried rice and Chinese sausages with some other tasty greens and aioli, tantalizing to the tastebuds, my wife ordered linkcod it came out cool sent it back and they flash fired it, not good, still just warm, she ended up not being able to eat it, staff was nice and removed it from our bill but now the wife is still hungry, a bit dissatisfied with that. Had dessert which was a smoky dish and pretty tasty. Overall a pretty good meal minus the wife's dinner snafu. I'd go back

I stumbled upon this place because my friend and I were caught in the rain (yes, I know it's Seattle! LOL). It was the closest restaurant to where we were walking. Although it looks like a posh/fancy place, and we were dressed very casual, the host didn't flinch when we walked in and was happy to welcome us. We selected the bar and ordered our drinks. The bartenders were super nice and easy to talk to. Since I am new in town, we were asking many questions about what to do in town for fun, the culture around town, neighborhoods to hang out etc. They gave us advice and tips on how to get places etc. The conversations and interactions made me feel at ease. The bartenders were the highlight of my night. I will definitely be back soon and next time I'll have some food.
The khaleesi is a very good drink. Also I heard that one of Andrew's specialty is the Ramos Gin Fizz, so I will be back for that drink (one of my favorite).

First time here and it's a new favorite. The space is really warm and lively. The food was outstanding
- we had the oysters, beef jerky, charcuterie, kale salad, beef cheeks, scallops, octopus, and dessert -all were delicious. Some reviews have noted the portion size as disappointing but we found them to be just perfect. We left satisfied but not overstuffed. The service is what ties it all together. It matched the restaurant's vibe - warm, lively, funny, attentive, never rushed. Love the sparkling water option. Special thanks to our server, Neil, who was so knowledgeable, attentive without hovering, and whose recommendations were spot on. We will be back.

My photos kind of suck but this was an excellent meal. Everything tasted great. All this, plus 2 cocktails cost me about 140 including tip. I thought this was about right considering the quality of the food, drinks and service.
Highlights were probably the prosciutto, perfect amount of fat. The Brussels sprouts, believe it or not, were to die for.
The cocktail, although I don't remember the name, was kind of like an old fashioned and tasted great.
I'd eat everything I ordered again.

Lovely dining experience!!
We had a double date here to celebrate some friends from out of town as well as our gentleman's birthday.
I really like that their menu is focused on pairing the food with an adult beverage (wine, beer or spirits).
FOODwise:
-Beet salad is divine! Seriously.
-Wild Sea Scallops (you can never go wrong with seafood in Seattle).
-Brussels Sprouts were a great side with any of the entrees we had on the table.
-Octopus was one of the better entrees with the Mezcal pairing.
-Smoked Caramel Panna Cotta came out with a birthday candle on-the-house for dessert.
The service was a 10/10 for us.
The champagne that was being poured at the beginning of our meal was just the touch of luxury we enjoy.
A definite must in downtown Seattle if you're looking for a quality dining experience.

I'd walked past Heartwood Provisions tons of times and had been meaning to check it out. Luckily, work decided to host a dinner for us there so I finally got to try it! And it did not disappoint.
We shared a bunch of salads to start and they were delicious. I then ordered the scallops and they were divine. Perfectly cooked, with this delicious kind of sweet corn-esque sauce. Yum!! I was so full, but I wanted more of that sauce. The broccolini side was perfectly grilled, and people loved the potatoes gratin. The desserts were also yummy! The panna cotta was overly sweet, but I couldn't stop eating it! Service was fantastic and they never kept us waiting. I'll have to try it sometime on my own, but here's hoping work takes us to Heartwood Provisions again!

Really great restaurant!
-Service was amazing.
-100% try the "Beauty and the Beast" drunk. It's super cool, with smoke coming out, and really delicious.
-The oysters with Mezcal are amazing, definitely recommend.
-Apple and pear salad is really nice and light. A great starter.
-I was in between the Squash and Halibut, and Im glad I got the Halibut. The fish is amazing, the mushrooms were an incredible added texture, and the ponzu butter is delicious.
-The Smoked Caramel Panna Cotta is so good. Not my usual go to dessert but the server recommended it, and he was right.
Would definitely recommend this restaurant. Plus if you're staying at the Loews it's only a block away.
Also, pretty good happy hour!

If I could rate Heartwood 3.5 stars, I would - it's better than 3, but just didn't live up to 4 or 5 star desired billing! I liked the vibe of the restaurant, especially the bar - I could see coming back for drinks. The cocktails were 5 stars - both "The Usual" and "Summer in Provence" hit the spot.
After that, our food was just "OK", and didn't come close to hitting the price point. My wife loved the spring salad - great blend of flavors. I had the foie gras - pretty good, but not $20 good... we then split the pork chop, which I was excited for. However, we ended up disappointed, as it was really fatty! I cut off at least 25% of the weight of the cut. At $35-40, I need to be blown away and that wasn't it :(
Our waitress was amazing - shout out to her for serving us well.

Heartwood Provisions does not fall short on excellent food or service. Really the best meal I've had in a while I love dining in my downtown neighborhood and there are so many treasures in the city. It I enjoyed my meals here and so glad I finally came here during SRW for the opportunity to try some amazing dishes. The Poutine-best I ever had. Canada has nothing on this restaurant. Big pieces of fork tender beef brisket on top of cheesy fries. Amazing. Seafood stew-nice creamy texture full of fresh tomato flavor and spices. Beet salad- sooo good. Nice presentation with large cubes of beets with fresh greens, pecans and creamy goat cheese. Panna cotta- creamy, dense, sweetened cream with buttery toffee bits and sauce. Best dessert ever. Heartwood Provisions is now one of my favorite restaurants in downtown Seattle.

Everything about Heartwood Provisions is just so impeccable.
Reservation is recommended! Place is spacious but tends to be fully booked.
I came here both during SRW and regular dinner service so I'd say I have a solid judgment for this place.
*Smoked Cod Brandade (SRW)
According to the mighty google, brandade is an "emulsion of salt cod and olive oil." You're supposed to use it as a spread on a warm bread. I thought it was pretty good, well seasoned and had that smoky flavor.
*Grand Central Bread w/ Duck Fat Butter
Warm bread paired with fragrant duck fat butter? Yes please! The butter itself has distinct aroma and taste that I enjoy better than those of regular butter.
*Gruyère Potatoes
Potato gratin made using gruyère cheese and grain mustard. HEAVENLY! Enough said.
*Pork Belly (SRW)
Very tender and flavorful! The sweet roasted pear was a nice touch
*Roasted Scallop
I have mixed feeling about this dish. Scallops themselves are good but I don't think it meshed well with curry laksa sauce which didn't taste like laksa at all (resembles peanut sauce). Wasn't a big fan of the crispy ramen either. Overall, still good but wished it was cooked differently.
*Octopus
My gloom-ridden past experience with overly chewy octopus had left me wondering if this dish was even worth trying. In the end, I'm glad I made the RIGHT DECISION. It was so tender and seasoned well! The ink sofrito and tamarind created the right balance between savoriness and swetness of the sauce. The puffed rice, although I think was unnecessary, added another layer of texture to the dish.
*Smoked Caramel Panna Cotta
PHENOMENAL! One of the best desserts that I've had. The combination of brown butter apple, hazelnut crumbs, caramel pop corn, and vanilla ice cream elevates the overall flavor tenfold!
Service was attentive and amiable. Highly recommended!

Wonderful happy hour with friendly staff!
My boyfriend and I came here whilst out in downtown Seattle and realized we were near Heartwood Provisions, just at the right time. And when I say the right time, I mean happy hour! From 3-6pm everyday, you can partake in one of the best downtown happy hours, as drinks and food are offered at affordable prices.
I heard you're supposed to get a cocktail here, which I will totes do next time. But as soon as I learned there was a happy hour Bordeaux for only six bucks, you best believe I was about to get on that bandwagon, as Bordeaux wines are my absolute favorite kind of wines! Plus, The Burger was only 10 bucks, so c'mon! I had to order it, which made for an awesome Sunday supper.
As we waited for our food/dinner, we sipped on our Bordeaux and made friends with the bartender who could not have been nicer. He was making conversation with everyone at the bar, asking us how our day was and what brought us into Heartwood Provisions. I told him that I had heard about the happy hour burger here, which he confirmed was a crowd favorite. After telling him the Met has my favorite burger in downtown Seattle, he mentioned the Met was their sister restaurant. Of freaking course. It's a sign.
The Burger was fantastic! I seem to always be on the search for the best burger around town and the burger here measures up. It was definitely a large patty, cooked to medium-rare, with gruyere, arugula, pickled onion, horseradish aioli, all on a lightly-toasted brioche bun. Plus, the burger came with fries that were double-dipped, making them extra crunchy and oh-so-lovely with the horseradish aioli. Ask for a side of the aioli and nix the ketchup; your fries will thank you. I left feeling satisfied. It was a great early dinner/happy hour burger.
So glad to have finally made it to happy hour at Heartwood Provisions! Beautiful, yet inviting spot in downtown Seattle, with awesome eats and warm customer service. What's not to love?

I've always heard great things about Heartwood Provisions and we finally got to try this place for the first time on Valentine's Day and we went again recently and it has exceeded my expectations both times! Honestly, I think it might be my new favorite restaurant in Seattle!
First of all, the restaurant is beautiful! I love the overall interior design and ambience. The food here is pretty amazing! Everything was super flavorful yet it had such a delicate touch, it blended perfectly together. All the dishes were presented beautifully as well. I wanted to explore their menu so we tried different dishes each time we went.
My favorites were:
- Octopus (soooo good!! I didn't think I liked Octopus that much until trying this dish)
- Chicken Thigh (has a burst of flavor and the chicken was cooked to perfection)
- Crispy Cauliflower (wow what a surprise! didn't think cauliflower could be this delicious)
- Beef Burger (yummmm, one of the best beef patty I've had and the horseradish aioli made it even better!)
- last but not least, SMOKED CARAMEL PANNA COTTA. (perfection of a dessert - it has all the deliciousness with different textures and temperature, it is a burst of amazingness in your mouth!!) hahaha
Seriously, I absolutely loved everything from the interior, the service, the atmosphere, the food, to the drinks!! I can't wait to go back here and try all of their other dishes!

Came here with the in laws for Easter brunch. Nice relaxing ambiance with delicious food! The waitstaff was generally great - our waters were never empty. Left very hydrated lol.
I was a little disappointed with the server as he would walk by several times, look over at our table, and didn't address things that needed attending to (coffee refills, serving spoon for the appetizer, etc.) but would walk away quickly so we couldn't grab him. It also took an unusually long time to get our bill even though the waitstaff has our tables cleared for a while. We had to ask the server for our bills awkwardly though yet again he passed by many times.
Food... so delicious. I have never seen anchovies in Brussel sprouts before but it was zesty and delicious! My breakfast burger tasted great and so did my husband's pork shoulder hash. We will definitely come back again for the food!!

The congee blew me away! It was very well balanced with soft poached egg, Chinese sausage (always a favorite with its saltiness and fattiness), sautéed greens, and fried wontons.
