The congee itself was infused with ginger flavor and was so smooth. Drizzled on top was a pimenton chili oil to add color and spice. I'm inspired to raise the bar for my homemade congee now! .
Other dishes we tried was a smoked pork shoulder hash. It had fried kale (what a great crispy element to add!), preserved lemon aioli, onion, and sunny side up eggs. We shared a small plate of brussel sprouts. It had tallow, pickled chili, white anchovy, and preserved aioli. The Brussel sprouts were cooked perfectly. It was on the fine line of char where a second more it could be burnt but no it was done beautifully. I wish I could cook brussels like that!
Every dish that came out looked gorgeous. Every ingredient has its purpose to the plate to being the dish balance with acidity, texture and dimension. There was so much flavor in every dish. I was very happy with my decision to come here and will highly recommend to anyone. I want to come back and try more brunch or dinner options!

Came here during a company happy hour and was pleasantly surprised at how great (and reasonably priced) the happy hour menu was! We had a party of ~20 people are they were great at taking orders and delivering drinks and food in a timely manner.
If you are a tequila fan like myself, I highly recommend the Paloma. For happy hour eats, the poutine is a must-have. Brussell sprouts were good too!

We were there for Happy Hour (daily 3-6pm) and sat at the bar. I ordered Rotating Punch. Our bar tender made me this very refreshing cocktail drink with dried lime. After a long walk at Pike Market it was really good. Great atmosphere and great conversations with our bar staff. Gave us sightseeing tips.
パイクマーケットで歩き疲れたら、マーケットからちょっと南に歩いて3ー4分のお洒落なレストランでハッピーアワー(毎日３時から６時)のお酒とアパタイザアーはどうですか？バースタッフに日本からの方がいて、日本語OKでした。フルにお食事も出来ます。今回はお酒とおつまみだけだったので今度夕食に行く予定！

I have been here twice now and I enjoyed both my experiences here. This review is specific to the most recent one during SRW.
My husband and I went in on a Tuesday evening for dinner. It wasn't their busy time and we received a lot of attention from our server.
We both ordered out of their SRW menu.
I had the cauliflower soup, trout for entree and panacotta for dessert.
The cauliflower soup really knocked my socks off. I didn't expect it to be so creamy. Just straight up brilliant. The entree portion size was slightly small but when had as a part of a three course meal, it works. The trout was seasoned ever so lightly but the pairing with the citrus and the crispy rice noodle worked very well.
Their take on the panacotta was very fresh.
There were peaches and english biscuit like crust. It was a heavy dessert.
The service was great and the ambience is perfect for a date night. Definitely recommend!!

Delicious pizza (as well as pretty much everything on their menu - especially the Gorgonzola gnocchi, but I come for the pizza).
On top of the great food, the brothers who own Cornuto take thoughtful care in making those who drink and dine here feel welcome and well taken care of from the dishes offered, to the cocktails crafted and wine selected, to the ambiance provided.
I have eaten here countless times (and it's often a go-to to take out of town guests) and also hosted a dinner for fifteen guests for my birthday. From small gatherings to larger parties, this is an excellent place that makes any evening feel special.
Tip: Favorite spot to eat/drink in the winter is the bar, favorite spot to eat/drink in the summer is the back patio which boasts sunshine, balmy breezes, and beautiful hand crafted benches and tables (again, not to mention the delicious food).

Delicious pizza and drinks for a tucked away spot! My only gripe is that for the size and price of the pizza is pretty dismal. I get that it's an artisanal pizza etc but that combined with one drink came out to over $35.00. Good food, just come prepared for some sticker shock at the end.

I love this place! First of all, the pizza is wonderful! And highly recommend the veal meatballs to start. If you are in a sharing mood, the gnocchi with Gorgonzola is also a good way to start a meal here:) the buffalina is prob my favorite. You can really taste the fresh tomato sauce and the creamy buffalo cheese. If ordering two pizzas, this is always one of them. Also a nice wine selection, Chianti is my go to. The Nutella calzone is a great way to end a meal if you've saved room. I was skeptical ordering but it is not overly sweet, well balanced amount of Nutella with dough and some fresh fruit. In the summer they have an outdoor deck in the back.

The food and ambience were amazing. We sat out on the back deck and while it was a little chilly, it was worth it! We god the Diavola pizza and added arugula along with the Tricolore salad and pesto gnocchi. Everything was great. I look forward to going f back soon!

Very cute date spot in the heart of Greenwood. They make everything right in front of you in the brick oven, which is very cool. Their wood fired pizza is really delicious & I loved the flavor on the crust. I ordered the Cipollina & my boyfriend ordered the spaghetti alle vongole. We watched them cook both our orders, they cook the clams in the wood oven & pour the clam juice right onto the pasta so it gets a really great flavor. The pizza was very tasty, I added mushrooms for a little extra flavor. My only complaint was that it was unclear that the pizza did not come with red sauce, it only had olive oil as the sauce. It still tasted great, it just wasn't what I expected. We also ordered a side of bread on the side for the pasta, so soak up the leftover clam sauce because it was so yummy. I also had a glass of wine that was just ok. Overall, I'd go back Cornuto for a nice date night. I'm not sure how it vibes with the rest of the spots in the neighborhood, which are more family oriented, this place is a bit more upscale.

The pizza here is Neapolitan style, similar to Tutta Bella or Via Trublinali. I went here on an afternoon for the happy hour, but after reading the reviews about how small the hh pizza was and finding that it was only 6$ off the list price, it would make it $11 for a 9" pizza, wow.
The full price pizza I got was Prosciutto which cost $17, it was barely 12" maybe 11. Incredibly bland with little to no cheese and a very slim layer of 5 small pieces of prosciutto. I asked for extra sauce on the pizza, but it still came a bit dry so I asked for some on the side.
They charged me $1 for the sauce and $17 for a tiny mediocre pizza. I was amazed that they are in business. total or $24 for lunch and I was still hungry afterwards....:(
Great location with nice western sun and outside seating front and back. It's really too bad they are not making a better effort on the food.
Cornuto is so cozy and inviting. I love the warm atmosphere and welcoming service almost as much as I love their wood-fired pizza. The perfect spot for date night! Cornuto has a new regular :)

I called in to order takeout, but they said I couldn't place an order over the phone because they were "too busy." Oddly, they said I could walk in and place a takeout order. That's completely unacceptable and a waste of the customer's time. Seriously, what successful pizza place refuses to take phone orders, let alone whine to the customer that they're too busy? Do yourself a favor and get your pizza from somewhere else. These guys are apparently so busy they don't need your business. I called Razzis and they were more than happy to take my order.

I last reviewed this restaurant four years ago. When I was first dating my now-wife, this was a great place for a romantic and tasty date. It has only gotten better since then and this has become a favorite neighborhood spot to relax. The cocktails have improved, the vibe is just as cozy. In the summer, the back patio is a great place to sit and enjoy pizza and a drink. The pizza is still amazing and made as pizza should be. The service is top notch, with personal attention and care from each bartender and server.

I'll admit it, if I didn't live around here I probably never would have found this place or come here, but it is awesome! Just a short walk from Greenlake, Cornuto is a stellar restaurant in Phinney Ridge. Aside from the pizza, they have an awesome bar. I love to come here late in the evenings because there is a bartender who makes a killer Amaretto Sour. I have also tried a few of their drink specials, and they never fail to be delicious. The wood fired pizza is also pretty good, if you're not too hungry a single pizza is enough to feed 2 people. I would definitely recommend this as a top restaurant and bar in the area that is decently priced too!

I'm a big fan of their happy hour pizza and carafes of house wine.
I probably make an appearance for said meal once every other week and I've never been disappointed. The owner, manager, and servers are all lovely. In the summer the back deck is a wonderful spot to lounge and well-behaved pups are allowed.

What?! I've been hearing about this place for weeks, but was disappointed. Tough, chewy crust. Scant ingredients...I ordered a pizza with prosciutto and basil, but the prosciutto was dry and came off in a single bite, and the basil - which tasted fresh - covered about 5% of the pie. $22 poorly spent on my opinion. :-/
The best neighborhood pizza place! The burrata will change your life! Highly recommend for a date night or a girls night - and they have outdoor seating! Five stars for sure!
Best calzone I've ever had, and it lasted me two days! Very nice staff too, personable and quick with service

We LOVE this place!! Not because it's a short walk from our house, but because the pizza is incredible! They cut up the ingredients fresh when you order! They have a wood oven inside and a beautiful atmosphere! The lights are low, the candles are lit and the energy is wonderful! I want to try a craft cocktail because the bartender is awesome. It's that classic charm with incredible food!

Have been here 3 or 4 times now & each visit is just as good as the first. The pizza is top in the city & love that it comes with scissors for cutting slices. The wine is also very tasty. Staff is friendly. Cute space too.

Came here with my dad while he was visiting and initially I just thought it would be another artisan pizza place, but I was completely blown away. The pizza is just the way I like it, with a thin crust, but not so paper thin that it's a big cracker. Cocktails were spot on and the tiramisu was addictive. I got home and wished I had gotten some to go... still thinking about it weeks later.
But this review is more about the service, which I can confidently say was perfect. Josephine (blonde hair, early 20s), was one-hundred-percent accurate in anticipating our needs and offered us what we needed before we even knew we needed it. She was congenial and attentive without being over-the-top. As a veteran server, I realize how difficult this can be and her nuanced attentiveness deserves a tip-of-the-hat. In fact, both of the ladies on the floor that night were working in tandem, the energy was just right, and I was truly impressed. It's refreshing to see a newer spot have good food and amazing service. Looking forward to coming back for more of that killer tiramisu and ladies, keep crushing it. You're appreciated!!!

Not bad but wasn't anything special. I wouldn't recommend the Caesar salad, it was honestly one of my least favorite I've had in recent memory. Everything felt overpriced and then on top of that I was charged an extra $3 for ricotta on my pizza and it was just 3 small dollops. The crust was a little saltier than I prefer but the texture was great and the flavor of the toppings was wonderful. Overall, I didn't leave disappointed but probably won't be back.

I've lived in Phinney Ridge for a month and have been here at least ten times. The pizza is so damn good, environment is awesome, everyone who works there is friendly and cool, and get that Nutella calzone cause dayuuuummm.

A solid Neapolitan pizza place that's become our staple on nights when we need something tasty, good for kids, and in our neighborhood (Greenwood). The place is small but rarely has a wait. There are 3 sections of the restaurant, a small part where you can view the pizza oven where all the action happens, a larger room where I have seen larger groups, and a back patio for when it's nice!
The menu has a revolving selection of cocktails and wines by the glass and bottle. The pizza menu is extensive and the apps/salad are legit. We typically get the meatballs, Caesar salad, margarita pizza, diavola, verde, and sometimes the Vongole (clams!). It's hard to go wrong.
The atmosphere is casual but as it gets later, it's a bit dim and the candles on the tables add a nice touch, so if you swing by after 8 it would be a good date place or if you come by later, say after 10pm, it would be nice for after a game or concert.

I was meeting up with a friend there after work and wondering if we could make it to HH. If you are like me searching for HH information - it's daily 5-6pm then again 9-10pm at the bar area!
They have a decent HH menu with $2 oyster & $7ish wine. You could try some of their main dishes in a smaller portion from HH menu as well. My favorite was the pasta with beef cheek (not on HH menu), good for sharing btw two people.
This place is much more spacious than most restaurants in west Seattle. I'd consider it a good spot for small group events. Reservation is pretty easy through open table.

Probably the best and newest find in all of West seattle. I have gone here a few handfuls of time and I would say go order
- burrata with extra bread
- all the three pasta choices
- scallops
- steak and fries
If at happy hour, the burger is

What an awesome addition to West Seattle! I came here on a Friday night with a couple of friends. You are able to make reservations which is awesome.
We choose a few dishes to share such as their crispy duck, rigatoni pasta, quail legs, and tuna appetizer. The duck and the pasta stood out to me. The duck was so moist with crispy skin. the pasta tasted fresh and was full of flavor.
The atmosphere was warm and inviting. It is a great place for an intimate dinner. The server was also very helpful and attentive.

What a great place for a nice dinner or brunch in the middle of Alaska Junction. Highly recommend to have a reservation! Everything we tried on the menu was very delicious but soup was definitely one of my most favorite meals. I wish the place was a little less loud but otherwise a great place to have a beautiful dinner.

My first time trying Haymaker was during Restaurant Week so I didn't see their regular menu. I did enjoy my meal and do want to make a return visit sometime!
Restaurant Week 3 course menu $35/person
Starters for the table
- I'm used to just picking your own starter, but here you get all 4 to share. What a great deal!
- Seared Tuna: I didn't try this because fish.
- Organic Greens: A pretty good salad. I wouldn't order it just because I rarely order salads at a restaurant, but I wouldn't complain if it was included as a side or starter.
- Risotto: Yummy and flavorful. I'd enjoy this as a full entree even.
- Pork Rillette: I had googled this beforehand to see if I wanted to choose it. I didn't think I'd like it because apparently it's similar to pate. But it was more like braised or pulled pork consistency, and salty. I ended up really liking it!
Choice of Entree
- Tonnarelli: This reminds me of cacio e pepe (cheese and pepper) pasta. It was very creamy. I found it a little too peppery.
- Braised Beef Cheeks: They were out of duck confit, so this was the substitution. I only tried a small bite, but it was very tender.
Choice of Dessert
- Since there was 3 of us, we each ordered a different option so that we could try all 3.
- Chocolate Fritters: They are like chocolate donut holes. I don't care for chocolate cake or donuts that much (would rather have vanilla or another flavor), so I just thought these were OK. I did really like the dulce de leche sauce though.
- Sorbet: Blueberry was the only offered flavor, and I think you'll like it if you really like blueberry.
- Cheese: Baked Brie with a crouton. I love Brie so this was tasty! I like it gooey but since it hardens as it cools, it's like a challenge to eat it when it's still hot but not too hot.
Drinks
- Westside $12: I don't remember the taste now that it's been a couple days, but I liked it the most of the 3 drinks our table ordered.
- Green Light $13
- Improved Whiskey Cocktail $12
*****
My Star Ratings:
1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.
2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.
3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.
4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.
5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.
Brunch on the weekend here is so good. Loved their giant pancake! Great coffee and lovely atmosphere for a date or girls outing. Highly recommend.

I was pleasantly surprised to find this in West Seattle. It takes a lot for me to venture into Seattle these days with all the cray cray ness going on so something good outside of the city is a bonus. Here I didn't have to worry about terrible parking. We didn't have reservations on a Friday night but lucked out in the bar after a tiny wait. Totally worth it hanging out with a super funny bartender. Food was delicious. Tried some unique dishes and loved it all. Ambiance lovely. Can't wait to go back again.

We were super excited to try Haymaker, as we are big fans of the other General Harvest Restaurants, and the place did not disappoint! We went on the second day after opening and it really seemed like they were very well prepared and knowledgeable of the menu.
We ordered the octopus, burrata, heirloom tomato, and Dungeness crab salad as appetizers. Our favorites were the burrata and octopus, but we all enjoyed the Dungeness salad as well. The heirloom salad was a bit of a disappointment compared to the rest.
For the pasta and protein portions we ordered the rabbit bolognese, agnolotti, black cod, and pork loin. As expected (given the chef's focus on pasta at his other restaurants) the pasta was delicious. We were split 50-50 for which of the protein dishes was better, but I was a big fan of the black cod.
Will be back again!

I was really excited to visit Haymaker but shortly upon entering, I realized this place is not for me. The vibe felt a little bit off/unwelcoming.
I was able to get a table without a reservation which was nice - but quickly came for realize (at least for my first visit) you have to wait 5-10 minutes to get initial drink service. I was by myself at a table below the bar area at this point, waiting for my friend.
When the server did come to my table, she was off putting. Friendly words yet came across as somewhat rude and condescending.
When my friend arrived it took the server a while for her to come to the table and get his order. When she did, he didn't get the most positIve vibe either. He ordered the same drink as I and was disappointed by the value for the price.
The server came to ask if we wanted food and we held off for a moment, debating if we wanted to stay for another drink - and for food. When we decided to ask for the check, it was evident she was annoyed by us. We saw her walk back toward the kitchen and say something to her colleague whom seemed to smile about whatever she said. We are pretty certain she spoke negatively about us at this point when we didn't ever do or say anything to her to warrant it.
I was hoping I would love this place, but nope! Not based on the service today.
I will not return to Haymaker nor recommend it to any of my friends, or otherwise.
The $14 cocktails were good though - but better worth the spend somewhere else.

We love Le Messe, so were excited to meet West Seattle friends here. My dirty martini was among the best I've had, and the others liked their beer and cocktails. Our server was stellar, he was very knowledgeable and helpful.
My husband and I were split on the crab salad. It had an Italian fish sauce on it, and I thought it was too salty and overpowered the crab, but husband liked it. Our friends loved their brussels sprouts and cauliflower, as well as the pork chop and scallops. We LOVED our 1/2 duck! It was perfect and so tasty. The tonnarelli, however, was hard, not al dente. My husband ate it, as he was hungry. We should have sent it back. Good wine by the glass.

We have been very anxious to visit the new West Seattle restaurant. Haymaker as it's partner restaurant Raccolto is one of our favorites. It did not disappoint. The service was excellent, the ambience feels right with great music in the background.
But that 1/2 roasted duck...wow. When I saw it was one the website menu, I really needed to get to Haymaker. I appreciate that they do not just serve the breast of the duck, and that I was able to enjoy a phenomenal entree that was excellent value, and most importantly was perfect in flavor. The meat was tender and juicy, and the skin was crisp and golden. My wife's Tonnarelli was also excellent. The salad was huge (perfect to split) and flavorful, and broccoli was also excellent.
We will be back!!!

Positive:
The Dungeness Crab was delicious. Best dish of the night. The agnolotti was also very good.
Negative:
The fuses were not well balanced. They served half a squash with 2 table spoons of goat cheese. The dessert was fried balls of dough served with a miniature portion of dulce de leche. The agnolotti portion size was small and not enough for one person. The service was mediocre and so was the drink selection.
If I go back, it would be for the crab.

Dinner was delicious! Taking into consideration this was day 3 after initial opening service was great!
Will return again and again to eat my way through the menu. Keep up the good work Chef Clevenger!

Decent addition to the West Seattle restaurant scene. The vibe is good and the pasta is (unsurprisingly) delicious, but the rest of the menu misses the mark on execution. Notably:
- Carrots were overcooked, undersalted, and the sauce was both too oily and too thin
- "Improved Whisky Cocktail" was way too heavy on the absinthe
- Sous vide pork tenderloin toppings were not well balanced in proportion, and the pork was surprisingly tough for a supposed 5 hour cook.
On the plus side, the guanciale pasta was amazing - a really spectacular dish.
If I were betting, I'd wager this place improves over the coming months. That said, it's not where it needs to be for me to recommend it, at least right now.

Happy Hour
Staff: friendly and attentive.
Ambiance: love it! It has a very industrial feel but it's bright and open. It's a small restaurant but the design makes it look like it's a lot more spacious. I even found the bathroom well designed. Also love an open kitchen.
Price: HH prices are decent for the portion and quality of food.
Food: ordered the oysters, pasta and burger. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The pasta and burger were both good BUT waaaaaaay too salty. The beef from the burger was one of the best I've had in a while. It comes with cheese which may be why it was salty. In that case, there should be less salt in the beef. The pasta also came with delicious Parmesan (?) but again, so salty. Thinking about it, I should have sent them both back.
I'm on the fence of going back. There aren't a lot of places like this in West Seattle. I may ask friends if they experienced the same overly salty dish or if it was just a fluke that day.
Had a wonderful experience! Food was tasty. Atmosphere was has great energy! Love the small plate selection to share food with your date. Wait staff is excellent!

Cool decor, nice staff but food is odd mix of ostentatious and millennial blah.
Aoli is Mayo
Beef is runny, I could have spoken up.
All in all not bad but.....meh!
Also put the price on the menu, don't give me that " if you have to ask" bs
Just give me straight forward info

If you're looking for a great dining experience, drop anchor at the Haymaker and you won't be disappointed. The good news: four of us had a great meal with more than a half dozen dishes that we shared, a couple of rounds of wine, and we headed out the door only $275 lighter. That's a heck of a deal for a quality meal.
With the possible exception of the carrots we ordered, everything else we tried was excellent. Perfectly prepared and expertly presented. The pasta with mushrooms and sausage is to die for (all of their pastas are really good), the steak with frites was spot on, and the swordfish cooked to perfection.
The waitstaff was friendly, very knowledgeable and gave us great recommendation to flesh out our meal after we'd made a main selections.
A truly enjoyable experience and we'd definitely go back for another visit.

great big open space! I appearantly just joined a group that is waiting to get in. Awesome happy hour....the groups just kept ordering. I loved the staggered good! that is how folks would do back at home...

Finally! The Junction gets a new addition worth going to. As a long time fan of Raccolto, I was excited to see an expanded menu concept featured at Haymaker. We've been in twice now, and haven't been disappointed in any of the dishes we've tried (and we've tried a lot of them.)
Standouts include: the burrata (which we've had served with both peach and eggplant, the grilled broccoli with fonduta, and the roasted baby carrots. The proteins are definitely the stars of the show, and I will have a hard time not ordering the pork collar and the NY steak on future visits. Both dishes have so much flavor, and the meat is cooked absolutely perfectly. I am usually not a huge fan of fries with steak, but these are crispy, salty, and delicious. To the person who said their beef was runny...do you mean juicy? Like, is that something to be mad about? Huh.
Anyways, go. Food, service, and drinks were all great.

Review for cannolis only (but they did have coffee & sandwiches)!
I'm a little picky about how sweet desserts are and usually shy away from cannolis because they always feel like a mouthful of sugar, but these were just the right amount of sweet and crunchy! There's a menu of 5-6 different types and I scooped up the Original, Espresso, and Lemon. They're made to order, too, so the shells are fresh, the filling is a really lovely smooth consistency and (again) not overpoweringly sweet. The lemon was my fav hands down, and it wasn't a long wait for 3 large cannolis at all. Service was fast, efficient, and polite! Pricing is a little on the expensive side in my opinion but, hey, it's a solid cannoli!
I rate places or depending on if I'd return and Holy Cannoli is a for me. I'd totally go back for a quick sugar fix when the craving strikes!

My friend and I came here for, you guessed it, cannolis! We visited in the late morning on a Saturday and all of the small shells for a cannoli were sold out. So, both of us ordered the original of the large, which they fill in store. The original is a vanilla cream-filled cannoli with chocolate chips on the ends.
The space is small, but luckily, my friend and I were the only patrons so found some bar stools by the window. My cannoli was good, and though I am not a cannoli expert by any means, visiting Holy Cannoli makes me wanna be one! The shell was stiff, but easy to bite into and the vanilla cream was solid, and I really liked that it was served at a chilled temperature. For next time though I definitely would want to do a small cannoli, as I thought the large size was so rich for just one person. I'd also like to try the other flavors, like the coconut or Nutella!
In addition to cannolis, Holy Cannoli has savory items like Italian sandwiches, salads and a full espresso bar. It's nice to know that for some casual Italian eats on the go, Holy Cannoli is there for ya.

We happened across this place after an afternoon at the science center. All 5 of us were approaching hangry and Yelp helped us discover a spot for cannolis and sandwiches!
It was a quick walk from the science center and basically marked the edge of Belltown (we walked to another spot in Belltown afterwards!). The shop seats maybe 15 and serves soups (when available), sandwich (when available), cannolis and caffeinated beverages!
The just nearly eeked out a four in my book, mostly because the sandwich our little guys had was so good - the seven mile special - it was a Seattle porcine party on crusty bread! Out turkey Sami was just so so- I think we were the last folks ordering sandwiches that night and we definitely got the vibe that our presence wasn't really required for our baristas evening to be complete. Not rude, but similar to a cat - not caring a lot either way.
We shared 3 Cannolis - chocolate, original and lemon. All were very good, though a bit expensive. I think 3 were something like $9, so not cheap but not so expensive that you had to eat at the crumbs.
By the time we were there, they were out of soup, a couple sandwiches, a few cannolis and some beverages. A bit weird but c'est la vie'. I imagine that 4:30 on a Sunday afternoon isn't totally prime time, but not having a number of items was a bit lame. Again, first world problems!
Well worth checking out if you're in the mood for some Italian insoires goodness!

My first-ever cannoli! Upon entering, the owner was surprisingly rude and put her finger up at me and gave me a stern look because she was on the phone. If I wasn't desperate to try a cannoli, I would've walked out at that exact moment LOL. While she was on the phone, I was browsing the cannolis on display and discussing the different flavors with my friends. After she got off the phone she explained that she was bombarded all day so that's why she was a little frazzled and was instantly friendly so I overlooked everything that happened upon my arrival haha. I just ordered the original cannoli in the mini shell, tried it, and wasn't too amazed. It was pretty messy to eat because the shell just cracked in half when I bit into it. They have plenty of flavors to try so maybe pick up a few if you stop by!

Always great service! The owner is a real delight, very nice to see people so genuine. #NoSeattleFreezeHere!
Give this place a try the cannoli are tasty, the service is exceptional, and they also have other yummy snacks to eat too!

Such a pleasant treat and excellent indulgence to look forward to when I am back in down town Seattle . The owner makes and hand pipes each cannoli to order so they remain crispy and flaky with each and every bite . Get a half dozen to try different flavors or a dozen to share . I had the pistachio , traditional , chocolate , and they were all perfect tasting . Never too sweet and balanced easily with a latte or espresso, also made In house .
I can't wait to return to try the coconut flavor soon. Thank you Andrea , who's truly Italian , for an amazing cannoli encounter .

I really wanted to love this place, but I didn't. The cannolis are mediocre and over priced. $3 for a cannoli that you can eat in two bites.
They also sell sandwiches and salads that are decently priced, but nothing amazing.
Don't expect great customer service either. The woman at the counter looked very unfriendly and didn't even greet us when we entered. Not worth it if you ask me. There are other places in Seattle to get great cannolis and great customer service!

The cannolis were delicious! They have 7-8 flavors to choose from. I got two small cannolis, one lemon and one traditional. Lemon was just tart enough with a balancing sweetness that wasn't overpowering. The traditional was dusted with a cocoa powder mixture and had a satisfying cream flavor with the perfect level of sweet.
Adrienne (the owner) and Nick were super friendly and accommodating. Talked with them for a good 5-10 minutes after finishing up my cannolis just because. A delicious and great experience all around.

Lady doesn't appreciate customers!!!! Don't waste your time. We walked in and Were ignored for a while because a friend of the employee was there gossiping with her. Latte was bad, cannolis were just ok. Dog hair in my latte

Would I come back? Who doesn't like dessert when they are mini sized. You get to try more and not feel bad about eating it.
Saw this on the Yelp map and decided to give it a try since it was near our breakfast spot. Each cannoli is $3 which is a tad bit pricey but I am on vacation, so I don't mind.
I ordered 3 different cannoli: original, salted caramel pecan and banana cream pie. I asked the cashier if she had any recommendations and she said that they are all about the same, just different flavors. No difference in texture or anything.
My favorite would be the banana cream pie. It had a hint of banana flavor and it was not too sweet. The salted caramel pecan was a miss for me. It sounded promising but I didn't think it was that great. I feel like the outside shell was not that fresh for the cannoli since it was kind of stale.
Would love to give it a try again if I knew that they were freshly made. Then again, I am no cannoli expert so maybe the shells are not supposed to be that crispy.

Holy Cannoli!!!! I just saw this relatively nearby when I was on google maps so I decided to walk here. I love Cannolis and I had some time to kill so cannolis felt like a brilliant idea. This quaint little shop is easy to find and it has a tight interior with a few small table tops. I believe the majority of the people here order to go.
Cannoli Prices:
- $3/each
- $16/half dozen
- $28/dozen
These cannolis are fresh baked daily and they are freshly stuffed throughout the day. Adrian, the owner, was telling me if she had any leftover from the night before, she would sell them in the morning for half price. That's awesome business ethics.
I decided on buying 3 cannolis and I had every intention on saving them for later, but they were so delicious I actually ate all three within minutes of buying them. Had I known sooner, I would have probably gotten then half dozen or dozen. Anyways, I had the nutella, almond toffee crunch and lemon. They were all delicious but my favorite among the three was probably the almond toffee crunch.
Holy Cannoli is definitely a gem that I would recommend if you are visiting the Seattle area. There Italian pastries can be found in many places, but it is rare that you can get baked and stuffed so fresh!

This review is for the cannoli only. I'm from the east coast...where imo, anything cannoli will be better than anywhere on the west. I was proven wrong today. This spot right here...has some goood stuff that reminded me of back home. New York and Jersey are still my top picks though.
The crunch and breakoff texture is on point...right before that cool filling hits and lushly melts away with the rest of your bite. Banana Cream Pie, Almond, Tiramisu, Traditional, or whatever flavors that excite you...will satisfy without cloying from too much sweetness.
I feel like I'm a different man after having a cannoli here. You know...like I have just discovered why my girl friends go all wow on these things. I'm on the hunt for some more sweet eats now.
5 stars baby! Do ittt!!!

Came later in the day to try these cannolis and the selection was still broad! I bought three which were $3 each. These cannolis are short and fat as I would describe them. I've been to Italy and really missed the italian cannolis so these definitely hit the spot! They didn't taste identical to the italian ones, but they were a nice treat! The shell was crispy and crunchy and there was a generous amount of filling in each cannoli! The shop is small and there was no wait when I went. The parking lot across the street also had a nice view of the space needle, which was cool. I would go here again to fulfill my sweet tooth craving!

Holy Cannoli is right! This is the perfect name for this place because their cannolis are out of this world! We came an hour before they were going to close, so when we were looking for what kind of cannolis to get, it was slim pickings. But the girl at the counter was so nice.. she said she would fill the other cannolis she had with whatever flavor we wanted! We ended getting 4 - 2 of the traditional and 2 of the coconut. There are 2 sizes, but we opted for the smaller one and it was just perfect! Not too sweet and it had a great crunch. My favorite was the traditional :)
Just a note - we saved 2 for later.. and they were a little soggy - don't wait to eat them!

worst cannoli ever.. she was out of all the flavors, nothing left to choose from!
lady working was not helpful and rude!
don't waste your time going here!
I've been looking for a taste of Sicilian cannoli for years around the world. And I found it here! The best cannoli in the world!!

So many cannolis miss on both aspects -- the pastry AND the filling. At best, you'll get a cannoli that's decent on one or other. But these cannolis are great. Perfect pastry. Delicious filling. We stuck with the traditional for our first trip here, and we will be back to try some of the others.

The cannolis are good but the have more cupcakes than they do cannolis. Not to mention they called them "cupcake" cannolis to make it seem as if they were cannolis even though they couldn't be bothered to make more variations of cannolis
This was a fun stop for a sweet treat after Chihuly and the space needle. All the flavors were delicious!

HOLY CANNOLI! These are so good! I stopped by for work to grab a box that we ordered for a meeting and I decided to pick-up two for myself to test it out. They're definitely on the pricier side ($3 per mini cannoli). I got the nutella & the coconut ones. Typically I'm not a big cannoli fan because they're super sweet and overbearing. I really liked these ones because they were more mild in their sweetness. I could definitely go back and need to take the boyfriend for a visit!

It's seriously always fun to come here! It's very tapas like items, except for the pizza! The pizza is just super unexpected and I love the idea of cutting it with a pair of gold scissors! This is super fun to do during HH and coming here with friends after a long hard day!
This is also a great working lunch location for obvious reasons! You can come here and share a glass of bubbly for a promotion or good talk or even just come here to get out of the office to talk shop. It's great 1:1 area.
I wish I felt more like I was in the spheres though. Gotta be honest it doesn't really have the feel to it if you've ever been inside the spheres themselves
The prices are a bit higher for the amount of food. That's why I warn ya that it is tapas style!
All in all I would only come here if I was in the area. I wouldn't make reservations to go here to come into the city for a Friday night.

A great little Italian spot hidden away on 5th Avenue in Seattle. Right around the corner from the Amazon Understory.
Modernly decorated, cozy, friendly atmosphere.
Although I wasn't very hungry, they had a unique selection of food and beverages! Having a holiday cocktail, I tried the Parco Savello which was unique & refreshing. Also sampled the Hadrian's Villa which was good as well.
Again, not being very hungry, but the menu looked so good, I decided I had to try some of the food. The Mushroom pizza was delightful and surprisingly not too heavy.
Will definitely be back to try some more the next time I'm in town!

It was a rainy December Friday night in Seattle. Imagine that, so it was perfect.The Center of the city was empty and the inside parking was free and we had a 8:15 PM reservation.
WG is located on the ground floor of one of the Amazon Spheres and as such it is a stunning minimalist space that curves around the inside. Our wet coats were taken and our party of 5 was quickly seated.
We began our evening with cocktails and appetizers that were both tasty and a bit pricy even for city center dining.
Cacio w Collins Honey crostini came with two small slices of the cheese and maybe a tablespoon of honey at $12.00.
Pacific octopus w/ roasted fennel and anchovy came with a price tag of $20.00. Both of these appetizers were very tasty but they both deserved either a larger portion or a more reasonable price.
The roasted beets w/ creme fraiche and the Gnocchi w/ pecorino both were very tasty and priced more in line for what we expected.
Now for the real reason to come to WG and that was the main course, Pizza. One large Chanterelle Pizza and one crispy Pepperoni Pizza were everything you would expect from a top notch Pizza kitchen and the Pepperoni was cooked to a prefect crispy crunch. These thick pies are served on wood cutting boards and you are given a pair of scissors to cut whatever size piece of pie yours eyes desire.
Overall the service was friendly and attentive the space is unique and visually exciting. The food was all very tasty. My recommendation would be to come for the Pizza which is very good and pass on the pricey appetizers. In fact that is what we will do next time we are in Seattle.

Was seriously hungry for pizza and am very lazy so I got my Tuesday Night Goth Practice group to go here because it had the word "Ghost" in the title. Long story short this place would get 5 stars if it didn't actually have the ghost of some dead guy named Pepper Willmott flying around! It was cool for like 10 minutes but then our pizza came and this ghost flew through it like 8 times and made it smell like farts! Who wants a haunted fart pizza?! 2 stars for getting a ghost to haunt your establishment, 1 Star for the bartender knowing what a Shirley Hemple was (from the show What's Happening) and 1 Star for square shaped pizza, even though ours got haunted which ruined Goth practice for my group.

This is in one of the Amazon spheres, but you can't really see the plants or garden part at all. Came here for a quick pre-dinner drink / snack. Ambiance is very clean, bright, a bit feminine, but really pleasant.
I think they're known for their pizzas but we got the fried gnocchi, burrata and focaccia. Didn't expect the gnocchi to be fried when we ordered, but it is on the menu as "fritti" so we just didn't notice. Regardless, it was pretty delicious, somewhere in between a smooth tater tot and croquette, and it had a nice mild heat. I enjoyed them. The burrata was ok, but I thought it was a really small portion. I'm used to it being served in a ball and this was like a half a ball that was cut open. It was really too small for $15, presentation wasn't super appetizing, and it didn't even come with any bread, the focaccia was a separate order. I will say the focaccia was really good though and I'm glad we ordered it.
I also got the Minerva's cup cocktail and enjoyed it. If you like mezcal I thought it was refreshing and good for summer.
I give it 3.5 stars, but because I didn't get pizza It might be unfair rate this restaurant as a whole. I rounded up to 4 for decent food and fun ambiance, and giving benefit of doubt for the pizza.

Beautiful space with a fresh and exquisite menu. Located on the exterior of the Amazon Spheres, Willmott's Ghost is a great little spot to get the true Seattle/Amazon experience.
We went for a mid-week lunch, and as soon as you walk in you are floored by the tastefully designed space. The decor lends to a feminine feel that is light and airy, which complements the next-door Spheres well. I couldn't stop gushing over the pink with gold accents everywhere, lending way to a gorgeous bathroom and Instagram-worthy experience.
We sat outside, which is great people/dog watching as the restaurant is right next to the Amazon Day 1 building. Once you get past the gorgeous design, you can focus in on the menu which is carefully curated and focused on fresh ingredients.
GET THE PIZZA! I got the zucchini pizza with mint, mozzarella, almond and feta, as well as the side of figs with ricotta and focaccia. The slice of pizza came out, and they're cut square and are a little different than pizza you may be used to but the bread is to die for -- it's light and fluffy, and definitely full of flavor. Topped with the toppings of your choice, it's something I can't wait to order again. Really not sure how the pizza was so good to a pizza snob like me, but it was incredible.
The figs were a small portion - but a nice little side. The ricotta it was served with was soft and paired perfectly with the sweetness of the figs. I recommend ordering a few of these 'sides' and going with a big pizza or two (you can order whole pizzas vs. just a slice) if you have a large enough group.
If you're looking for a pretty restaurant with amazing food, Willmott's Ghost is a great find in the hustle and bustle of the Amazon campus. I'm looking forward to round 2!

Cute restaurant in the coolest structure! The restaurant is inside a glass ball, which makes the restaurant itself super interesting. The decoration is all pink and green, so its super cute and modern.
-service was not great
-the food is whatever, nothing special
-good drinks
-cool bathroom
Honestly, it's a worthwhile restaurant for the place and the decoration, but don't expect much from the food

So this place is very fun and delicious.
The decor is very 1950s diner. Small place, very cute. Seems out of place to be in the Amazon Spheres, but it is very cool inside.
The drinks were fun and smart. The Panna Oro was a creamsicle turned into a drink. It wasn't crazy sweet like at other restorative have tried to mimic a creamsicle. It was perfectly balanced and tasted just like a creamsicle. LOVED IT!!!!!
The food was great too. We definitely ordered way too much food, but it was all good and we got to take home leftovers. We had their Fresh & Pickled Pepper Pizza. It could've used some sausage on it to round out all the flavors, but still very good. The Scallop Crudo was great. The pickled cherries that came with the Pork Terrine was amazing. We also had their Brick Chicken with Chicken Liver Pate.
I would definitely go back to try other menu items.

Petty mediocre. Nice and airy. Slow service.
The thing is- do you like your pizza burned ?
Overall not bad. Very nice cafe decor. Not a big food menu but the coffee was good, pizzas we got weren't burnt and pretty good. On the pricey side. But overall our visit to this cafe was great!

Gnocchi: Dry and Spicy but smells good. 2.5/5
Tiramisu: Average. If you've never tried tiramisu then they make pretty good ones. A little too much for one person. Share! 3.5/5
Final Score 3/5
Cute place - wonderful decor. Pizza is a simple Roman style pizza. The salad was beautiful and delicious as well.

Yummmm! And fun!!
Dining inside the sphere? Drinks? And Italian? Not to mention Roman style too?? Sign me up!
The place is gorgeous! Obviously! Open kitchen! Open sphere! Love! Came with my girlfriends for a week night dinner and we shut it down! Literally!
The good/ decor and service!
A ok: the food!
Six of us ordered everything on the menu for primi and appetizers (6-8?) .Got a secondi and a pizza and a few desserts!
Most dishes are good. Having an Italian family means my expectations are a little higher. And having family in Rome and spending a month there every year, I'm all about Roman food!
So some of the dishes are good. Just a little too busy! Mortadella is what we usually make at home. It's great. But the pizza has the spice that you usually don't find in Italian food/ Roman cuisines.
The calamari was too oily. They were good but not great. Nothing really stands out. Also we did a lot of fried items. Got so full so fast! Clams were good but not quite Roman. Too much seasoning. Pizza was the same. Overall, we had a blast from the company and the atmosphere. We left full too. Food was a ok for me! The staffs great though!

Willmott's Ghost is a great concept, in reality however it misses the mark. My brother and I looked to make a reservation here and it was wide open, so we chose to risk it for a table without a reservation on a Sunday night. We showed up and the place was empty except for two tables. They asked if we had a reservation which we said no, and they were only able to seat us at the bar. We looked around at the entire restaurant with open tables but they refused to let us take a table.
We ordered salad, burrata, drinks, and a pizza to share. The salad was delicious and had a great dressing. The bartender failed to tell us that the burrata did not come with bread until after it arrived, so we had to order focaccia at that point which they bake from scratch so it took another 20 minutes to arrive. It was worth the wait because it was delicious, but it seemed like something they would want to mention at the time a customer orders the burrata.
The pizza was good, it was unique that you had to cut your own piece but it was fun at the same time.
By the time we were done with our two hour meal, there were multiple tables that were still available and we could have sat at. Not allowing us to sit at a table felt like a strange choice since the restaurant was empty the entire night.
The atmosphere was pretty, and very aesthetically pleasing. I would probably go back to see if the service changed at all, but it seemed like a mismatch from the image they are presenting.

Came here for Happy Hour on a Friday around 4:30pm and it was pretty busy. We luckily got a seat at the bar as soon as we walked in. The host at the front wasn't the friendliest, but our server was great! She told us about the happy hour specials (house red and white for $8, aperol spritz for $8) and some appetizers for half off and a pepperoni pizza for $10. The pizza was delicious! It was on sourdough bread, had tons of pepperoni, and was huge! The aperol spritz was also really good.
We didn't try anything else but I will definitely be back to try more things on the menu!

Get the prosciutto and foccacia with the burrata! It is referred to as the holy Trinity. Loved the olive oil that soaked the food. I tried their highly recommended sausage pizza and it is on a thick bready crust. Seemed a bit on the too salty side for me even though I can eat a bag of cornnuts in one sitting. It is very cheesy though with a few pieces of sausage on it. The potato garlic scapes pizza was also salty and on a breast crust. I could only eat the potato which was the least salty of the pizza.

This place is decent. Aside from their cool location (inside of the Amazon Sphere), their menu wasn't super expansive and their HH is just okay. HH was 1/2 off on 4 appetizers and $15 for the pepperoni pizza. It's also a bit more on the pricey side and for the food they served - it wasn't entirely worth it.
Not to mention, our waiter wasn't very attentive. We had to ask him for a refill on water and crostini a couple of times before he remembered. He also forgot to ring in the focaccia bread so when we got our burrata, we didn't get a chance to eat it with the bread. He also cleared our calamari without asking if we were done with it and did not pick up our dirty plates. The host was much friendlier and attentive IMO.
Also note there is a 20% gratuity charge and the gratuity charge is added to the total... so they TAX you more off your total bill. I have never experienced the gratuity charge being a part of the total at any other establishment.. so this was indeed strange. Personally - I would have not mind paying the 20% gratuity if A) service was better B) the food was better.
My friends and I ordered a wide selection of food - focaccia, burrata, chicken liver pate, gnocchi fritti, calamari, scallop crudo, penn cove mussels, Salish Sea halibut, the Lumni Island flash fried shrimp, and the pepperoni pizza.
What I liked:
Pepperoni pizza, focaccia, burrata (although nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary), squid, scallop crudo, and the Salish Sea halibut.
Everything else was just sub par. The gnocchi in particular was a complete waste of money. It was just overly salty, lacked flavor and was dumped in Parmesan.
Most likely will not be making a return.

I'm giving this 5 stars because of the pepperoni pizza + decor. It's in the Spheres so that's a thing. The decor is magazine-worthy, and you can get some good IG moments here. You can make reservations on OpenTable, so that's convenient. So yeah. That's enough for 5 stars.
The people who work here are, like, *cool*. But to the guy's credit, we asked for wine recommendations to pair with the pizza, and he was knowledgable about their wines and gave a great recommendation.
We ordered burrata and focaccia to start. After a few moments the guy came back saying that they were out of burrata. We got there right when they opened. So that was whatever. We still got the focaccia and it was good. And with the burrata, I'm pretty sure it would have been amazing.
The pizza was perfection. I think it's called Sicilian style? The pepperoni was on point. So so good. They serve it traditionally where it isn't cut. And they give you scissors to cut it. So if you're trying to look cute on a date or something, be prepared to deal with that.
We ordered the pistachio ice cream with biscotti even though we were pretty full, and it was definitely not a mistake.
I'll definitely be back.

La vie en rose! My friend and I visited Willmott's Ghost after touring the nearby Spheres, as we saw that they had happy hour, just when we needed some fuel.
Like all of Renee Erickson's restaurants, there is always a particular color that gives off an aura of sophistication, yet is inviting. Here at Willmott's Ghost, it's rose-petal pink. Pink espresso machine, pink cocktails, pink flowers and gold accents all around. I dug it.
For cocktails my friend ordered The Rose Society while I went with Mr. Pink. We had seats right at the bar where the bartender was making all the magic, and most of the cocktails she made were pink, including the spritzer that was on happy hour. We also shared the fried gnocchi, which is one of the food items on happy hour. My Mr. Pink cocktail was nice, especially because I could taste the rhubarb-infused Campari, which is primarily why I ordered it. I love the sour flavor of rhubarb, which you definitely get from this drink. Since I don't like sweet drinks either, I was especially happy that this one was more on the sour side; and I say sour in a good way. The fried gnocchi was yummy! Texture of the gnocchi was perfect with a light crunchy batter, but soft in the middle from the pasta. I really liked that it was made with chilis, so had a spicy bite to it, not needing any kind of dip or sauce to go with. I'd recommend it. Menu is Italian-themed.
Though the A-frame sign outside of Willmott's Ghost reads that happy hour is from 4-6pm, it's actually 3-5pm. We were bummed to learn that our happy hour window when we arrived was cut shorter, but glad I know for next time. It is cool to visit Willmott's Ghost since it's in the spheres, as the windows are exactly that. I'd check it out, at least once...over a pink cocktail.

I3 stars for cute atmosphere. Horrible service. Went and four tables were there and plenty of staff. Took forever to get glass of wine and at least 25 mins between our apps and main course. Never came by to check in is in between or voice updates. Food was mediocre and overpriced. Maybe a good spot to grab a drink at the cute bar but that's the most I'll go back for.

The place is beautifully decorated. Lovely restaurant with great food, service, atmosphere. Varied Italian starters. I had Canneloni alla Fiorentina (ground veal) and my partner had the Spaghetti Carbonara.
The staff was very attentive and the owner checked in on us a few times during the evening to see how we were doing, this on a busy Sunday. The tiramisu dessert was delicious and authentic.
Definitely a repeat visit. The coffee following superb. The service was very good too.

Zio Sal is the nice higher-end Italian restaurant that REDMOND desperately needs and deserves. What it does well:
Anything sausage or pork or pesto related.
The atmosphere and decor are excellent.
The bar and wine list is fully stocked and great.
Where do they need to improve?
The chefs need to get on the same page for the pasta dishes.
The pizza needs to be removed from the menu altogether or have a page one Re-write.
They need another server OR two people whose only job is to bring out the food. The staff is simply stretched too thin.
The aroncini rice balls should be smaller so that there can be four at the table.
There needs to be a larger amount of bread at the table.
A simple kids menu is critical; we're a family suburb.
I know this seems like a lot, but this restaurant has the potential to be Carmine levels of great! It's a fantastic date place, it's walkable, and reasonably priced. As-is -it's still good, but it can become great. The restaurant is only 10 days old; therefore, it has time to become perfect.
Should you go? YES! This restaurant could become a true Redmond Gem. This is really critical because we have no Italian food for miles around!

Wow! The food is outstanding! I enjoyed every dish, every flavor. They are working out the kinks in being recently opened but don't let that stop you.
The staff is attentive. Water was refilled, plates were cleared, extra food was boxed without a glitch. The marinara is heaven! Beautiful notes of bright tomato with delicate seasoning, sausage that is robust and satisfying. The wine list is a beautiful representation of many regions of Italy.
It can be a bit loud but that is not so bad. I told my server how much I enjoyed the tastes and the chef was brought to my table. It was an honor to thank him for a lovely meal.

So excited to have authentic Italian food in Redmond!!!!!
From the atmosphere to the food to tHe people you will enjoy every aspect of eating here!!!!! Bring Family, Friends and Business here to enjoy the service and food!!!!

Looks like this place just opened... and wow! This is what Redmond needed. The atmosphere when you walk in is calm, inviting, and modern. Menu has fantastic choices and honestly wish I could try everything. Specials were written on a large chalkboard above the kitchen so definitely give that a look.
We picked up an order of calamari, manicotti, and a slice of pizza to share between the two of us. Food came out fast but in fairness it was relatively slow at the moment inside. First up, the calamari is perfect. A large serving of crispy calamari with an awesome sauce on the side. It can be difficult to find something comparable in Redmond so if you like calamari definitely give this a try.
The manicotti was the star dish though. Two tubes stuffed to the brim with a perfect ricotta mixture filling it. The sauce was better than anything I've had in the area with everything perfectly cooked. Compared to nearby Tropea who burned their manicotti that I had to scrape off the plate, Sal's was heavenly. I can't wait to try more pastas.
The pizza was pretty good but definitely paled in comparison to the other two dishes. Perfectly fine since it seems to be more of a side menu item or perhaps for the bar being priced effectively. I'm just a pizza dork and had to get it.
Dessert we tried their cannoli and this was impressive! My girlfriend loves cannoli and even makes them at home. Hers are good but these are great. I generally don't like cannoli but could easily down this.
Top it all off with great and friendly people and you've got a fantastic resteraunt.
Small side note, I don't understand that one negative review in regards to portion size. We didnt order too much and were struggling to finish it all despite being so good. If somebody wants to stuff their face, feel free to buy some big box fast food crap if you want. Here, you'll get a quality and hearty meal for a fair price. We can't wait to go back.

We stopped by due to a recommendation from someone in the business and were not disappointed. We had the ravioli and Bolognese and it was delicious. Great prices. Perfectly cooked pasta. The wine list is good and with prices that will entice you to have more than one glass. We shared a tiramisu and it was excellent. Not too much coffee or a soggy cookie. So good. You've got to go and experience it for yourself.

I've been going to Seattle for business for quite a while now, and every trip i take I make sure to eat Italian. I've been to numerous spots trying to find my favorite. My hunt stopped tonight. I absolutely loved the food! The fulissi and lemon cheesecake were amazing! I recommend everyone eat here if you're looking for some authentic Italian.
Great service as well! Never had to ask for a refill.
Fabulous new Italian restaurant. Great happy hour and employees. Places does get busy so show up early.

I have been here twice, and there are some great things about this place. The servers are nice but they're stretched too thin. The pesto was great, but the tortellini with cream sauce was nothing special. The pizza is not good. It's focaccia with marinara sauce and not nearly enough cheese. Totally out of place on the menu. And it was cold. The aroncini (sp) came with just one ball to split between the 4 of us. The free focaccia was also meager. The pork chop with Marsala sauce was amazing. I'll go back, for sure, but they have some tweaking to do.

Stopped by on a quiet Sunday evening and enjoyed a quality meal. Great selection of wine, too (tried the Chianti Classico Riserva). Focaccia bread was made in-house and delicious. Green salad with salami and provolone was well dressed, followed by spaghetti bolognese. Food is really well prepared and they clearly use high quality ingredients. Definitely recommend!

I'm the owner of Zio Sal - my name is Salvatore Lembo and also the founder and owner of Firenze Ristorante in Bellevue for 27 years . I'm very proud of my restaurants and I want answer to Caren about her bad review.
We are open for just a week and you ordered something out of the menu - yes my people made a mistake not adding the chicken but you could easily ask again. Any new restaurant may have some issues at the very beginning and thank god most people understand and give a chance plus support at any new activity.
Yes I agree at Maggiano you bet much more food for the same money.... If eating it's about quantity Maggiano is the place to go.
I want wish a fabulous weekend to everybody and please come to celebrate with us if you have a chance.
God bless you all!!!
Zio Sal
Love it, Salvatore!! Glad you will be closer so we can be frequent patrons!!! A winner!
My new favorite Italian spot in Redmond, great food and service and outstanding wines!

Alright y'all I rarely and I i mean rarely do I leave reviews but I felt this place deserved one. This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to on the west coast! I was visiting a friend in Seattle and we decided to stop by as it was a nearly opened spot and decided to give it a try. The atmosphere aside from the food is a reason to stop in. The food is some of the best looking and delightfully tasting I've had in some time! Val who I believe is a server/manager was so amazing she made the experience worth while! If you ever find yourself in Redmond, WA definitely give this place a go. Prices are great, service is even better, trust me you won't be disappointed!

Great addition to the Redmond restaurant scene - it needed a quality Italian restaurant!! Here it is....love it! Been here three times in the first couple weeks. It's nice not having to drive to Bellevue for great cozy Italian. Love the three tv screens too!
Have enjoyed a spectacular Marsala Pork Chop with Aglio e Olio - spaghetti carbonara! - pizza and lasagne over my three visits.
Everyone also very pleasant - especially manager Valentina who has greeted us on each visit.
We'll definitely be back soon!

My new favorite spot in Redmond. Beautiful ambiance and amazing food to match. Valentina was wonderful and explained the story of the restaurant. Her father Salvatore moved here from Italy and opened their first restaurant "Firenze". They get fresh food flown in from Italy, so it is REALLY authentic italian cuisine. I will absolutely be back, what a wonderful experience.

What a fantastic Friday night experience! My husband and I stumbled upon a new Italian restaurant, Zia Sal at RTC in Redmond. They just opened 2 weeks ago. We shared a fantastic evening together thanks to our fantastic server Lea; since place is new we followed her recommendations and tried two of the specials. They both had very romantic Italian names that I can't remember, but my husbands was a ribeye with mushrooms, potatoes and vegetables, mine was chicken piccata style, and we shared a spaghetti with saffron and lobster tails. For dessert we had pisashio cheesecake; it was so delicious! I highly recommend this new place in Redmond. We really needed another choice besides our regular standbys RGB and Prime.

I came here with no expectations. The wine pours were small (maybe too big of a wine glass). I ordered one dish, but something else came out. The waitress was confused but accommodating. It took a few minutes and my family was eating their main meal. Once she brought it, I could not eat it. It was fusilli with Marinara sauce and the pasta was completely overcooked. Not at all al dente. I sent it back. I'm Italian, lived in Italy and traveled extensively. I could not eat overcooked pasta. Perhaps it's opening kinks. I don't think I can go back. It was unforgivable.

We ate dinner at Zio Sal on Saturday night, and at 5:30 it wasn't too crowded yet. We were seated right away, and the server was very friendly and efficient. I had the Pollo Ripieno, my wife had the Pollo A Tuo Placere with limone sauce, and my son had the Spaghetti Bolognese. All were excellent and a very well priced. I also ordered a cup of Minestrone and a hazy IPA, which were also excellent. The only things that could be improved were the food took quite a while to be served, and the spaghetti portion was a little small, perhaps a larger option should also be offered. Overall, Zio Sal is a very welcome addition to the limited offerings of quality Italian food on the eastside. We plan to return often.

Went to this place on a spur-of-the-moment after walking by in Redmond TC. The food was amazing the ambiance was relaxing and staff was so polite and pleasant! My random hunger has led me to a new favorite place. So excited!!!!
I love this place. The food is amazing. My favorite here is the beef taretare. The service is friendly and welcoming. Definitely give it a try.

Excellent food! Try their fried dates. They are really good.
You can feel all the spices there and how the chef balanced them perfectly.
I don't give 5 starts because our table was not somehow spacious. A little bit tiny in the middle of others.

Entrance was a bit odd because there was outdoor seating near the stairs, but you'd have to walk past the tables to enter the restaurant. Staff was friendly and food was good!
FALAFEL SALAD $18 (5/5): highly recommend this dish! Super flavorful and everything in it tied well together.
CICCHETTI (4/5): we ordered the 3 for $16, and the 3 we ordered were the dates, beef tartare and pomegranate muhamma. The pomegranate is like a sweeter hummus and comes with flatbread. Beef tartare was ok; I didn't think it was super flavorful or anything special. The dates were super good; filled with chorizo, a great mix of savory and sweet. I would recommend the Cicchetti to share!
Sharing the falafel salad and Cicchetti was enough for two. I would recommend this place!

Our Eastlake go-to for delicious small plates, excellent cocktails, awesome late-night menu.
The cicchetti (small plates) are super tasty and addicting - have frequently enjoyed and highly recommend:
Wood-fired halloumi and olives - SO GOOD
Pomegranate muhammara - flavorful
Beef tartare - a lovely treat
Hummus, grilled pita - simple perfection
Smoked mussel escabèche - wonderfully smoked flavor, not overdone
Confit chicken wings and their flatbreads fresh out of the wood-fired oven are also quite tasty.
Lovely ambiance - great for date night or small groups. The staff here keep us coming back - bartender Tyler makes delicious cocktails with your spirit of choice, large cocktail list to enjoy. Jerry has been our server on numerous occasions and always makes us feel at home.
Daily happy hour runs Tuesday-Saturday 5-6:30pm, featuring large plates for $9-$12 including pizzas, kefta burger, wings, falafel, as well as a Cicchetti trio for $14. Drink specials include house wines (red, white, cava) for $6, drafts $2 off, wells $5.50, house cocktails $7.50.

Best date night venue in Seattle. Ha ha. I don't even like dates but their date small plate is awesome. What are dates anyway, a big raisin or small prune? LOL
We sat at the bar for Happy Hour and had almost everything on HH menu and everything was fabulous. Would have rated it a 5 star but the small plates are really small and pricey for what you get. Check it out.

Was pleasantly surprised at how awesome the food and space was! Tucked away in a quiet corner of Eastlake, this place has a ton of interesting menu offerings and a cozy interior.
My buddy and I tried some of Cicchetti apps, including the brussels, dolmas, and muhumarra. These were all fantastic, particularly the maple yogurt that adorned the sprouts.
For our mains we shared the brick chicken and the falafel. The chicken skin was beautifully crisp and perfectly cooked throughout. The charred leeks and potatoes bravas side dishes were also quite tasty. The falafel were good, but have had better elsewhere in the city.
Our server was great as well. Will be back, hopefully with a date.

Such a cute little place with outdoor seating and the inside is great as well. We sat inside and it wasn't that crowded so we had our own little room off to the side which was nice. Got the toscana red wine as well, where a bottle was nice to split for the entire meal. The trio of small plates was so good and although it doesn't look like a lot it's pretty filling. The dates were my favorite and would totally get them next time as well and try new things for the other two choices if I'm feeling adventurous. There's something for everyone on the menu and although a little pricey, the food and ambiance was completely worth it!
It's so great to have this in the Eastlake neighborhood. The cocktails are fantastic and the food is innovative.

WOW! I have a new favorite Mediterranean place! Cannot say enough good things about this place. The hostess and servers were friendly and accommodating. We ordered the Kofeta burger and 3 Cicchetti apps, my tastebuds were on a roller coasters, couldn't decide which was the best. I definitely see myself coming back.

A lovely little place. The restaurant is pretty small with limited seating. It's situated inside what appears to be a converted residential house. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. The ambiance was casual yet mature. The lighting was very dim with various interesting light fixture designs. I recommend sticking to the cicchetti portion of the menu & their drinks (especially wine) menu. Everything I tried from cicchetti menu was flavorful, fresh, and delicious in their own way. The entree was mediocre. I had a daily special: tagliolini with pork cheeks. The spices/flavors were not to my taste - strong peppercorn taste and not very complementary cashew bits. Some of the tagliolini was clumped & hardened together at the ends. I would be willing to give this place another try though for the cicchetti and drinks only next time.

Alex was our server, and he made the experience great for us. He was very knowledgeable about the food - he was well-acquainted with every ingredient and answered all our questions. He described the dishes accurately and we liked our food. It was Seattle Restaurant Week, and we went with the special 3-course dinner. We also added a "Cicchetti", I.e. small plate appetizer. This was a great value financially,
The food was presented well. My wife had the fattoush salad. I started with the cod tamasalata - these dish names are from memory & I know I'm not getting them correct. My wife loved the crispy Brussels sprouts. I loved the prawn skewers with polenta and asparagus. My wife enjoyed her spaghetti genovese. Delicious chocolate semifreddo & I had strawberry rhubarb mousse & enjoyed it.
Found a parking space close by in the street. Loved the ambience. Kind of a vintage feel.

My boyfriend and I stumbled on this restaurant because we wanted to eat some Greek/Mediterranean food. Who knew this great restaurant is tucked behind the popular Italian restaurant, Serafina?
The restaurant does have a front patio which I can see being very popular in Summer. They have happy hour Tuesday - Saturday. We ordered various of dishes such as their pizza of the day,Cicchetti Trio, and their dish of the day. We really enjoyed every dish. It was executed well as everything was pretty flavorful, and tasted fresh.
I also thought the service was superb. The server checked up on us a few times and there was another server that made sure our waters were full and took away dishes when we were done. Everyone was pretty friendly as well.
This place is a great for a date night or intimate dinner with friends/family.

This place is awesome!
Three of us went to this place last night during Seattle Restaurant Week. We picked the restaurant because the menu looks really good and it's really close by.
The entrance is a bit hidden. It's not directly on Eastlake, it's behind the next door restaurant on a side street. But once you found the sign everything was smooth.
We were seated at a table beside the window on the second floor ( you will need to climb a few stairs). We ordered all three options of the appetizers and the desserts, and for entree we all picked lamb shoulder. The result was wonderful! The overall taste was excellent, especially the lamb shoulder and one of the desserts we had (see picture). It's a cracker with artisanal Brie cheese and house jam. It sounds generic but it's so good! So good that we had to order one extra lol
We didn't pay attention to the regular price of meh items, but we think for $35 the food we had was totally worth it. Worth to mention they do automatically add a 3% subcharge for the back kitchen staff. No tips were added automatically.

Do yourself a favor and spend an evening dining at this restaurant. There is a lovely outdoor dining area and the inside is equally as nice. I recommend he "tapas" style food as it makes for a lovely communal dining experience, not to mention that I drool just thinking about the dishes I ate there. The food was expertly prepared, creative, and mouthwateringly good. I found the staff to be friendly and attentive and I never felt rushed. This is a great place to come have a meal with friends and make a whole evening of it. Highly recommend!

Seattle Restaurant Week Spring 2019. I've been wanting to eat here ever since it opened many years ago. This cute little place packs in a lot of tables and people without feeling too crowded. And the ambiance is unassuming, intimate, and perfect for a date night or a meet up with friends. The menu triggers all my good memories of small Mediterranean small plates during my travels. We ordered a starter plate off the main menu: wood fire roasted dates stuffed with chorizo in a pimiento aioli, but then went for the SRW menu after that. For me: fattoush with gem lettuce, cucumber, red onion, bell pepper, and tahini yogurt dressing; rosemary prawn skewers with creamy polenta, black garlic aioli, charred asparagus, and romesco (one of my favorite SRW dishes); and for dessert artisanal brie, berry compote, and poppy seed lavosh. Hubby had the smoked cod taramasalata with charred scallion, lemon oil, Aleppo, and crisp pita; spaghetti Genovese with arugula-walnut pesto, spring onion, green bean and pecorino; and for dessert chocolate semifreddo, salted caramel, peanut butter, peanut cookie, and candied peanuts. We are so full and very pleased with the meal. Can't wait to come back and order their entire starter menu!

The food was exotic, ambience was romantic, and the staff were nice and friendly.
We ordered the lamb dolmas, wood fire dates and wood fire halloumi. The halloumi was a very nice surprise, with fantastic olives, I didn't know I could love olives this much.

Amazing food and great service. A nice place for a date night. We will be back! The appetizers are amazing. I recommend giving multiple a try as they are designed to be small plates. The selection for the main dishes at dinner are small, but I've always believed that's a good sign. Still, for how small the menu is, it certainly covers a wide variety of foods on based on the Mediterranean style. Like I said, we'll be back.

A fabulous dinner for my birthday! Phenomenal food and even better service. Each course was special, loved the small plates and the lamb was delicious! Thomas, our server, was awesome, great recommendations and very personable, a great addition to the already great food! We already plan on coming back for my next birthday.

So pleased by this place. Finally something in Seattle that serves good Mediterranean/middle eastern-ish cuisine. Well by finally I mean they have been here for a while but it took forever for me to check it out haha. The cicchetti dishes are all amazing sounding and quite tasty. I very much enjoyed the muhammara. Only complaint is it comes with just a few pita chips and if you want more they will charge for these (oh and they won't tell you this... you just find it on your bill later... just a little surprise for you haha). The falafels are to die for. Perfectly cooked with a crispy exterior and soft center and the feta yogurt and cucumbers they are served with in phenomenal. They also do an excellent lamb dish. They have a nice patio area outside which is lovely on a warm day.

One of my favorite HH places north of DT. Just off eastlake. Had lamb and seafood paella. Both dishes amazing. Seafood on top of squid ink rice was incredible. Excellent service to boot. I only wish their HH pizza was on the dinner menu.

This is a wonderful and cozy family run Greek Italian restaurant. Very friendly and welcoming servers make you feel at home. My favorite is the Hylopetes Greek Pasta while my wife always gets the Lasagna. They have different specials daily that are not on the menu but definitely must try. Speaking of which, the menu is short but that's a good thing because what's there are all good.
Ummm. Ordered a Greek Salad. There were ice cubes and a "broth" at the bottom of the plate. The waitress said they like to keep the plates cold.....

This is one of the top three pizza places I've ever been! Lots of toppings, lots of cheese, and everything is so hot and fresh! I usually pick one up to bring home, and I have to eat a piece as soon as I get in the car. Their pasta and salad is also delicious, especially the pesto tortellini!

Just wrapped up our first visit to this place and am extremely pleased. Good old fashioned American-Italian! I can report that both the canneloni and the ravioli are delicious. I can also report that there is PLENTY of spumoni in one order to share! We'll be back!

This is my uncles restaurant it's amazing!!! Please eat here all the food is amazing!! Amazing service amazing food and amazing prices!!! It can't get any better!!!! If I could I would give this restaurant 100000000 stars

I have put off writing a review of this place for years because I don't want anyone else to know about it. It's our favorite restaurant on the north side of Seattle.
