I've been twice - I had low expectations if I'm being transparent. I think the photo being used for the "background" of the yelp is a bit misleading. That being said I was pleasantly surprised by my experience!
I will say my initial experience is what really surprised me - fast service and delicious, affordable food! Second experience very meh but still good. It appears to be locally owned, with a lax staff. Which is nice. My parties had a few awkward moments with the staff - perhaps because we are still new to the area / are especially new to this restaurant. I personally have ordered the same pasta both experiences, blush sauce pasta with a salad and bread. Totally worth the price. That being said second time around I thought, maybe it's just good cause I don't eat pasta at all - and while I am definitely going to be back (bc yum!) I've made easily comparable meals with minimal effort. Don't mean it isn't good, just means I'll pick this place over my own work if 1) I don't wanna cook 2) I wanna go out. That being said it 100% is the best pasta I've had so far around (I haven't been to the fancier joints around - just the usual family style Italian places, aka all the pasta prices are about the same - 10-15$).

Very casual place with a very friendly service. We had chicken wings and pastas. It tasted fine. Seems like a fine place to eat if you are too lazy to cook yourself. I wouldn't go here if you are looking for a very nice and special lunch or dinner.

I've been ordering pizzas about once a week for the past year and a half and while it's convenient, I've gotten to the point where the carry-out orders have been wonky enough on a monthly basis that I'm done. Last night was the last straw; once again, they didn't care that the order had been screwed up and I didn't have enough time to have the pizza remade. Just shrugged and took my card.
My favorite moment remains the time a couple of months ago when I called on the phone to order, got put on hold for 15 minutes, got tired of being on hold and walked down to order with my phone still with me, ordered at the counter, and waited and got my pizza, still able to see the light blinking on the phone to show I was on hold. In all fairness, it was a Friday evening and they were fairly busy.
FWIW, they are always friendly and customers in the restaurant always seem to be having a good time. I would avoid takeout, however. The food is not tasty enough to outweigh the unreliability.

Came across this place while looking for something else. Pasta sounded good and we were not disappointed! The lasagna was very good and served up hot, even after taking it to go. Friendly and helpful staff too. I'm glad we stopped by!

It's an "all right' pizza place. Inside it seems geared toward families..
With the pizza, the crust leaves a lot to be desired in my opinion. It's kind of crunchy nothingness; no real taste. And I'm a total crust-lover (I never understand how people leave good pizza crusts on their plate!) so this was disappointing.
Also, *do not* get parmesan on your pizza when they offer! I thought they meant a sprinkling of some parmesan cheese like your mom used to do... no, it's a complete thick layer that you cannot remove as you eat (see picture).

This is our most favorite restaurant ever, we have been coming here for seven years now and never plan to stop. All of the wait staff is amazing but Sue and Eleni are the best. They treat us like family and we have never had a bad experience here. We highly recommend coming here. BEST PLACE EVER! Good food, good beer and even better company. We love this place.

2 stars instead of 1 because the server wasn't terrible but everything else just did not impress me. The meat balls were physically nice but tasteless, the salads were OK but the pizza not so much, I asked for light cheese which I think they just ignored, the toppings were fine but the dough was mediocre, Zeeks has much better thick crust pizza and Credo for thin crust. The wine is one of the smallest pours I have ever seen and was delivered in thimble size glasses ($7.50 for 4oz) and to add insult to injury, a woman vacuumed all around us while we were eating, so all in all I have no reason to return.

We didn't have pizza or pasta, so this review might be useless. We had a sub, an order of wings and a salad and all were really good!
The only negative thing about any of our food was that it was all on the salty side but still quite good. The chicken on my doo-dah salad was so tender and nicely seasoned.
I like the decor and the wait staff were very nice and professional. They might need another server, though, because the single one they had was very very busy and we had to wait a LONG time for the check. We're really looking forward to going back and trying the pizza and some pasta.

Went to Spiro's for a birthday dinner.
The food was great, love the pizza.
The service could have been better, forgotten drinks, and a few times being completely ignored by the staff when trying to get there attention.
Will probably go back as the Pizza is worth it.

I've had the fortune of the Olive Garden Pasta Pass twice now and this is my closest go to location for literally dozens of visits. My favorite of Neverending Pasta is fettuccine with meat sauce and shrimp fritta. I usually just get spaghetti with meat sauce with sausage and meatball combo as my second order and take it home for breakfast. I alternate between the house salad and the chicken gnocchi soup.
Food is always fresh and tasty. Service is great.

Came here for lunch on MLK day. The restaurant was full for a mid day, but some I am sure some people like me had Monday off. I will say the restaurant was run by mostly young (high school/early college) employees. Service was good, they were attentive to customers.
My big complaint was that the wine glasses that were on the clean table were clearly dirty and even so with the empty clean table next to us had the same thing.
As for food I ordered the seafood fettuccini which was okay, I didnt think the sauce was as thick and flavorful as I was hoping for but the mojito I ordered was great. I also liked the $5 lunch to take home. Overall I think it's a little pricy for the quality of entree but I love the bread and zuppa Toscana soup.

1.5 stars
*any of the soups 1/5
*salad 4/5
*bread sticks 4/5
*chicken parm 2/5
*deep fried ravioli 1/5
*spaghetti 2.5/5
*4 cheese penny Pasta 3.5/5
-my meal came with unlimited soup. They all tasted like they have been sitting out for a while and the meat in the noodle soup that looks like tomato soup tasted like really poor quality.
-definitely have the salad. Was extremely surprised to have a good salad here. A little heavy on the dressing but still good.
-breadsticks as everybody knows are great here and are always the same. They can't mess this one up.
-The chicken Parmesan was over cooked garbage. inedible and horrible.
-The deep fried ravioli tasted like it had been fried three times over. More fried than anything else. Also inedible.
-The spaghetti was OK but it would be better fresh. I could make better spaghetti at home.
-The four cheese Penny pasta it was the meal I got to take home for five dollars. it was worth getting.
dont go here, food is not good. also expensive $15-$19 per person.

uh.. I'm not a fan, but the kids like it, they have a lot of value and vegetarian options so we go a lot. I usually get their chili soup or minestrone.. it's the P.F. Chang's of Italian food.. need I say more?

Ate Dinner tonight at Olive Garden in Kirkland. The food was excellent. I had the Cheese Ravioli topped with shrimp in an Alfredo sauce.
Our waiter was professional, courteous and great attention to detail!! His name was Giavoni. You need to ask for him when visiting this location!!
Thx again for a great dining experience!

Have come here at various times in the last few years, experiences have always differed.
Pros: never had to wait too long, staff have always been nice to me (unlike others reviews, I seem to be lucky!), if there have been issues, staff have resolved them for me, and politely!
Cons: Food is lukewarm for some bizarre reason. Menu is expensive for a chain - that's not this locations fault though, as that is set at corporate level! I think because salad/breadsticks are part of the meal, they up the prices to cover this "complimentary" service.
Overall, this location has good amount of parking, sometimes the outside can be dirty, which isn't ideal when entering a restaurant. Food doesn't look appetizing, but taste isn't the worst. They try really hard, and can see that in the manager feedback too. Consistency depends on when you go, it needs to be consistent more regularly though!

I love Olive Garden Italian Restaurant. Our waiter was awesome which us cool because we had a large group. He offered us free wine and bread which is a plus and our food came quickly. Olive Garden never disappoints me... I just wish we had one in Hawaii

Had a great server this weekend in the bar area of the restaurant, his name Logan! Totally impressed from start to finish. I never had to remind him of anything. We've been coming to this OG for years and Logan best server we've ever had!! Unfortunately I came up short on the tip but hopefully this review will help out! Thanks Logan!

Whenever we come in we always have a fantastic service but today when my family and I came in, it was the worst service ever. As we get seated the server didn't look like he knew what he was doing, never got our breadsticks with our salad, never checked on us, our water was empty and never bothered to come by and check if we needed more water. We would ask for more bread and salad and it didn't come until we were done with all our food. We didn't even enjoy the food because of how bad the service was, very disappointed. Because the server was taking forever we just payed with the little computer that's on the table and left without hesitation.

Super friendly service . But my pasta (creamy mushroom ravioli) was quite salty to my taste but it is , I understand, very subjective. So for their friendly service I am giving 3 stars (my son liked his food a lot by the way)

normal food good but not amazing terrible service the waitress has no experience because I ordered a Peroni beer and I took a different one, I asked for water and my food came first and much later the glasses with water arrived, the glass of my beer was broken, and the waitress told me, it's probably because the glass was hot and they put cold beer and it broke, then they serve cold beer in a hot glass? Then I kept eating and the waitress brought boxes and the bill, we felt that she wanted us to leave, when we still had our plates full of food but well for this I give a star to this restaurant

FALSE ADVERTISING! A friend was treating me to a birthday dinner. I saw a TV ad for $10.99 "Oven Baked Pastas" at Olive Garden, so we went there. We both ordered an oven baked pasta dinner, even though we didn't see the special listed on the menu - but, I trusted the TV ad. The bill came with the full price of $21.99 each. Neither the waitress nor the manager heard of the "special" or knew anything about it. The manager acquiesced, discounting the price to $19.99 each, when I showed him that was their normal price listed on their web site. The food and service were great, but I was embarrassed and disappointed because I tried to take it easy on my friend's generosity.

Very slow service! Soup seemed off and cold.
This is the worst Olive Garden I've ever been to.

I should have known better. First let me say the Host stand is staffed by mean girls. Little eye contact and kinda rude. And the ladies room was really neglected. When I mentioned it I got a canned response that made me think they hear this way too often. I should have left.
My waitress was fine if hurried, but my requests misfired. My martini with no vermouth was pretty watery and did have vermouth. I drank it as she seemed stressed. I ordered the eggplant parmigiana with angel hair rather than spaghetti and asked for very little salad. I think she tried to make a small salad but it was still too much. As for my entree: spaghetti all the way.
Beyond that, I should also remember that good Italian food is not likely there. Greasy and bland at the same time. I need some sort of a taser that stops me when about once a year I think to try try again.

Service is really good and environment is good as it's friendly family style. The foods come very quickly, but you could taste it is not just freshly made. The foods are pretty salty and it could be because I added too much cheese.
Note: Payment is self pay from the machine on the table.

So I'll start off by saying it's been at least 3 years since I've been to Olive Garden so I wasn't sure what to really expect not knowing if menu was changed or what changes have been made . There was no wait so we got seated immediately and Yaritza was our waitress . I'll say she did a great job , very attentive and always checking on us , and great with my kids as well. I can't stand when a server allows guests to sit with an empty cup while they are eating because duh we get thirsty while we eat haha. I needed a refill and it sat for maybe one minute and she brought another drink for me, I didn't even have to say anything !!
As far as the food goes , all 4 of us were happy with our meals, everything tasted great and we were pleasantly surprised the breadsticks were unlimited. The best place to go if you feel like carb loading !!! We probably won't be back for a while , and not because of anything bad , we just like to explore new places !

We were prompted to try this Olive Garden for their Veterans Day menu. Many businesses do a nice Veterans Day special or discount for active military and retired. Olive Garden offers a free meal off a special menu with a pretty nice selection. The husband apparently has better foresight than Professor Trelawney from HP and anticipated there might be a wait. He easily made reservations online and despite the hangry mob in the waiting room, we were seated upon arrival.
Our server was pleasant and attentive. They brought out the usual salad and kept off the croutons for me since I'm a no choice allergy member of the glutenisgross club. If an Olive Garden salad is something new to you, well then, the dressing is about its only redeeming quality and helps make the iceberg lettuce palatable. Their gf menu includes a gf pasta prepared in separate water and choice of marinara or meat sauce. There's not a lot of selection so I always go with the same meat sauce every time I find myself in an Olive Garden. It's mediocre but I definitely appreciate having a pasta option. The husband decided his free meal would be the chicken parm and overall found it to be nice and crispy and well prepared, but again there's just a mediocrity to this chain's sauces.
Our noms came out quickly despite it being a Sunday night and we were in and out in under an hour. I appreciated the kitchen's effort to keep me away from the glutens and we had a great server. We also always appreciate acknowledgment of our veterans and active duty military. Overall a solid Olive Garden location.

KEVIN A. THE SERVER!!!!!
He is probably the best server we have ever had. He had my boyfriend's soda refilled before he had taken a 4th sip. He was always there when we needed him without asking him for anything. We needed more soup. He somehow appeared. We needed more salad. He was there. I complained to my boyfriend how I only had one piece of gnocchi in my last two soups somehow I had eight pieces in my next bowl without telling him! He rocks.

Regret visiting Olive Garden (OG) with my family and friends. Firstly, the waitress was rude and disrespectful. We never expected such a bad experience from a reputable hospitality group. The food was okay. To our surprise, the waitress got our check within 10 minutes of serving the food and did not even care to ask if we needed deserts. This place needs some serious attention to training and supervision. Location: 124th St, Kirkland WA.

Food is good. Service is good. The ability of the hosts to adequately tell us how long our wait is/was is less than appealing! Way off! They had the audacity to suggest going elsewhere! Interesting! I'm convinced their gluten free rotini is cooked in water where gluten pasta is cooked in! Not good!

This place is so cute!
Family friendly & a cool hangout. Lot's of tv's to watch sports. We sat upstairs.
The fried chicken and biscuits (pepper gravy) was good. The cheesy grits were interesting. It had onions in it, which was odd. I probably wouldn't order the grits again.
Even the kid menu has peanut butter jelly biscuits. My baby cousin enjoyed his, he ate it all and wanted more.

I'm just going to write one thing.... Such poor service. My server Jonathan S took our order and not even coming once after. Wow... my wife needed to order some drink but could not get his attention at all. Since Serious Pie automatically charge 20% service fee, it is all about getting more people in and not caring about the service? I raised my hand several times to get his attention but failed. Provide some service if you are going to charge 20% fee! What a bad service.
Update - 1/15/2020
The service was bad, but Michael, the manager, reached out to me right away and addressed my concern. This is a sign of top notch restaurants. I'm sure I can expect a better service next time. Thank you.

This is one of my favorite restaurants for great pizza and biscuits. Neapolitan pizza & crispy on the outside with soft pillowy fluffy inside biscuits. Even though this is a larger spot, it does get really busy so be prepared if you come during peak hours. If you can sit upstairs, you might get lucky to get one of the few tables that overlook the kitchen and you can see a lot of their baking operations.
There are decent happy hour & lunch deals here, but there is no wrong time of the day for pizza! Their brunch is not to be meddled with either, as they have great shakshuka like bakes with their biscuits.
Overall, I'd highly recommend checking this spot out, and they have multiple locations in Seattle, except not all of them offer the same amazing biscuits.

2nd visit to Serious Pie. Ordered biscuit with arugula, tomato and egg. Additionally, wanted gravy on the side server was more than happy to oblige. The flavors of arugula, egg and tomato combined were divine. Absolutely no doubts about the ever famous biscuit and gravy! Flaky, delish and so fresh at the same time. The portions are more than enough for a person. The coffee seems ok, serious pie could improve on it. Else absolutely happy (again!) with serious pie.

Well we decided to try this location because we love the pizza and thought that we should try the biscuits as well. We are regular visitors to the Virginia St. location but were hoping for shorter wait times. We were seated without a delay and the staff was very friendly. We ordered the fried chicken biscuit, the biscuit with butternut squash (special), the hushpuppies and the bacon fries. None of it was particularly interesting and didn't really have much flavor. The hushpuppies have some spice and tend to overwhelm the more delicate profiles that might be there. I found the same with the chicken and the fries (potato cubes) were good but also lacked a significant savory flavor.
We will always come back for pizza but probably won't do the biscuits again. If you have a choice and this is your first visit, always go for pizza.

This place is awesome! I gladly go over my calorie intake just to eat here.
The menu has so many good things, but you can't go wrong with biscuits and gravy. Menu has really good descriptions so you know exactly what you're getting. Sadly didn't get to try the pizza but when I am in that area I will make sure to check it out.
Decor is industrial. Layout is designed for a practical and spacious seating area.
If you're not comfortable sitting with random strangers.. you will have to get over it. Trust me the food is worth the social awkwardness.
Service is fantastic!

Great place for lunch! Not too loud so you can have a normal conversation, and the ambience is easy going. The staff were nice and attentive and answered all of our questions to help us make a decision.
My friend got the salmon biscuit and she enjoyed it! I got the mushroom pizza and it was very good!
The pizzas are personal size which is nice if different people want to try different flavors!
I would recommend this place and will be coming back.

Love Serious Pie & Biscuit, and I'm going to miss it now that I'm no longer in Seattle! The pizza was so good, though a little pricey. The portion size is definitely good though, and we split one of the pizzas among 2-3 small girls and it was definitely filling and worth!
The service is also great and they were super accommodating with dietary restrictions, which made the experience even better :)
We also got a coconut cream pie as the dessert, which we honestly felt kind of iffy about (it was kind of all cream, not a lot of coconut -- tho to be fair it was good cream!)

Biscuits for breakfast and brunch is a great option, however, the quality and service is just not the same level as the original location on Virginia.
This location has much more seating and a full bar with many more beer options. But ultimately the food falls short and I am all about the food. The pizza crust is not as crispy all around, the flavors aren't as deep, the cheese isn't shaved as even and as generously as the original location.
Unfortunately, service also fell short. They were understaffed and things kept on getting forgotten. Whether it's utensils, drinks, menus there was something that was always a little off. After reading other reviews of this location it seems like this is a trend.
I really, really like Serious Pie and the original location has been around for ~20 years. After hearing there was a newer larger location with more food options I was excited to visit, however I was pretty disappointed.
If you want a great, great experience I would recommended making the trek to the original location for that clam, pork, lemon thyme pie.

My wife heard about this place from several friends so it was another stop on her list of must eats.... thankfully the last one :)
We initially ordered the Zach and the sweet fennel sausage pizza--- so we could try both a biscuit and a pie. My wife had a Coke and I had the House Gin & Tonic. However, while waiting for our order, my wife saw a pic of the ham hock/collared green biscuit and decided to order that as well.
The Zach was good. Nothing special but good. I liked the chicken the most in this dish. However, I think Biscuit Bitch had better biscuits, gravy, bacon, etc. The fennel sausage pizza was delicious. All the ingredients tasted fresh and the crust was amazing--- thin and crispy. The ham hock was amazing. I thought the whole dish was okay but my wife didn't care for the greens, and ended up eating the ham by itself. Further, the gin/tonic was decent. Lastly, portion size was pretty good. We ended up only eating the Zach and a third of the pizza and taking the rest of the pizza and the entire ham hock dish home for dinner.
While the food might get 4 stars, there's a couple things that irritate me. $15 for the Zach, $12 for the ham hock, and $10 for the gin were all overpriced. Secondly, as others noted, this restaurant automatically includes a 20% "service fee" in your bill, in lieu of a tip. While I'm not saying that our waiter didn't deserve 20%, I HATE that they don't tell you up front or in advance that that is included. I also feel that by doing that, you take the incentive away from the waiter/waitress to provide top notch service to each and every customer. If they know that the tip is already included, and the customer can't take that away, then why try at all?

Pizza and Biscuits restaurant on the corner of Westlake and Harrison. They have a ground floor with a bar, some seating and a counter serve area, and a loft for more seating. Went there during weekday lunch, and the place was busy. There was a wait for the normal tables, but there is a small self-serve area with high top tables that was open, so we took that. There is no table service in that area, so you have to order and grabthe food from the counter and get your own water and cutlery.
As the name indicates, the food is primarily biscuits and pizzas. I got the Zach, which is their signature biscuit sandwich that has fried chicken, fried egg, and bacon and smothered in gravy. The biscuit was prepared pretty quickly. It's a hearty biscuit sandwich with a good piece of fried chicken. The cost was $15, which is a bit pricey for just one biscuit with no sides. For $15 and counter serve, I was expecting the portion to be at least 50% larger. The same goes for the pizzas which are $20 for a personal sized pizza. While the biscuits were prepared quickly, the pizzas take more time to bake, and we waited 20+ minutes for a pizza that someone in my party ordered.

Came here for lunch and got the morel mushroom truffle pizza and it was amazing. The pizzas are on the smaller side and pretty expensive, but this one was worth it. If you are a big eater, one pizza might not fill you up. We also got the Margherita pizza which was good, nothing fancy.
Haven't tried the biscuits yet, but will be soon.

Took my granddaughter for pizza here. The selection on the menu did not appeal to a pre-tween which was not an issue because they will make a simple cheese or pepperoni pie for pickier than normal eaters.
Love the crust. Sauce was a tiny bit on the salty side but I did enjoy the pizza. Service was fast and friendly.
Had a healthy mixed greens salad to round out the meal.
I recommend this spot for a nice pizza pie and tasty beverage.

We had a great experience here. A group of us came down on a Sunday after the Submarine Birthday Ball.
The service was good, not great, but good enough. The food was delicious! I got the biscuit with peanut butter, honey and banana. Once again, I always go for the Elvis type items. It wasn't cheap honey and peanut butter, it was the good stuff and it made all the dif
We had a good time. Inside is beautiful. We sat at a big wooden table. There were 9 of us and we fit fine, and they fit us in without a problem.
If we are in the area again, we will for sure be going back and trying more of what their menu has to offer!

Came here for the biscuits and gravy and added the pork shoulder ham. I really enjoyed the dish. The biscuits were crispy, buttery and flaky. The ham was the highlight. Since it was pork shoulder it had that fall apart texture like carnitas. I felt the gravy was the weakest point of the dish. There was some seasoning that I wasn't crazy about. At $12 it was a bit pricey for a single biscuit, but not outrageous. I would definitely go back to try the other biscuit sandwiches.

My friend and I stopped by for a quick bite to eat.
We shared a pizza and we each got a pint of the draft beers that were available.
We had the pizza with the soft egg on top and it was perfect. The crust was crispy on the outside, chewy and soft on the inside.
The dough is done well!!!
Service was prompt and friendly but we did go at a quiet time.
I will stop by next time to try the biscuits.

Ok with over 1500 reviews and a four star rating I just had to try this place out. Plus its a pizza place, and not an ordinary one.
Let me start with the pizza my daughter ordered. Sweet fennel sausage, roasted peppers, provolone. This was a red sauce pizza with an excellent sausage, peppers and cheese. The crust is thin and crispy, all the ingredients are made in house and the flavors blended well.
For mine I ordered a less traditional pizza. Soft eggs*, smoked prosciutto, pecorino sardo, arugula. The soft Eggs were a little runny as expected and the local grown arugula was fresh and in abundance. If I have any complaint at all it would be that i would have liked more smoked prosciutto, however this was not a deal breaker. An outstanding choice.
Now my curiosity had me, I have sampled the pie, but what of the biscuit? These dishes are served in the day before 3pm. I must return......
So the following day I am sitting at the bar ordering "the Zach" with fried egg and bacon fried chicken, tabasco black pepper gravy.
OMG to die for... Let's start with the gravy, obviously scratch in house nice amount of pepper and just a touch of heat, not enough to destroy the palate but enough to enjoy the flavors. The fried chicken was boneless of course and was breaded perfectly with a breading that was flavorful and complemented the gravy. The biscuits were absolutely perfect.
Do yourself a favor arrive hungry. The service is a little slow but not unreasonable. This gives you the opportunity to sample the many top shelf beers they offer....

Stick to the pizza's here. Although, a bit on the pricier side, I did come back to try some of the other menu items. Last time i had the truffle mushroom pie, that was great! Equally tasty, the sweet fennel sausage pizza i had this time. The jalapenos added a nice kick.
The only knock i had for my second time here is that i got something other than pizza. Fried chicken and biscuit, drenched in gravy was bland. Chicken wasn't really seasoned, and the gravy just didn't have much going for it. Home fries... same.
Stick to the pizza and you're golden! Just don't go overboard. They're a bit pricey.

Full disclosure: I'm a born New Yorker, and my pizza expectations have never been met on the West Coast. I really had high hopes for Serious Pie, but the texture and flavor are off. The crust isn't quite chewy enough, and is often gritty throughout, instead of from a light cornmeal or semolina dusting on the bottom only. I don't like the salt sprinkled on the bread and toppings: it should be integrated into the components evenly. SP is among the better options in Seattle if you want pizza, but doesn't compare to an NYC pie.

I've been on a biscuits and gravy kick lately and I had an amazing fried chicken biscuit sandwich called "the Zack" when i visited. The biscuits are topped with the chicken, an egg, and bacon with gravy on top. It was a delicious sandwich and I couldn't finish the whole thing. I would also recommend adding aardvark sauce which they have on the tables for an extra kick.
The left side of the restaurant is open seating and you order at the counter, while the right side is a traditional sit down restaurant.
If you're looking for fast-casual biscuits and gravy, give it a try! They're well-known for pizza too so I will definitely be going back to try that.

They are SO nice here!!! The owners are very accommodating and want nothing more than to make their customers happy. If you're craving a crepe and some smiling faces, come here. Oh and the crepes were delicious.
Going to keep this place in mind for the rainy months!!!

Great spot to grab a coffee, a tasty panini, or a fantastic dessert. great service given by friendly people makes this spot a must visit.
The kale salad is amazing and tasty. The paninis have s nice thin crunch on the outside and tender on the inside. Veggie panini and Turkey panini was delicious.
The carrot cake and lemoncello cake is spot on. not over the top sweet, just right.
The dark chocolate mocha was great.
love this place.
I just had D best crepe! Ordered the Nutella one with some white chocolate and was soo delicious! I've tried their coffee before and it is as well ! Will be ordering in the future!

I stopped in on a whim on my way to a totally different restaurant and man, I made the right choice!
I had the Italian crepe (with pesto, goat cheese, red peppers, and prosciutto. It was delicious! The crepe was stretchy and perfect - the texture was spot on (often I find crepes too dry).
Every menu option (except dessert) comes gluten free - crepes, paninis, you name it! My husband has celiac disease and I'll definitely be returning with him in tow.

This is easily my favorite cafe in Capitol Hill. I stumbled in here one day a last year while hunting for a quick sandwich, and am so very glad I did. The food is delicious and is prepared quickly, but just as importantly, the owners (Katarina and her husband) are two of the nicest, sweetest, and most friendly people I have ever met. There's limited space to eat inside, so plan to get your food to go! My favorite sandwich is hands-down the Turkey Pastrami Panini, although I have also fallen victim to the Spinach Delish Crepe or the Breakfast bagel. If you're eyeing up something sweet, I highly recommend the Nutella Crepe or Carrot Cake, as well as a quintessential go-to Chai Latte.
Do yourself a favor and check out Capital D cafe the next time you're around 15th - you will NOT regret it.
Best coffee in the neighborhood! The owners are so nice and will custom make a drink or food to your liking. A great place for breakfast and lunch!

I really like this place! I've stopped by a couple times before appointments for coffee, and ended up getting food. So tasty! They prepare your salad from scratch right there. The lox bagel I had today was marvelous...toasted on the panini maker, which also flattened it enough to make it easy to eat! NOM.

Ordered takeout from here which was a Medium size half Italian Sausage and Veggie and half Chicken & Goat Cheese Pizza.
I placed the order over Slice app and the pizza was ready for pickup 40 min later. It was pretty hot by the time I arrived home and tasted fresh. I liked both the flavors but the sausage+veggie was better of the two. The pizza had a decent quantity of cheese and the crust wasnt dry. It wasnt super oily either and the quantity was decent; we had couple of slices leftover after 2 folks eating.
I'll be back to try out other pizza flavors as well as test their pastas.

Ordered here from Slice. Ordered half sausage anchovy and half pepperoni, as I always do when trying a new place if they allow half orders as a baseline to see how I like the pizza. First time I was given artichokes instead of anchovy, pretty disappointing but oh well, the restaurant apologized, offered 25%off a future order and Slice offered $7 credit. So far just fine, nobody's perfect. Next day I figure I'll give them a shot at redemption while using up the discount and credit since it's a cheat weekend on keto for me so I didnt want to wait forever to use those up and wanted to give Modena a chance to make good on their error. This time the pizza was NOT EVEN CLOSE to what I ordered. As you can see in the photo, this time "half sausage anchovy half pepperoni" (input using the guide on the app that clearly shows which half to put toppings on and everything) translated to a full pizza of "sausage, pepperoni, mushy Canadian bacon and white sauce". This time they offered me a 10% discount on a future order...??? Like why the hell would I come back again after twice failing in a row and offering less of a fix than the first time? Good joke, bad pizza, bad customer service. Slice, on the other hand, gave me another $10 off for anywhere I want to use it, certainly won't be at Modena!!

Ditched leftovers & caved into pizza on my day off. Was very pleased to find I didn't have to leave the house today... they have free delivery (grub hub). Got the Modena special... medium (just in case) to get free delivery. Left over pizza makes a hardy breakfast or lunch carb heavy earlier in the day. Added spinach which I was expecting a call for them to tell me how much extra it would be- they just added it which was a pleasant surprise.
‍ Didn't time how long it took, it estimated 35-45. Based on where I ended up in my Letterman Episode I'd say it came in 25 min.
Crust was yummy... not too thick and a little chewy just like I it. Very flavorful, great amount of toppings. Only thing I'd change is it being a little less greasy but it had lots of pork product so some grease to be expected.

Love love love this pizza ! I order through Grub Hub and get the Hawaiian and hot wings with ranch. Ever let time
I have ordered my food was perfect and on time delivery.
The crust is delicious and chewy for a normal pizza. Love this restaurant my friend and I are dreaming of our next order it was so good ....

Don't be fooled by the location of the restaurant and it's size. Walking in, we could already tell from the smell alone that this was going to be a fantastic dining experience. The owner of the restaurant was at the front desk and was very welcoming and helpful to us first timers. He walked us through the menu, and even had a laugh with us about how much food we ordered lol. They don't have servers at the restaurant but their kitchen staff doesn't make it seek that way - They cook, serve, and entertain. This family style restaurant will woo you over with their fresh ingredients and their tasty dishes. The first thing that arrived at our table was the salad. Very bright green veggies, paired with their light blue cheese dressing (they have other dressings of course). The taste set my appetite just right. We were so glad to find that our pizza would come shortly after as well as our pastas. They even gave us complimentary tiramisu which was just to die for. Thank you for such an amazing experience Modena!

This is my go-to location for deliveries. They do not have a delivery fee and have a $15 minimum, which is easily met with a medium pizza.
The only pizza I have tried from this location remains to be my favorite pizza in Seattle-- the Red Goat Pizza with red onions, red peppers, and goat cheese on regular crust and marinara. The flavors complement each other very well. This is an easy vegetarian option I order whenever I'm not feeling in the mood for meat. If I want to add a little more "substance" to the pizza, I add mushrooms (easy to do through the app).
I have branched out and tried a couple appetizer/side dishes to accompany my Red Goat pizza. The spicy garlic prawns are soooooooooo good. They have a nice kick and I usually put these on top of some freshly made linguine to divide into two meals. There's plenty of sauce to make this happen, and for that I am very appreciative. The cauliflower is ok. It was a bit bland for my taste but I still ate it, so yay veggies. Modena used to have a lobster ravioli as well and that was delicious. I didn't see it on the menu this last time I ordered, but hopeful it will come back.
Need to make my way into the physical location and check it out. As a delivery restaurant, Modena gets 5-stars and a monthly order from me!

Tried to call and order food and the person I talked to was completely unable to take my order over the phone. I wasn't sure if he was at a call center. He didn't seem to know what I was talking about when ordering pizza. P-i-z-z-a
Good pizza 1 st time to order from them would order again hot and on time drive was nice would xl mushroom pineapple and sausage thanks

Being nice here because the service was great but to describe my experience:
One bite (everybody knows the rules)
Very flavorful and tasty cheese
Which act as a perfect blanket
For the best salami and Canadian bacon I've ever had on a pizza
This is by far some of the best pizza I've ever had on the west coast
I would recommend this for an impressive dinner that is surprisingly quickly made and delivered for how much of a punch the pie packs.
Thanks for all the work and love you put in this, I am ordering again!
Owner was extremely rude. He actually said he does not have to be nice to customers and he does not like people. No wonder the place was empty.

TLDR: generous proportions.
Tip: Pasta comes with garlic bread and soup or salad. Half order of the garlic bread appetizer is 2 pieces vs 4 from a full order.
Small authentic Italian restaurant with mellow Italian music playing. Limited dining area--7 tables. Clean place. Most orders are to go.
Menu is all text. Sorry you visual folk--no pictures but the descriptions are ok.
Don't order too much especially if you get the pasta--it comes with garlic bread and soup or salad. The pasta proportions are pretty generous. Order it first and if you're still hungry, order more. Don't over order!
Service: wait to be seated, order at the table, leftovers will be boxed for you, check brought to table.
Italian Sausage Soup: a Soup of the day item. Sausage is homemade and has a delightful taste and spice. Tiny pastas in the clear broth are so satisfying to the palate. Perfect for warming up on a cold day!
Fettuccini Salmon: I love the capers! Salmon was a bit on the salty side but the fettuccine and sauce help counter it. The sauce is not too thick and is lightly flavored with garlic. I just wish there were more veggies.
Garlic bread: soft, light and fluffy with a slight outer crisp. Not too salty and has satisfying spices sprinkled on top.
Italian Sausage Pomodorini: Sausage is delicious and has a slight kick. The sauce is a bit on the tangy side--lots of tomato chunks. You might find yourself reaching for water or more bread with this one.
Tiramisu: homemade. Very light and fluffy! Not too sweet but enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. I kinda wished there was slightly more coffee flavor though. You know how when you eat tiramisu you can taste the individual layers as they hit your palate? This one, though it was tasty, had a more uniform taste--like the flavor soaked into the cake.

Real old world style pizza, thin fresh crust and great toppings. I stopped by for lunch - a slice and a beer $6.00, and I was so very glad I did! When they say a slice of pizza, they mean about a fifth of a whole pizza. Customer service is great! A real taste of Italy.
Great pizza quick delivery through Yelp and they even gave us a free bottle of wine for Christmas.

Nearly five months since my last visit, spontaneously revisited Modena this evening after a ten hour workday (8/21/17). I am happy to report this no frills spot has remained consistent, both food and service wise. When one seeks out friendly service, no nonsense cuisine at reasonable prices, this place nails it. And they honored my ancient $5 off coupon!
Person #1
House Red, $6
Gnocchi alla Gorgonzola w/ garlic bread, $9.95
Tiramisu, $4.95
Person #2
Orange Pelligrino, $1.95
Penne alla Gorgonzola w/ garlic bread, $10.95
Cheesecake, $4.95
Person #3
Lots of water
Penne alla Arrabiata w/ garlic bread, $14.95
Tiramisu, $4.95
First time to order this particular entree and this was spot on. Penne pasta with Italian sausage, red onion, red chili flakes, tomato cream, and garnished with shaved parmesan. Not heavy and has a spicy kick.
Tiramisu here is decent. It's not dry, not soggy, not overly boozy, not cloying, and a steal at nearly $5.
Pasta, pizza, calzones, salads, sandwiches, desserts...something for everyone at Modena's.

THIS IS IT. THIS IS THE PIZZA YOU'RE LOOKING FOR!!! Look man, I'm a college student. I eat a lot of pizza. I went to this place based off the pepperoni pizza reviews alone. Walked up, highly question my decisions based off of the exterior. I WAS WRONG. IT IS AMAZING. I'm literally writing this with a slice in my mouth. Best pizza in Seattle, hands down.

Fairly decent product. The cheese crust was very good. The pizza that came with the cheese inside the crust was a Brooklyn style. Which was nice. Not very thick and just the right thinness.
Toppings were a little sparse and not very evenly distributed. Rather kind of just tossed on to the pizza. Quality of the ingredients was average. Salad was fresh and good size.
Overall the experience was pretty good and will probably order again sometime.
Another great take-out spot. I wish you got more ravioli for your money (it's a smallish portion) but the flavor is there! They're always super nice and prompt.

Ordered a Hawaiian through Grub Hub with "lots of pineapple" the pizza arrived with hardly any pineapple. In fact, several pieces only had only one piece of pineapple. I called immediately and was told my next pizza would be free of charge. Two weeks later I try and make good on the offer and now they claim they were only giving me the topping for free.
Let me get this straight, I order a pizza with hardly any of the topping I paid for and now you'll send me that topping for free as long as I pay for another pizza? Thanks but no thanks. Bad pizza and worse customer service.
delayed review - got these takeout a few months ago and it was delicious. I think I had the extra cheese filling pepperoni and alfredo chicken pasta was good too. Very reasonably priced as well ;)

Well first Im going to tell you idiot moment, I blame it on being up since 4 am and then having to deal with snowfall...
I ordered from them through Grubhub. I accidentally gave them the wrong address. (I know i know). I called them after I realized it and they called their driver and he was STILL able to get it to me on time because I wasn't too far from the incorrect addy. That wouldn't happen with UberEats.. Ok now I ordered a pizza I think it was called Crispy Pepperoni - It's soo damn good! The sauce is very flavorful, the pepperoni is cooked to perfection. I love it. The pic doesnt do it justice. Theres a lot of pepperoni!!

This is a great go too, for a nice meal and good drink. They always have great desserts too!
A pretty decent happy hour menu.
I do miss the cocktails & design of the Tiger Tail. But they kept enough of the original build out.
I do wish they opened earlier and did brunch or lunch. The area is lacking things open before 4pm.

Three stars is a stretch for tonight, unfortunately.
The staff seemed overburdened. They were very slow to get to us but once they did, it wasn't a long wait for drinks or food.
And then we come to the food. We had two small plates: pesto cream gnocchi and cauliflower with romesco. The gnocchi was heavy, almost pasty, and clunky. The cauliflower was badly over-seasoned with salt, though the texture was pretty good. For dessert, coconut coriander rice pudding with pistachios. The portion was huge (like two cups) but the dish was also a miss. The rice was undercooked so the texture was less like pudding and more like pinhead oats.
Overall, I don't think we'll return.

This place was incredible. The smoked tuna toasts were so delicious (I wish every time I made a tuna sandwich it tasted as good as that smoked tuna) with a sweet pepper as a perfect touch on top. The roasted cauliflower was good and flavorful, though admittedly my least favorite item we tried. The pan seared tuna (daily market fish) was expensive at $32 but wow it was flavorful. The sauce on top was tangy, refreshing, and I just couldn't get enough, and the fish had a beautiful crisp to it. The dungeoness crab spaghetti with a lemon butter wine sauce -- wow. Decadent, rich, and delicious with a piece of roasted bread dipped into it. I'm excited to go back and try more. The service could've been a bit faster, but the waiter was friendly and had a lot on his plate (hah)
Update: They now do brunch too! Homemade sweet potato English muffins with their eggs Benedict. The lemongrass braised short rib with kimchi Benedict was stellar and the apple streusel oven baked French toast... wow. The portions are huge so bring a friend to split!

Mediocre food across the board: came with a larger group, and wasn't impressed by any of the apps or entrees. The gnocchi was especially disappointing for the price: the pesto was made with dried basil (yuck), and the dish as a whole was gummy. Desserts were unimpressive. Drinks were okay - the options are decent, and there's good wine to be had. This is a relatively easy spot to get into with a group of 5+, but I'd rather wait for a great meal elsewhere.
Great delicious breakfast. Several vegetarian options. I really liked the Ballard black beans. Yummy mix of squash and eggs in that one.

This is a super cute place! We stopped in for a drink and appetizer and were not disappointed.
The service was super friendly! The bartender was very welcoming and helpful with the menu.
We ordered a few drinks and the crab fitters. The fritters were perfectly fried and so tasty! A perfect app to share.
This place would be great for a date night! It's really cute and not too pricey. Oh, and I'm pretty sure a coupon popped up when I check in but we didn't use it. Check it out tho, if you come here.
We definitely want to come back for dinner soon!

Bit of a mixed bag here, though I'm glad to have given it a shot.
The plantain appetizer didn't have a lot of flavor, though the guacamole and salsa with them were quite good.
The burgers were fine.
The spinach and artichoke dip was very parmesan heavy with a side of well toasted bread.

Food was phenomenal! I got the ribs and the polenta was the best I have had. It melts softly in your mouth with some of the juice from the ribs. Came with a bit greens which compliments very well. Also had the manila clam, it was pretty delightful. Great attentive server paired with very comfortable vibe. Highly recommend!

Our server was so outstanding, I want to give her a 5 star rating! She was very knowledgeable and very patient in answering all our questions. She paced the meal well.
Unfortunately, only some of the food was great. The coq au vin and short ribs were delicious and well prepared. The fried chicken was wonderfully crispy and well-seasoned.
Some of the food was so-so. The red sauce for the meatballs was better than the meatballs themselves, which were too heavily seasoned with smoked paprika. None of us liked the meatballs, and yet scraped the last bit of sauce from the dish. The brussel sprouts (on the menu since day 1!) were tasty but extremely sweet. The would have been a better dessert than starter. The fries were crispy and hot, but we couldn't taste the black truffle at all. The Caesar salad had nice flavor, but the salt wasn't balanced between the fried capers, croutons, cheese and dressing (overly salty).
We will try it again, hoping the kitchen was having a bit of an off night.

Gathered with some pals here a few times now and its always been a wonderful experience. Last time I had the spinach salad with oranges and bacon and added a chicken breast, a winning salad! My favorite meal has been the fried chicken sandwich with a twist..switching out the fried for a juicy chicken breast! Honestly I talked about that sandwich the next day. Have something to talk about the next day and go here already!

This place reminds you of an old setting american style bar.Its a bit expensive for drinks and large plates but the food more than makes up for it. They have ciders on rotation and a large selection of wines and beers as well.
Being a vegetarian,we had the artichoke artisan dip and roasted cauliflower for appetizers. The artichoke was the tastiest dip ever ! The cauliflower was a bit soggy but it had a cuminy taste which was good.
My friends also had the shrimp tacos and the seafood spaghetti which they raved on about !
They also have desserts per seasonal changes, we had the lava cake and the lemon strawberry tart. I am a dark chocolate fan, so i loved it. The tart had a subtle sugar taste which suited me.
The service was gracious and couldnt be happier about it ! Will definitely head to this place more often.

We live in the neighborhood and walk by The Blue Glass all the time so we finally decided to try it. We are so happy we did. All the food was delicious. The meat was cooked to perfection and the app was just as great. It's not the cheapest place but Seattle in general is not. We walked away a little under $100. Two drinks, two meals and an app feeling satisfied. Service was excellent too and we sat at the bar cause the restaurant was packed.

Nice ambiance but the football game on 3 televisions that nobody appeared to be watching. I ordered the lamb shank and the meat was falling off the bone and juicy but flavorless. There was a bit of ground mint on top, but not a balancing of flavor, just a smack in the tongue of mint and lame lamb. The sweet potato, brussel sprout, etc... vegetable 'hash' was no hash but a medley of sorts and the flavor on the plate. I ended up eating each bite of lamb with brussel sprout halves to add flavor to meat.

Blue Glass is a great little spot for a glass of beer, wine or a cocktail. They also have a nice menu that is simple yet good offerings. Clams were delicious! Not much seating and def gets warm in the summer.

We ate there the week before Christmas ... it was very busy, and both the wait-staff and the kitchen were overwhelmed - and service was very slow as a result - I assume that isn't normal.
The southwest corn chowder was fabulous (a special, not on the regular menu). The Moroccan lamb was tasty and interesting, with golden raisins and a mix of flavors, and Israeli-style large grain cons-cous. The veggie burger was thick and tasty - we feared it might be simulated meat, but no, it was a proper veggie burger, and quite good. Their list of specialty cocktails is interesting - I had the anejo sour, which was good, if pricey. They also had a good selection of beers (the Seapine IPA on draft was my partner's pick).
All-in-all, we liked The Blue Glass - located downhill of Phinney Ridge on 65th, it's a neighborhood joint with some spizazz. It was a bit pricey ... not outrageous, but more than I would expect for that kind of restaurant.

Wow! Where to start, my husband and I stumbled in here super late a couple days before Christmas!
It's a super cozy little restaurant with a great vibe. There were no children in there which was a godsend! I'm not sure if it's a family restaurant or if it's more of an 'adult only' setting but it was great to eat a meal without having to hear people's children.
Food was 10/10! The short ribs were some of the best I've ever had.

This was always one of my favorite cozy dinner spots but now it's also my go to brunch spot! The lemongrass short rib kimchi Benedict was so decadent and flavorful. My friend and I also shared an apple streusel French toast and I was in sweet tooth heaven. The restaurant is 21+ which definitely made for a more peaceful brunch than you would usually experience

LOVE THIS PLACE My first experience with The Blue Glass was this summer, when I went in to grab drinks with friends. Our cocktails were great! And we tried the smoked tuna toasts with Mama Lil's Peppers. DELICIOUS! I was so happy to find myself there again with friends last Friday. I was encouraged to go for it! -and try the Braised Short Ribs with polenta and sautéed rapini. The ribs practically melted in my mouth! A wonderful dish! Of course I ordered the smoked tuna toasts appetizer again, had to! I took a bite of my friends' Moroccan Lamb and Albondigas, and was in heaven!
The atmosphere is warm, inviting, and intimate. You are set up to have a wonderful time chatting it up with your company. Perfect night out, highly recommend

My wife and I visited while vacationing in Ballard. It was a short, pleasant walk from our Airbnb. It had a great vibe inside - comfy and iconically picturesque at the same time.
The beer list was fairly extensive, and the beer tasted fresh.
We ordered pan fried brussels sprouts (awesome texture and perfectly cooked, but quite sweet - it could be a dessert), crab fritters (great flavor and super filling) as appetisers. For entrees, I had a Caesar salad with coho salmon (salad was meh and the fish was overcooked) and my wife had the pear arugula salad (good but nothing special).
They could have had an off night this particular Wednesday. Its got awesome ambiance, really good beer, but I would not recommend them for the food.

We hosted the rehearsal dinner for our wedding here in June. If you're in search of a restaurant to "buy out" for an evening that is a good fit for 50-ish people, definitely give The Blue Glass a look!
James at The Blue Glass worked with us to customize the night to meet our needs. The Blue Glass was flexible on menu and able to accommodate a variety of dietary constraints (including gluten-free and vegetarian). We ended up starting with buffet-style appetizers (Brussels sprouts and Dungeness crab fritters -- both a hit!) and then had plated entrees for the main course. We were able to give our guests the choice of three different entrees (lamb, salmon, and vegetarian risotto) which was great for accommodating various tastes. FYI they have beer, wine, and a full bar available, too.
Size-wise, the restaurant was a perfect fit for our group of 45-50. We filled it up nicely, and when it was time for a few toasts you could easily hear the speakers without needing microphones / audio equipment. (One less logistical item to worry about!) And since we had bought out the whole restaurant for the evening, there were no concerns about toasts disturbing other patrons!
The evening itself went off without a hitch. No delays, no food quality issues, and no worries for me and my partner! Afterwards, a number of guests commented on what a good spot it was for a rehearsal dinner. We would definitely host a rehearsal dinner here again: alas, for us, we hope that is a one-time sort of thing(!) -- so why don't you host yours here, instead?
